name: 5 Minute Pesto
instructions: Combine basil leaves, olive oil, pine nuts, nutritional yeast, garlic, salt, and black pepper in the bowl of a food processor, pulse until smooth.

name: 5-Ingredient Tofu Soup
instructions: Combine water and bouillon in a pot; bring to a boil. Boil until bouillon cubes have disintegrated fully.
Reduce heat, add scallions, and simmer for 30 seconds. Add kale and tofu, cook until kale has softened to desired texture, 3 to 5 minutes.

name: Agave-Lime Shrimp
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a small mixing bowl whisk together agave syrup and lime juice.
Melt butter in a 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute 30 seconds.
Add shrimp, season with salt and pepper, pour in agave and lime mixture. Spread shrimp out into an even layer.
Cook until pink and opaque on bottom, about 1 minute then flip and continue to cook until shrimp has cooked through, about 1 minute longer.
Sprinkle with lime zest. Serve immediately.

name: Air Fryer Baked Potatoes
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Rub potatoes with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and parsley. Place potatoes in the air fryer basket.
Cook in the preheated air fryer until potatoes are soft, 40 to 50 minutes, depending on potato size.
Slice potatoes lengthwise. Pinch both sides of each potato, using your hands and forcing potatoes to open up, until the fluffy insides come up.
Place 1 tablespoon of ghee into each potato.

name: Air Fryer Beef Taco Bowls
ingredientLines: 8 oz soft mini tortilla bowls (1 package)
instructions: Preheat your air fryer to 350°F for 3 minutes. Place the bowls into the air fryer. Air fry for 5-7 minutes or until the bowls are nice and crispy.

In non-stick skillet, add the onion, saute for 3-4 minutes. Add garlic and saute an additional 30 seconds. Finally add beef and cook for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the meat is cooked through.
Add drained tomatoes, chilis, chili powder and cumin. Cook 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until mixture has thickened and liquid has reduced, remove from heat.
Spread a good tablespoon of refried beans over bottom of each fried bowl. Add heaping serving of the beef mixture and enjoy.

name: Air Fryer Brussels Sprouts
ingredientLines: 10 oz Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved lengthwise
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 350°F.
Combine oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix well. Add Brussels sprouts and turn to coat.
Air fry for 5 minutes, shake the sprouts, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Transfer sprouts to a serving dish and sprinkle with balsamic vinegar; turn to coat.
Sprinkle with bacon.

name: Air Fryer Buttermilk Chicken
instructions: Combine buttermilk and hot sauce in a shallow dish, mix to combine.
Combine tapioca flour, ground garlic, and 1/2 black pepper in a resealable plastic bag and shake to combine.
Beat egg in a shallow bowl.
Mix flour, salt, brown sugar, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, oregano, and remaining black pepper in a gallon-sized resealable bag and shake to combine.
Dip chicken thighs into the prepared ingredients in the following order.
Buttermilk mixture, tapioca mixture, egg, and flour mixture, shaking off excess after each dipping.
Preheat an air fryer to 380°F.  Line the air fryer basket with parchment paper.
Place coated chicken thighs in batches into the air fryer basket and fry for 10 minutes.
Turn chicken thighs and fry until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, an additional 10 minutes.

name: Air Fryer Chicken Katsu
ingredientLines: 4 skinless, boneless chicken thighs, pounded to ½ inch thickness
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the air fryer to 400°F.
Season the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Place the flour, egg and panko crumbs into separate shallow dishes.
Coat the chicken breasts in flour, shaking off any excess. Dip them into the egg, and then press into the panko crumbs until well coated on both sides.
Place chicken in the hot air fryer, and cook 5 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Serve imemdiately.

name: Air Fryer Chicken Schnitzel
instructions: Place chicken thighs, 1 at a time, between 2 sheets of parchment paper and flatten with a mallet.
Combine bread crumbs, salt, and black pepper in a shallow bowl. Place flour in a separate shallow bowl and beaten egg in a third shallow bowl.
Dip chicken thighs first in flour, then in beaten egg, and finally coat with bread crumb mixture.
Preheat an air fryer to 375°F.
Place breaded thighs in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching, work in batches if necessary.

name: Air Fryer Egg Rolls
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat air fryer at 400°F.
In a large pot, bring 4 quarts of salted water to a boil. Add carrots, celery and cabbage and blanche for 2 minutes until slightly softened. Transfer to an ice bath.
Once cool enough to handle, drain and squeeze the veggies using a kitchen towel until all of the water is removed. Set aside.
In a small bowl combine hoisin, soy sauce and sesame oil.
In a large skillet over medium-high, heat oil. Add ginger, hemp seeds and garlic and cook, stirring, 30 seconds. Add the drained veggies, season and saute for 2 minutes.
Place an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface in a diamond shape. Spoon 2 tbsp of filling onto the bottom third of the wrapper.
Fold up bottom half and tightly fold in sides. Gently roll, then seal fold with a couple drops of water, pressing to seal.
Brush each egg roll with olive oil then add to the fryer basket. Air fry for 10 minutes, flipping halfway through, or until the egg rolls are golden brown and crispy.
Serve immediately.

name: Air Fryer Eggplant Rings
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the air fryer to 425°F.
Cut each eggplant crosswise into ½-inch slices. Punch out the center of each slice.
In a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs, parmesan, garlic powder, paprika, basil, salt, and pepper.
Add the eggs to a separate bowl and whisk. Add the flour to a third bowl.
Dredge eggplant rings in the following order: flour, eggs, and breading mixture. Make sure to coat all sides. Arrange the eggplant rings in the air fryer basket.
Fry for 10 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown on both sides. Serve immediately.

name: Air Fryer Greek Frittata
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 350°F.
Whisk eggs and cream together in a bowl. Stir in spinach, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, onion, oregano, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Pour into the prepared cake pan and cover tightly with foil. Air-fry for 12 minutes.
Remove foil and air-fry until top starts to brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 4 to 8 minutes longer.

name: Air Fryer Herb-Seasoned Chicken Wings
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 390°F according to manufacturer's instructions. Oil the basket. Rinse chicken wings and pat dry.
Mix black pepper, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, parsley and salt together in a bowl. Sprinkle on both sides of the wings.
Place wings in the fryer basket, making sure they do not touch. Fry until browned and no longer pink in the centers, about 9 minutes per side.

name: Air Fryer Kfc
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 400°F.
Combine tapioca flour, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken pieces through the mixture.
Line a baking sheet with a cooling rack and place chicken on rack to let excess dredge fall off.
Lightly grease chicken with oil and place in the air fryer basket.
Cook in the preheated air fryer for 10 minutes, shaking the basket halfway through.
Combine tomato sauce, gochujang sauce, and soy sauce in a small bowl and drizzle over the chicken pieces.

name: Air Fryer Meatballs
instructions: Preheat the air fryer to 350°F.
Combine beef, pork, Italian seasoning, salt, garlic, egg, Parmesan cheese, and bread crumbs in a large bowl.
Mix well until evenly combined. Form into 16 equally-sized meatballs using an ice cream scoop and place on a baking sheet.
Place 1/2 of the meatballs in the basket of the air fryer and cook 8 minutes. Shake the basket and cook 2 minutes more.
Transfer to a serving plate and let rest for 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining meatballs.

name: Air Fryer Spicy Bay Scallops
ingredientLines: ½ lb bay scallops, rinsed and dried
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Combine bay scallops, smoked paprika, chili powder, olive oil, garlic powder, pepper, and cayenne pepper in a bowl and stir until evenly combined.
Transfer to the air fryer basket. Air fry until scallops are cooked through, about 8 minutes, shaking basket halfway through the cooking time. Serve imemdiately.

name: Air Fryer Sweet And Sour Pork
instructions: Place pork, flour, and sesame oil in a bowl and toss to coat. Let sit for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat the air fryer to 350°F.
Oil the basket of the air fryer. Place pork in the basket of the air fryer and oil top of pork.
Cook for 10 minutes. Shake the basket and cook pork until desired crispness, about 10 minutes more.
While the pork is cooking, combine sugar, vinegar, tomato sauce, and soy sauce in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved and mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low and keep sauce warm until ready to use.
Transfer pork to a bowl. Pour sauce on top of the pork and toss to coat. Top with sesame seeds.

name: Air Fryer Tilapila With Fresh Lemon Pepper
instructions: Preheat the air fryer to 400°F for 3 minutes.
While fryer is preheating, rinse tilapia fillets and pat dry with a paper towel.
Combine lemon zest, olive oil, pepper, salt, and garlic in a bowl. Rub spice mixture over the tilapia.
Sprinkle lightly with paprika. Spray the air fryer basket with cooking spray and place the filets inside, coated side up.
Air fry until fish can be flaked with a fork, 7 to 10 minutes.
Remove tilapia to a plate, garnish with chopped parsley, and serve with lemon wedges.

name: Air Fryer Vegan Taquitos
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Heat 1/2 olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes.
Add vegetarian beef crumbles, chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, cumin, and onion powder. Cook and stir for 5 minutes.
Add cream cheese, nutritional yeast, and salt. Cook until cheese is melted and everything is evenly combined, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Spoon a heaping tablespoon of mixture into the middle of each tortilla and roll up.
Working in batches, place a single layer of taquitos in the air fryer basket, seam-side down. Spray the tops with remaining oil.
Air fry for 6 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with remaining taquitos.

name: Air Fryer Zucchini Fries
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 400°F.
Add egg to a shallow bowl. Combine almond flour, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper in a second bowl, mix to combine.
Dredge zucchini first in egg, then in almond flour mixture, and lay out on a baking sheet.
Oil zucchini generously. Spread out zucchini in a single layer in the air fryer basket.
Cook until crispy, about 10 minutes.

name: Air-Fryer Taquitos With Cauliflower And Black Beans
ingredientLines: 6 oz black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 320°F for 8 minutes.
Cook mushrooms, onion, bell pepper, and garlic in ¼ cup water over medium about 10 minutes or until onion starts to turn translucent, stirring occasionally.
Stir in beans, tomato paste, and taco seasoning. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in riced cauliflower, lemon juice, and salt.
Warm tortillas according to package directions. Wrap in a kitchen towel to keep warm.
To assemble taquitos, lay a warm tortilla on a clean surface. Spoon tablespoons filling horizontally across middle of tortilla.
Starting from edge closest to you, roll up tortilla, tucking it under filling and rolling tightly to make a thin roll. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
Transfer taquitos into the air fryer. Air-fry 5 minutes or until tortillas are crisp and slightly browned around the edges. Serve immediately.

name: Ajapsandali
instructions: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat until shimmering. Add onions and cook until translucent but not browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato paste and stir until well-combined and fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add eggplant and salt to encourage moisture release. Stir to combine and cover, cooking for about 5 minutes.
Add peppers, chilli and tomato, pea proteins, and stir to combine, cover and simmer, adding a bit of water if necessary to thin out the stew. Cook for about 15 minutes.
Add garlic and half of the cilantro, stir to combine and cook for about 2 more minutes. Turn off heat and add remaining cilantro.

name: Albondigas
instructions: Combine all ingredients except oil and tomato sauce. Roll meat mixture into balls.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Brown meatballs on each side, about 5 minutes. Drain off excess oil.
Add tomato sauce, bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer 20 minutes or until meatballs are cooked through.

name: Apple Banana Oat Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 400˚F.
Place the oats in a food processor or blender and blend until a coarse flour is formed.
To a large mixing bowl add the blended oats, baking powder, proteins, cinnamon, salt. Mix and set aside.
Roughly chop the apples, add to the food processor, and pulse blend until the apples are finely minced.
To a separate mixing bowl add the bananas and mash them with a fork or potato masher but leave a few chunks.
Then add the apples, erythritol, lemon juice, vanilla, and water. Stir to combine.
Combine the wet mixture with the dry mixture, stir until well combined, and pour equal amounts of the batter into each section of the muffin pan.
Bake for 25 minutes.

name: Apple Chicken Salad Sandwich
instructions: Mix sour cream, lemon juice, honey, and poppy seeds together in a medium bowl.
Add chicken, apples, pecans, celery, green onions, parsley, toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
Place lettuce on a bun and top with salad.

name: Apricot Balls
instructions: Combine cashew nuts, apricots, coconut, and dates in a food processor bowl. Pulse ingredients until mixture is crumbly.
Add citrus zest, flour, spices, and salt to mixture. Pulse ingredients to combine well, and process on high speed until mixture starts to stick together.
Line a tray with parchment paper. With clean hands, shape the mixture into balls. Garnish with some sesame seeds and store in refrigerator,

name: Apricot Chicken With Almonds
instructions: Heat a large, deep frying pan over medium-high heat. Add a splash of oil and brown the chicken pieces all over for 10 minutes.
Mix together all the glaze ingredients. Add 2 tbsp water to thin the glaze out a little but not enough to make it overly watery.
When the chicken is golden brown and almost cooked through, pour off the excess fat.
Return the pot to the heat and add the glaze. Allow the glaze to simmer gently, basting the chicken regularly until the glaze has reduced.
Garnish with almond flakes and serve.

name: Apricot Chicken With Balsamic Vinegar
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet with a lid over medium-high heat. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, and cook about 5 minutes.
Stir in the onion, and cook for about 3 minutes more. Pour in the balsamic vinegar, bring it to a simmer, and allow it to reduce for a few minutes.
Cut half of the apricots in half, leaving the others whole. Place the apricots into the skillet, and pour in the chicken stock.
Bring to a simmer, then stir in the apricot preserves and thyme. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the apricots have softened, 10 mintues.
Sprinkle with chopped scallions and serve.

name: Arroz Con Pollo
ingredientLines: 2 lb skinless, boneless chicken thighs, chopped
instructions: Place chicken in a large bowl and cover with apple cider vinegar. Set aside.
Heat oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add bell peppers and cook for 1 minute. Add onion and cook for 1 minute.
Season with oregano, cumin, and pepper. Add capers and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Pour in tomato sauce and cook for another minute.
Strain chicken and discard vinegar. Add chicken to the pot. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 15 minutes. Adjust heat as need to simmer but not boil.
Add broth, cilantro, and rice to the pot. Stir until well mixed and return to a simmer. Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook for 20 minutes. Remove pot from heat and stir.

name: Arroz Rojo
instructions: Grate tomato into a bowl using a box grater; discard tomato skins.
Heat vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat and cook onion until translucent, stirring often, about 5 minutes.
Stir garlic into onion and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir rice into onion mixture and cook, stirring often, until rice is lightly toasted, about 3 more minutes.
Stir grated tomato, broth, and tomato sauce into the rice. Bring mixture to a boil.
Mix in jalapeno pepper, cilantro, and salt; reduce heat to low.
Cover skillet and simmer until rice has absorbed the liquid, about 15 minutes.
Turn off heat and let rice stand covered for 8 minutes. Fluff with a fork before transferring rice to a serving dish.

name: Artichoke-Pea Rigatoni
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When the oil shimmers, add garlic, thyme, artichokes.
Cook until the artichokes begin to crisp on the edges, about 5 minutes.
Add wine, and season with salt and pepper. Simmer over medium heat until reduced by about 1/3.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and boil the pasta to al dente according to package directions. During the last minute of cooking, add the peas to the water.
Toss the hot pasta and peas with the artichokes. Add the parmesan, lemon zest, juice. Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Asian Cucumber-Zucchini Salad
instructions: Spread sesame seeds in a skillet. Cook and stir over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove seed from skillet, set aside.
Quarter cucumber and zucchini lengthwise, cut into ½-inch thick slices.
In small bowl, combine soy sauce and vinegar, mix well. Add cucumbers and zucchini; toss gently until well coated. Sprinkle with sesame seed.

name: Asian Keto Chicken Stir-Fry With Broccoli
ingredientLines: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, sliced
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large frying pan, over medium-high heat. Add the chicken, garlic powder, and pepper. Stir-fry for a few minutes.
Add the broccoli and soy sauce. Stir together for a couple of minutes until the broccoli is crisp, yet tender.
Spoon into individual bowls, and serve immediately.

name: Asian Pilaf
ingredientLines: 6 oz beef steak, cut into pieces
instructions: Heat the oil and cook beef until browned on all sides, for about 5 minutes. Set aside.
Add onion, garlic, and carrots and saute for 2 minutes. Stir in paprika, cumin and turmeric.
Return the browned meat to the pot and add 1 cup of  water and 1 cup of stock, along with salt and pepper to season. Bring to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes.
While the meat is simmering, place the rice in a large bowl and rinse in several changes of water until the water runs clear.
Carefully add the rice to the pot, smoothing it out to cover the meat evenly.
Season with salt and pepper. Return to a medium heat and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes.

name: Asian Steak Roll Ups
ingredientLines: 1 red bell pepper, sliced into strips
1 yellow bell pepper, sliced into strips
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Lay out a few strips of steak on a cutting board. Add a couple of slices of peppers to each roll.
Season the beef and vegetables generously with salt and pepper, then roll up somewhat tightly and secure with toothpicks.
Add the olive oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Add the steak rolls and sear on all sides until browned.
Remove from the skillet and place into a baking dish. Bake the steak rolls for 15 minutes.

name: Asian Tofu Stir-Fry
instructions: In a salted boiling water cook rice noodles until al dente.
Heat oil in a skillet and saute ginger for about 2 minutes. Add carrot, red pepper, and spiced, and saute for 5 minutes.
To make sauce, add vegetable broth, vinegar, and soy sauce.
Pour the sauce into the pan and bring the mixture to a simmer, and simmer for 1 minute.
Add noodles, tofu, and toss to combine. Cook for 2 minutes, and serve.

name: Asparagus And Tomatoes
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Pour balsamic vinegar into a microwave-safe container. Cook on high power until vinegar is reduced by half, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes. Set aside.
Combine asparagus, cherry tomatoes, lemon, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a large bowl and toss until well combined.
Spread out vegetables in the air fryer basket in a single layer. You might need to cook in batches.
Cook in the air fryer until asparagus is lightly browned and the tomatoes begin to burst, about 10 minutes.
Place vegetables on a serving platter and drizzle with reduced balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle with feta cheese and serve warm.

name: Asparagus Risotto
ingredientLines: 4 oz asparagus, cut into small pieces
instructions: Heat oil and half the butter in a large, deep frypan on medium-low heat. Cook onion and garlic for 5 minutes until soft.
Turn heat to medium-high, add rice and stir to coat. Add wine and stir for 1 minute.
Add stock a ladleful at a time, stirring and allowing each to absorb before adding the next, until rice is cooked but still al dente.
Add asparagus with a final ladleful of stock, stir in cheese, butter, and 1/2 cup water, cook for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in rind and parsley. Season and serve with remaining parsley.

name: Asparagus Soup And Prawn
instructions: Boil the asparagus tips for a few minutes in lightly salted water. Cool and place them to one side.
Fry in a pan together with the rest of the asparagus and spinach.
Add the vegetable stock and double cream, then bring to the boil. Allow to simmer until the asparagus is tender.
Blend it all into a smooth consistency with a hand blender. Season with salt, pepper and lemon juice.
Add the frozen prawns and allow them to thaw in the hot soup. Sprinkle the asparagus tips over the soup.

name: Au Gratin Potatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F and butter a large baking dish.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add cream, milk, thyme, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Let simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat.
Layer a third of potatoes, slightly overlapping, in prepared dish then pour a third of cream mixture over potatoes.
Repeat with remaining potatoes and cream to make two more layers. Sprinkle cheese over top.
Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes.

name: Avocado Pasta With Smoky Pecans
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Blend the avocado with garlic, 1 tsp oil, lemon juice, basil, salt and nutritional yeast. Add as much water as needed. Taste and adjust flavor.
Add pecans and oil to a skillet over medium heat. Cook for 3 minutes,  stir occasionally to roast. Add the spices and salt and mix in. Cook for half a minute.
Mix the avocado sauce and pasta. Garnish with the smoky pecans, chopped basil, and serve.

name: Avocado Salad
instructions: In a medium skillet bring water to a boil. Add eggs and cook until hard-boiled. Peel them and slice.
Cook in the steamer casserole for 5 minutes. Drain the vegetables and then plunge them into cold water with ice to stop them cooking.
Place all of the ingredients in a large salad bowl, wash and drain the spinach leaves and add those too.
Mix the mustard and vinegar in a bowl. Then stir in the olive oil, salt and pepper.
Pour the dressing into the salad bowl, toss carefully and serve.

name: Avocado Sandwiches
instructions: Spread the cream cheese on slices of bread. Top with avocado slices, parsley, and drizzle with balsamic vinegar.

name: Avocado-Tuna Boats
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Cut the avocado in half and scoop the middle of both avocado halves into a bowl, leaving a shell of avocado flesh about ¼-inch thick on each half.
Add lemon juice and onion to the avocado in the bowl and mash together. Add tuna, corn, tomatoes, salt and pepper, and stir to combine. Taste and adjust if needed.
Fill avocado shells with tuna salad and serve.

name: Baccala Salad
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Place cod in a large bowl of cold water. Refrigerate for 24 hours, changing water after 12 hours. Drain cod and cut into 3-inch pieces.
Transfer to a large saucepan, cover with water, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat to medium and cook until fish is easily flaked with a fork, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain and transfer cod to a bowl filled with cold water until cooled, 10 to 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, olives, garlic, and onion, season with salt and pepper to taste.
Drain cod and flake with a fork. Add to bowl with olive oil mixture, toss to coat.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Serve chilled or at room temperature over leafy greens, mixed before serving.

name: Bacon Alfredo Pasta Casserole
ingredientLines: 8 oz creamed cheese, cut into squares
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Spray a 13x9 in baking dish with nonstick cooking spray and set aside. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and saute until tender, about 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in the Alfredo sauce, cream cheese, and heavy cream, and bring to a simmer over medium low heat.
Add the cheddar or Havarti cheese and stir until the mixture is melted and smooth. Remove the saucepan from the heat.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the penne and cook until al dente, according to package directions.
Meanwhile, combine the eggs and light cream in a large bowl and mix well using a wire whisk until blended. Place the frozen peas in a colander in the sink.
When the penne is cooked, drain it into the colander over the peas. Immediately stir the pasta and peas into the egg mixture in the bowl until coated.
Stir the coated pasta and peas into the sauce mixture in the saucepan along with the Parmesan cheese and the bacon.
Pour this mixture into the prepared casserole dish and top with the remaining Parmesan cheese. Bake for 30 minutes until the mixture is set and top begins to brown.
Cut into squares to serve.

name: Bacon And Egg-Stuffed Sweet Potato
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Wrap sweet potato with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until soft yet still a little firm, about 30 minutes. Remove foil.
Slice sweet potato in half and scoop out part of the inside to make a hole for the egg and bacon.
Wrap raw slice of bacon around the inside hole of each sweet potato half. Pour egg whites into the holes and place on a small baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until egg whites start to set, about 10 minutes.
Remove sweet potatoes from the oven and add egg yolks on top. Bake until the egg white has been fully cooked, 10 to 15 minutes.
Season with sea salt, pepper, garlic powder, parsley, and a drizzle of sriracha sauce.

name: Bacon Cheddar Cauliflower Chowder
instructions: Cook bacon in a large skillet and over medium heat, turning occasionally, until crispy, 10 to 12 minutes.
Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate with a slotted spoon, leaving bacon grease in the skillet. Crumble bacon when cool to the touch.
Add celery and garlic to the skillet and cook in the bacon grease until celery is tender, 3 to 4 minutes.
Add cauliflower, water, and onion powder, cover skillet to steam cauliflower. Cook, stirring every so often, until cauliflower is tender, about 5 minutes.
Add milk, 1 3/4 cups chicken broth, and hot sauce. Bring to a boil.
Meanwhile, whisk flour into the remaining chicken broth in a small bowl and drizzle into the boiling chowder.
Add Cheddar cheese and 1/2 of the crumbled bacon. Stir until smooth and cheese has melted.
Season with salt, pepper, and hot sauce. Ladle into bowls and top with remaining bacon and green onion.

name: Bacon Wrapped Chicken Breasts
instructions: Preheat the air fryer to 350°F.
Pat chicken pieces dry with paper towels. Use a sharp knife slice horizontally through the middle halfway, beginning at the thickest part.
Open the 2 sides and spread them out like an open book.
Season both sides with lemon-pepper seasoning. Place 1/3 of cheese on each chicken breast.
Cut asparagus spears in half and place 4 halves on top of the cheese.
Roll the chicken up and over the cheese and asparagus, keeping the stuffing inside each roll.
Wrap each chicken breast with 1/3 of bacon, using wooden toothpicks to secure the bacon, where it overlaps.
Place each bacon-wrapped breast in the air fryer basket and air fry for 15 minutes. Turn and cook for 15 minutes more.

name: Bacon-Wrapped Scallops
ingredientLines: 1⁄2 lb bacon slices, cut in half crosswise
Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the broiler to high. Coat a sheet pan with cooking spray.
Wrap a slice of bacon around each scallop and secure with a toothpick, arrange the scallops in a single layer on the baking pan.
In a small bowl, mix together the maple syrup, soy sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Brush half the mixture over the top of each of the scallops.
Broil for 10-15 minutes, or until bacon is crisp and scallops are cooked through. Brush the remaining sauce over the scallops halfway through the cook time.

name: Bagel Pizzas
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Arrange bagels on prepared baking sheet, cut sides up. Spoon a thin layer of pizza sauce over each bagel half and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and pepperoni is lightly browned, about 6 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Baked Cheesy Gnocchi
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In an oiled skillet over medium heat, add ground beef, and onion and season with salt. Cook for about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute. Drain off excess grease.
Add tomato sauce and remaining seasonings and cook over low for about 5 minutes.
While sauce is on low, cook gnocchi according to the package instructions.
In a baking dish, add 1/3 of the sauce on the bottom. Toss the gnocchi on top of the sauce and then pour the remaining sauce on top.
Sprinkle the top with the mozzarella cheese. Bake in the oven for about 20 minutes. Garnish with parsley andd serve.

name: Baked Chicken Taquitos
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Pour everything into your blender, including peppers and vinegar. Blend it until liquefied.
Cut the tops off of your peppers and slice in half lengthwise. Pour the vinegar into a saucepan, add peppers, salt, and garlic. Cook 10 mintues.
For filling, in a medium bowl combine chicken, cheese, taco sauce and cumin, set aside.
Stack tortillas and wrap in damp paper towels. Microwave 40 seconds or until warm and softened.
Spread one-fourth of the filling onto the bottom third of each tortilla. Tightly roll up tortilla. Place, seam sides down, on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake 15 minutes or until edges of tortillas are starting to brown. Serve with the sauce.

name: Baked Cod
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Combine tomatoes, olives, olive oil, and basil in a bowl and mix well.
Lay parchment paper on a work surface and place 1 cod fillet in the center of each. Spoon tomato mixture evenly on top of the 4 fillets.
Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Place a second sheet of parchment on top and seal the edges to make a parcel.
Repeat with the remaining fillets and tomato mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until cod flakes easily with a fork and asparagus is tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and carefully unwrap the parcels. Spoon onto warmed plates and serve immediately.

name: Baked Cod In Roasted Red Pepper Sauce
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F.
Add peppers to a baking tray, skin side up, and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Bake peppers for 20 minutes. Pull the charred skin off the peppers.
Add the peppers, 2 tbsp olive oil, almond milk, parsley, lemon juice, garlic, salt and cayenne pepper to a blender. Process until a creamy smooth sauce is formed.
Pour sauce in a baking dish. Drizzle cod fillets with the remaining oil, and season to taste. Add cod fillets to the baking dish filled with red pepper sauce.
Bake for 18 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Baked Eggs In Avocado With Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Arrange the avocado halves on a cookie sheet, and line the hollows with strips of smoked salmon.
Crack eggs into avocados, add salt and pepper. Garnish with some more salmon, paprika and bake for 20 minutes.
Garnish with parsley, and serve.

name: Baked Jalapeno Poppers
ingredientLines: 6 jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
Fill each jalapeno pepper half with cream cheese, Cheddar cheese, and bread crumbs, and arrange peppers on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until jalapenos are tender and cheese melts, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with red peppers flakes and serve immediately.

name: Baked Macaroni And Cheese
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a 2-quart baking dish.
Boil macaroni in a large pot of salted water until barely done, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Whisk together milk and egg in a large bowl. Stir in cheese and ghee. Place par-boiled macaroni in the prepared baking dish.
Pour milk mixture over macaroni, season with salt and pepper, and stir until combined. Press mixture evenly into the baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until top is browned, 30 to 40 minutes.

name: Baked Parmesan Zucchini Sticks
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
In a shallow baking dish, combine breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Place about 4 of the zucchini sticks into the eggs, and completely cover all sides.
Put zucchini into the bread crumb mixture and toss to completely coat. Place onto prepared baking sheet.
Bake for approximately 20 minutes or until golden.

name: Baked Tater Tots
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink. Drain. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer to a baking dish and top with tater tots. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25 minutes.

name: Baked Tofu
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Cook rice in pot of water accordinf to the instructions on the packaging.
Meanwhile arrange tofu slices onto a baking sheet. Brush olive oil over the top of each slice. Sprinkle salt and pepper over the tofu.
Bake tofu in preheated oven until lightly browned on top, 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir soy sauce, Sriracha, sesame oil, chile-garlic sauce, sesame seeds and garlic in a bowl,  spoon atop the tofu slices.
Return baking sheet to oven and continue baking tofu until topping is warmed, 3 to 5 minutes more. Garnish with green onion.

name: Baked Tomato And Mozzarella Orzo
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F.
Tip the orzo into a medium casserole dish, then stir in the oil and oregano.
Tip in the chopped tomatoes, then refill the can halfway with water and pour that in too.
Give everything a good mix, season, then cover and bake for 20 minutes until the pasta is almost cooked.
Take it out of the oven and give the orzo a stir. Remove the foil and return to the oven for a further 5 minutes.
Take the orzo out of the oven and tear the mozzarella over the top, then grill until melted and bubbling.

name: Balsamic Grilled Zucchini
instructions: Preheat grill for medium-low heat and lightly oil the grate.
Brush zucchini with olive oil. Sprinkle garlic powder, Italian seasoning, and salt over zucchini.
Cook on grill until beginning to brown, 3 minutes per side. Brush balsamic vinegar over the zucchini and continue cooking 1 minute more.
Serve immediately, drizzled with flaxseed oil and sprinkled with sesame seeds and pomegranate.

name: Balsamic Ravioli
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook ravioli according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Warm butter in a skillet over medium heat until slightly brown, about 1 minute. Add balsamic vinegar. Cook and stir until melted and combined, about 1 minute.
Divide ravioli between plates and drizzle with the balsamic-butter mixture. Top with Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

name: Balsamic Roasted Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400ºF.
In a small bowl combine the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, thyme, and pepper. Place the mushrooms in a ceramic or glass baking dish.
Pour the marinade over top and stir to coat the mushrooms. Roast the mushrooms for about 30 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Banana Hemp Seed Smoothie
instructions: Layer bananas, peach slices, almond butter, and hemp seeds in a blender, pour in water. Cover and blend until smooth.

name: Banana-Oatmeal Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350ºF. Line a baking sheet with a sheet of parchment paper.
Then, in a mixing bowl, mash the banana until it becomes a bit creamy but still has a few smallish chunks.
Next, add the vanilla, salt, cardamom, cinnamon, maple syrup, and coconut sugar to the mashed banana and stir.
And now, add the oats, cranberries, and walnuts to the mashed banana mixture and stir until combined.
Now, using a teaspoon, generously scoop the oat mixture and then, using your hands, gently shape each scoop into a ball and place on the prepared pan.
Gently pressing the top of each cookie lightly with two fingers to flatten slightly.
Bake cookies for 15 minutes.

name: Basil Pesto Grilled Shrimp
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
½ lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Pulse the basil, garlic, pine nuts, parmesan, oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a blender until smooth.
Marinate the shrimp in the pesto for at least 10 minutes in the fridge.
Skewer the shrimp and grill over medium-high heat until cooked, 2 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

name: Bbq Prawns In Orange Sauce
instructions: Preheat barbecue to high heat and cook prawns for about 3 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Remove from hotplate and place in a bowl.
Sprinkle zest, garlic, and parsley over, drizzle with orange juice and season to taste.

name: Bean And Potato Vegan Enchiladas
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Toss the potatoes in 1 tbso of olive oil, some salt, and some black pepper. Distribute evenly on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
In a large saucepan, heat the remaining olive oil. Cook the onion over moderate heat until soft and translucent, about 2 minutes.
Add the garlic, jalapeno, chili, cumin, paprika, salt and pepper and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in the tomatoes and remove from heat.
Blend in a food processor or blender until smooth. Return the tomato mixture to heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, beans, and 1 cup of the sauce. Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch glass baking dish.
Arrange the tortillas on a work surface. Spoon a heaping ½ cup of the potato mixture onto each tortilla. Roll the tortillas up and line up in the baking dish.
Top the enchiladas evenly with the remaining sauce, spreading. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Bean And Pumpkin Stew
instructions: Place beans in a medium saucepan and cover by about 2 inches of water. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat, drain and rinse.
In a stockpot over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add onion, garlic, salt. Saute until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in sweet paprika and tomato paste. Cook for 1 minute. Add beans, vegetable stock, Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer, partially covered, for about 20 minutes.
Add pumpkin to bean mixture, plus additional stock or water to cover, and simmer, partially covered, until tender, about 15 minutes more.
Garnish with green onions and serve.

name: Beef And Bean Burritos
ingredientLines: 10 oz canned black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a medium skillet, saute the onions and diced jalapenos until slightly soft.
Add ground beef, and cook until brown. Add water and black beans, cover and cook on medium heat for about 5 minutes or until water is mostly absorbed.
Warm large tortillas on griddle, if desired, and fill each with small amount of beef and bean mixture and desired toppings. Roll up.
Garnish burritos with some cheese and bake for 10 minutes in oven.

name: Beef And Broccoli Fajitas
instructions: Blanch the broccoli and beans for 2 minutes in a large pan of lightly salted boiling water, then drain well.
Drizzle the steak with oil, season really well and sprinkle over the fajita seasoning, patting to coat.
Heat a non-stick pan over a high heat and cook the steak for 3 minutes on each side.
Add the blanched broccoli, onion, beans and the peppers to the pan and fry for 3 minutes until the broccoli is starting to char. Serve.

name: Beef Yaki Udon Noodels
instructions: Mix all the ingredients for the sauce in a small bowl and set aside.
Remove your udon noodles from its package and add it to a pot of boiling water.
Frozen udon noodles can be added directly to the pot of boiling water. Stir gently until your udon noodles are separated and pliable.
Rinse and drain your noodles under cold water. If not using right away, drizzle on a little bit of oil to keep them from sticking.
Heat your pan over high heat and add the oil. Add in the ground meat and stir fry for 1 minute before adding the rest of your vegetables.
Stir fry together for 2 to 3 minutes and then add in the noodles and sauce. Continue stir frying for about 3 minutes or until well combined.
Serve immediately.

name: Beefy Chinese Dumplings
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together beef, cabbage, carrot, and onion. Stir in the egg, salt, soy sauce, and vegetable oil.
Place a large teaspoonful of filling in the center of a dumpling skin. Moisten the edges of a wonton with a few drops of water.
Then fold the dumpling in half, and pinch the edges together to seal.
Create a ripple pattern along the pinched edge by pinching and gently pushing together small segments of it. Repeat with remaining dumplings.
Boil the dumplings in water until they float to the top, about 5 minutes.

name: Beefy Vegan Taquitos
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes.
Add vegetarian beef crumbles, chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, cumin, and onion powder. Cook and stir for 5 minutes.
Add cream cheese, nutritional yeast, and salt. Cook until cheese is melted and everything is evenly combined, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Spoon a heaping tablespoon of mixture into the middle of each tortilla and roll up.
Working in batches, place a single layer of taquitos in the air fryer basket, seam-side down.
Spray the tops with cooking spray. Air fry for 6 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with remaining taquitos.

name: Black Bean & Tomato Chili
ingredientLines: 12 oz canned black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add peppers, onion and garlic. Cook and stir 10 minutes or until tender.
Add beans, chili, cumin and oregano. Heat through. Sprinkle with cilantro and serve.

name: Black Bean And Corn Salad
ingredientLines: ½ avocado, peeled, pitted and diced
instructions: Place lime juice, olive oil, garlic, salt, and cayenne pepper in a small jar. Cover with lid, and shake until ingredients are well mixed.
In a salad bowl, combine beans, corn, avocado, bell pepper, tomatoes, green onions, and parsley.
Shake lime dressing, and pour it over the salad. Stir salad to coat vegetables and beans with dressing, and serve.

name: Black Bean Burger
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a baking sheet.
Mash black beans in a bowl; add onion, garlic, carrots, and green bell pepper. Mix.
Whisk cornstarch, water, chile-garlic sauce, chili powder, cumin, seafood seasoning, salt, and black pepper together in a separate small bowl.
Stir cornstarch mixture into black bean mixture. Mix whole-wheat bread into bean mixture.
Stir flour, 1/4 cup at a time, into bean mixture until a sticky batter forms.
Spoon 'burger-sized' mounds of batter onto the prepared baking sheet, about a 3/4-inch thickness per mound. Shape into burgers.
Bake in the preheated oven until cooked in the center and crisp in the outside, about 10 minutes on each side.
Serve patties on top of buns with tomato, lettuce and onion.

name: Black Bean Cutlets
instructions: Boil the beans until tender. Add oats and cook till water has dried up.
Heat a little oil in a pan over moderate flame. Fry the onions and garlic till they turn golden brown. Add this to the oats mixture.
Now add lemon juice, chili powder, salt, and masala,. Mix well and make small balls of this mixture and shape into desired cutlet shape.

name: Blackened Chicken
ingredientLines: 10 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, halved
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a baking sheet. Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat for 5 minutes until it is smoking hot.
Mix together the paprika, salt, cayenne, cumin, thyme, white pepper, and onion powder.
Oil the chicken breasts with olive oil on both sides, then coat the chicken breasts evenly with the spice mixture.
Place the chicken in the hot pan, and cook for 1 minute. Turn, and cook 1 minute on other side. Place the breasts on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Blue Cheese Burgers
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, blue cheese, chives, hot pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, black pepper, salt, and mustard. Cover, and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Preheat grill for high heat. Gently form the burger mixture into about 12 patties.
Oil the grill grate. Grill patties 5 minutes per side, or until well done. Serve on rolls with lettuce, tomato and onion.

name: Blueberry Bread Pudding
instructions: Prehet the oven to 350°F.
In a medium bowl add the eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract and ground cinnamon. Mix until fully combined.
Add bread that has been torn into 1 inch pieces, raisins and seeds. Mix until you see that all the bread pieces are in touch with the liquid.
Brush a small baking mould with oil or give it a light coating with oil spray. Transfer the bread pudding mix and spread evenly.
Bake for 10 minutes in the middle rack of the oven. Then transfer to the highest rack, turn on the broiler setting at high and bake about 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
instructions: In a blender mix together 4 oz blueberries, 1 tbsp chia seeds, almond milk, 1 banana and pea proteins.
Pour the smoothie in bowls and top with some granola, blueberries, sliced banana and chia seeds.

name: Boneless Chicken Wings
ingredientLines: 1 lb skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
instructions: Mix tapioca starch, salt, pepper, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, and paprika together in a large bowl with a fork.
Add chicken cubes; toss with your hands until coated on all sides.
Heat coconut oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until melted and hot.
Add some of the chicken cubes using tongs; cook until browned, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate lined with paper towels. Repeat with remaining chicken, heating up more coconut oil and butter as needed.
Reduce heat to medium and whisk garlic and ginger into the grease in the skillet.
Reduce heat to medium and whisk garlic and ginger into the grease in the skillet. Whisk in coconut aminos and sriracha sauce.
Simmer over low heat until flavors combine, about 5 minutes. Stir in chicken, cook until sauce thickens and coats chicken, 5 to 7 minutes.
Garnish chicken with scallions and sesame oil and serve.

name: Bourbon Chicken
instructions: Place chicken breasts in a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine the ginger, soy sauce, onion powder, bourbon and garlic powder.
Mix together and pour mixture over chicken. Cover dish and place in refrigerator. Marinate overnight.
Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Set aside.
Remove dish from refrigerator and remove cover. Bake in the preheated oven, basting frequently, for 30 minutes. Serve immediately with rice and parsley.

name: Braised Octopus And Potatoes
instructions: Place the garlic and ¼ cup (2 fl oz) oil in a large saucepan over low heat.
Cook, swirling pan occasionally, for 2 minutes to infuse.
Increase heat to high, then add the octopus.
Cook octopus, turning, for 2 minutes or until evenly coloured.
Add the wine and bring to the boil, then cover and reduce heat to low.
Simmer for 45 minutes or until octopus is tender.
Remove from the heat and set aside in the pan until cool enough to handle.
Meanwhile, place potato in a large pan of cold salted water and bring to the boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to medium and simmer for 12-15 minutes or until tender.
Drain, then return to pan and cover to keep warm.

Remove the octopus from saucepan using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towel. (If using a large octopus, you may need to peel the ‘skin’ by rubbing or scraping it gently – the ‘skin’ of small octopuses can stay on.)
Cut the octopus into 2 inch pieces and return to the pan.
Add the potato, parsley, lemon juice and remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, and stir to combine.
Serve together in a large dish, warm or cold.

name: Bread Pavese Soup
instructions: Prepare the stock, dissolving the stock cube in 3/4 pint of boiling water.
Now, take a shallow pan and melt the butter. Fry the bread until both the sides are golden brown.
Put the bread inside the dish, pressing it down so that it stays on the bottom of the dish. Break the eggs on the bread and sprinkle with Parmesan.
The dish is ready for the adding of the stock. The stock must be boiling hot, so the heat of the stock will cook the eggs.
Sprinkle with some more Parmesan and serve.

name: Breaded Air Fryer Pork Chops
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 390°F.
Place pork chops on a plate and season both sides with Cajun seasoning.
Lightly beat eggs in a separate shallow dish. Dip pork chops into eggs, letting excess drip off.
Coat chops in breading and set on a plate.
Oil air fryer basket and place chops inside, making sure to not overcrowd the fryer.
You may have to do two batches depending on the size of your air fryer.
Cook for 5 minutes. Flip chops and mist again with cooking spray if there are dry or powdery areas.
Cook 5 minutes more. Repeat with remaining chops.

name: Breakfast Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Lay 9 quail eggs in a pot, cover with water and boil on low heat for 5 minutes.
Gently fry bacon in a pan to become golden and add  butter to melt.
While the eggs are boiling, combine flour, salt and baking powder in a small bowl.
In another, medium sized bowl, whisk 1 egg, milk, vinegar and sour cream.
When quail eggs are done, pour cold water over them and peel. Leave aside.
Add dry ingredients, bacon, cheddar and onion slices to wet ingredients and quickly combine.
Fill one third of each muffin cup with the batter and press boiled quail egg into the middle. Fill the cups with the rest of the batter and bake for 20 minutes.

name: Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Blanch or steam broccoli florets for about 5 minutes.
In a stovetop pan melt the butter and saute the onions for about 5 minutes. Dust in the flour and stir until moisture is absorbed.
Pour in the milk a little at a time and whisk or stir until a thick roux has formed.
Stir in cream cheese, cheddar, salt, and pepper.
Add the broccoli and stir again so all florets are coated. Transfer to a casserole dish
Top the casserole and bake for 15 minutes until top is golden brown and cheese is bubbling.

name: Broccoli Cheese Soup
instructions:
Melt butter in a medium size pot. Add chopped garlic.
Saute until garlic turn slightly golden in colour.

Add flour and stir until flour is bubbly and cook through.
Add stock and bring to a boil.
Add carrots, broccoli, cream and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a quick boil.
Add cheese, stir and serve.

name: Broccoli Hazelnut Spread
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet and cook shallot until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add hazelnuts and cook until toasted, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil and cook broccoli until softened, about 3 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Drain well.
Combine shallot-hazelnut mixture, nutritional yeast, broccoli, parsley, and dill in the bowl of a food processor, pulse until blended.
Pour 2 tablespoons olive oil in slowly, with the processor running, until spread is smooth.
Add more olive oil if needed. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Serve with crackers or bread.

name: Broccoli Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Spray muffin molds with olive oil.
Fill saucepan with water and bring to a boil. Add the broccoli and boil for 3 minutes, then drain well and cool.
Beat together eggs and cream in a large bowl. Whisk in the cheddar, onion powder, broccoli florets, salt, and black pepper.
Divide the mixture between the 12 muffin wells and bake until the eggs are set, about 15 minutes.

name: Broccoli Omelette
instructions: Crack open the eggs and put it directly into your microwave safe dish.
Add sea salt, garlic powder, and onion powder to the same bowl. Gently whisk with a fork.
Add the broccoli florets to the egg mixture. Stir gently.
Microwave this broccoli omelette for 3 minutes until cooked.
Top with shredded mild cheddar cheese and head for the door.

name: Broccoli Quesadilla
ingredientLines: 6 oz canned corn, drained and rinsed
instructions: Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Cook the zucchini in two batches over high heat until it’s browned and tender. Add broccoli and corn.
Reduce the heat to medium-low, add the garlic and cook, stirring, for 30 seconds. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spoon some of the filling on one half of a tortilla, sprinkle with cheese and fold it over.
Heat a small amount of oil in a large frying pan, place two quesadillas in the pan and cook them over medium heat until golden on both sides.

name: Broccoli Soup
instructions: Add the onion, garlic, carrot and celery to a pot with a few tablespoons of the vegetable stock, oil and cook until they start to soften, 5 minutes.
Add the broccoli, stock and milk and simmer over medium heat until all the veggies are soft and tender, about 15 minutes.
Carefully pour the soup into a blender, add proteins, and process until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper, if needed. Serve right away.

name: Brussels Sprouts And Bacon
ingredientLines: 2 cups Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: Fry the bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat until crispy.
Add the Brussels sprouts to the pan, stir and cover the pan with a lid. Reduce the heat and cook for 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper if needed. Serve garnished with some Parmesan.

name: Brussels Sprouts Gratin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Boil the Brussels sprouts until bright green and beginning to soften but not mushy, 5 minutes.
Drop the sprouts into the ice water to stop the cooking, then drain and pat them dry.
Melt the butter and flour in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring, until smooth and bubbling, about 1 minute. Whisking constantly, slowly stir in the milk.
Continue to cook, whisking frequently, until thick and creamy, 3 minutes. Add 3/4 of the cheese and stir until melted and smooth.
Remove the pan from the heat and season the sauce well with salt and heavily with pepper.
Place the sprouts in an even layer in a baking dish, pour the sauce evenly over the top, and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
Bake until golden and bubbling on top, 10 minutes.

name: Bucatini All'Amatriciana
instructions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in bucatini and return to a boil.
Cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until bucatini is tender, about 11 minutes. Drain.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic cloves; cook until golden brown, about 1 minute.
Remove with a slotted spoon and discard. Add bacon, cook and stir until crisp and golden, about 4 minutes.
Add onion and red pepper flakes; cook and stir until onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes, salt, and black pepper. Simmer tomato sauce until flavors combine, about 10 minutes.
Stir bucatini and Pecorino Romano cheese into tomato sauce and toss until evenly coated.

name: Buffalo Chicken Dip
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Cook chicken bites in salted water, until tender, about 15 minutes.
Mix everything except ½ cup of the cheddar cheese into a large bowl until well combined.
Pour the mixture into a pan and cover with the remaining cheese and parsley. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Buffalo Chicken Meatballs
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, egg, tapioca, onion, paprika, garlic, salt and pepper. Mix well until fully combined, careful not to overwork the meat.
Heat a large nonstick heavy skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the ghee.
Roll chicken mixture into balls about 1.5” and place in the hot skillet to brown. Use a spoon to carefully turn them 3 times to brown evenly on all sides.
While meatballs brown, whisk together the oil and tomato paste. After browning, pour sauce over meatballs and lower the heat to medium-low.
Cover the skillet and cook another 4 minutes or until cooked through. Uncover and stir sauce, spooning it over the meatballs. Serve immediately.

name: Bulgogi
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together soy sauce, wine, sugar, garlic, sesame oil, sesame seeds and black pepper
Place beef and onions into the mixture, and stir to coat. Cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Preheat grill pan over high heat. Brush oil over grill pan, and add beef and onions. Cook, turning to brown evenly, for 3 to 6 minutes, or until done.

name: Bulgur With Mushrooms
instructions: Melt the butter in a large saucepan along with the olive oil, and cook the mushrooms and garlic over a medium low heat for 5 minutes, until soft.
Add the bulgur wheat, pepper, and vegetable stock.
Simmer very gently for around 10 minutes, or until the bulgur is al dente. Stir every couple of minutes to ensure the bulgur doesn't stick to the pan. Serve.

name: Burrata Caprese Salad
instructions: Add the basil leaves, olive oil, pine nuts and lemon juice to the bowl of a food processor and make the pesto. Process until smooth.
Transfer the pesto to a bowl and stir in the grated garlic and cheese. Season with salt.
Slice the tomatoes into wedges and place them on serving platter. Add spinach leaves.
Place the burrata cheese on top and drizzle with pesto.

name: Burrata With Cherry Tomato Confit
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325°F.
In a bowl, combine the tomatoes, lemon juice and salt. Let marinate for 5 minutes. Drain.
In a baking dish, combine the tomatoes and oil. Bake for about 25 minutes.
Transfer to a serving dish. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until completely chilled.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the garlic in the butter.
Place the burrata over the tomatoes and cut in half. Season with pepper and top with the basil. Serve immediately.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Heat a large skillet or medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the oil, butter, and onions and cook onions down until lightly golden, about 3 minutes.
Add ginger and garlic and let cook for 30 seconds, stirring so it doesn’t burn.
Add the chicken, tomato paste, and spices. Cook for 5 minutes or until everything is cooked through.
Add the heavy cream and simmer for 10 minutes stirring occasionally.

name: Butter Sauce Shrimp
instructions: Heat the olive oil and 2 tbsp butter in a skillet over medium high heat.
Add the shrimp to the heated skillet and saute with salt and pepper to taste for several minutes until the shrimp is cooked through. Remove and set aside.
Turn the heat down to medium on the stove, and add the remaining butter and minced garlic to the same skillet. Saute for 30 seconds.
Whisk in the white cooking wine, Italian seasoning and lemon juice. Serve with parsley.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
ingredientLines: 1 1/2 lb butternut squash, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 400ºF.
On a large baking sheet, toss butternut squash and potatoes with 2 tablespoons olive oil and season generously with salt and pepper. Roast for 25 minutes.

Meanwhile, in a large pot over medium heat, melt butter and remaining tablespoon olive oil. Add onion, celery, and carrot and cook until softened, 7 to 10 minutes. Season generously with salt, pepper, and 1 tbsp thyme.
Add roasted squash and potatoes and pour over chicken broth. Simmer 10 minutes, then using an immersion blender, blend soup until creamy. Serve garnished with thyme.

name: Butternut Squash Vegan Alfredo Pasta
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Combine squash and 1 tablespoon oil on a baking sheet, toss until coated.
Roast in the preheated oven until tender and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add cashews, simmer until softened, about 20 minutes. Drain.
Combine cashews and 1/2 cup broth in a blender, blend until very smooth.
Add roasted squash, remaining 1/2 cup broth, miso, nutritional yeast, and lemon juice, blend until sauce is combined.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook bow-tie pasta, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes.
Drain, reserving 1 cup pasta water. Transfer pasta to a serving bowl.
Heat remaining oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and salt, cook and stir until golden brown, about 9 minutes.
Add sage and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Pour in cider, cook, stirring up browned bits from the bottom of the skillet, 1 to 2 minutes.
Stir half of the cashew sauce into the pasta. Add onion mixture. Stir in enough reserved pasta water to thin and warm sauce.
Season with pepper. Garnish with parsley.

name: Cabbage Pancakes
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, mix together the raw cabbage, onion, and almond flour.
In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, soy sauce, pepper, and garlic. Stir the egg mixture into the cabbage mixture. Mix well.
Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and add 2 tbsp olive oil. Scoop the mixture onto the pan and flatten with a spatula.
Cook the pancakes until browned on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.

name: Cabbage Steaks With Bacon
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Stand the cabbage up root end on your cutting board. Cut into ½ inch thick slices, being careful to hold the leaves together.
Arrange the cabbage steaks on two cookie sheets. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast for 30 minutes.
Add the bacon pieces to a skillet set over medium heat. Cook until bacon is crisp and then remove with a slotted spoon to a paper towel lined plate.
Combine the cream, lemon juice, dijon mustard and garlic in a small bowl and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
One the cabbage steaks are cooked, drizzle them with the creme fraiche sauce and sprinkle them with the bacon. Serve immediately.

name: Cabbage, Watercress And Pine Nut Dumplings
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: On a work surface, combine the chopped watercress, cabbage, scallions, garlic and pine nuts and finely chop them all together.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and season with the salt and white pepper. Knead the mixture slightly to wilt the greens.
Spread 6 gyoza wrappers on a work surface and brush the edges with water. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the filling into the center of each wrapper and fold in half.
Press the edges firmly to seal, pressing out any air pockets. Transfer the dumplings to a cornstarch-dusted baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
In a pot of boiling salted water, cook the dumplings until tender and translucent, about 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Cajun Air Fryer Salmon
instructions: Preheat the air fryer to 390°F.
Rinse and dry salmon fillets with a paper towel. Mist fillets with cooking spray.
Combine Cajun seasoning and brown sugar in a small bowl. Sprinkle onto a plate.
Press flesh sides of fillets into the seasoning mixture.
Oil the basket of the air fryer and place salmon fillets skin-side down.
Cook for 8 minutes. Remove from air fryer and let rest for 2 minutes before serving.

name: Calamari Rings
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine heavy cream, wine, and sliced squid.
Prepare batter by well combining almond Flour, grated Parmesan, garlic powder, pepper, eggs, and sparkling water into a large mixing bowl.
Transfer the squid into the batter, and set aside.
Pour olive oil into fry pan. Add squid and cook for 1 minute on each side.
Transfer to a serving plate with some tomato sauce.

name: Calamari Salad
instructions:
Rinse squid and slice tubes into 1/2 inch rings.
Leave the tentacles whole and set aside.
In a medium bowl combine onion, garlic, tomatoes, feta, parsley, olive oil lemon juice, vinegar, salt and fresh pepper.
Bring a medium pot filled with water and a pinch of salt to a boil. Add calamari all at once and cook until tender, 3 minutes.
Quickly drain when cooked and add to the ice bath until cool, 5 minutes.
Combine squid with the salad and toss well.

name: Calzone Rolls
instructions: Place a rack on bottom shelf of oven. Preheat to 450ºF. Line a large baking sheet with parchment.
Warm oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook for 1 minute.
In a large bowl combine ricotta, salt and pepper.
Roll out dough, spread the pesto, spinach mixture and ricotta. Top with cherry tomatoes and fold dough over. Repeat with remaining.
Transfer calzones to baking sheet. Whisk egg with 1 tsp. water. Brush top of each calzone with egg wash. Bake for 15 minutes.

name: Cannellini Spinach Toasts
instructions: Starting in a cold pan, bring olive oil and garlic to medium heat.
Add spinach and cannellini beans and cook until the cannellini beans are warmed through and the spinach has wilted.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Top the toasted bread with the garlicky spinach and bean mixture, garnish with Parmesan, and serve.

name: Caponata
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high.
Add chopped red bell pepper, chopped white onion, and eggplant cubes to skillet. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 10 minutes.
Stir in chopped tomato, Simmer until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped fresh basil.

name: Caprese Stuffed Avocados
ingredientLines: 1 avocado, halved, stone and skin removed
instructions: Plate the avocado and top with the mixture of the tomato, mozzarella and pesto followed by a drizzle of the balsamic vinegar. Serve immediately.

name: Caprese Tomato-Basil Soup
instructions: Cook the onion on a medium heat in a big saucepan in olive oil for 5 minutes. Crush the garlic and add it to the onions and cook for 30 seconds.
Then add the diced tomatoes, yeast and the broth and let it simmer. After 20 minutes wash and cut the basil and add it to the soup.
Add the tomato paste and Greek yogurt and blend it smoothly using a hand blender. Add salt to taste and serve immediately.

name: Carbonara
instructions: In large skillet, saute bacon over medium heat until crisp, approximately 10 minutes.
Transfer bacon to a bowl using a slotted spoon. Leave 2 tablespoons bacon grease in skillet.
Add cream to skillet and bring to simmer, then remove from heat and whisk in egg yolks. When combined, whisk in parmesan cheese and black pepper.
Add gluten-free noodles and bacon to skillet. Toss well to combine. Return to medium heat and heat through.

name: Cardamom, Avocado And Blueberry Smoothie
ingredientLines: 1/2 oz unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth. Pour the smoothie in glasses and serve immediately.

name: Carrot Cake Smoothie
instructions: Pulse carrot and mango together in a blender until roughly chopped. Add peach, soy milk, cinnamon, allspice, and ginger; blend until smooth.

name: Carrot Chips
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Combine carrot chips and olive oil in a resealable bag and toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt.
Air-fry until crispy, 10 to 12 minutes, stopping every 3 minutes to give the air fryer basket a shake.

name: Carrot Cumin Parsley Soup
instructions: Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add carrots and onion, cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, nutritional yeast, coriander, and cumin, cook until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.
Add bone broth and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer until the carrots are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add parsley, cook for 1 minute more.
Puree with an immersion blender or in a blender until smooth. Add yogurt; blend until thoroughly mixed.
Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and garnish with cilantro.

name: Carrot Curry Soup
instructions: Pour the vegetable broth into a soup pot, and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Stir in the curry powder, cumin, cinnamon, and ginger, add the carrots.
Reduce heat to a simmer, and cook until the carrots are tender, about 20 minutes, stirring often.
Strain out the carrots from the broth, and place carrots into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.
Pour about 1/4 cup vegetable broth into the blender to allow the carrots to puree. Add yeast.
Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender and leave it to puree.
Puree in batches until smooth, if needed, return the pureed carrots to the vegetable broth.
Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the carrots right in the cooking pot.
Stir in the coconut milk and the water. Bring back to a simmer, sprinkle with cilantro to serve.

name: Carrot Falafel
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl add the onion, carrot and garlic and mix well.
Add everything else and stir together really well making sure all the spices are distributed well.
You should have a really thick batter that is sticky but that can be squeezed together in your hands. Add water gradually, stirring as you go.
Roll into tight walnut sized balls and place on the prepared baking tray then bake for 25 minutes.

name: Carrot Fritters
instructions: Add carrots, green onions, garlic, flour, salt, pepper, ground mustard and cumin to a bowl. Stir to combine.
Add the egg or flax egg (see notes) to the bowl. Mix until you have a thick paste-like mixture. Form into  equal patties, Set aside.
Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add tablespoon of avocado oil. Once the pan is hot, add half of the carrot fritters to the pan.
Cook until the bottom is golden brown, about 3 minutes. Flip over, and press the fritters down with the back of a spatula. Cook another 3 minutes or so, until golden and crispy.

name: Carrot Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large, heavy pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add the carrot, potato, lentil, and broth. Cover the pot and cook until the vegetables are very soft, 20 minutes.
Puree the soup in a blender or food processor until very smooth. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Carrots With Parsley
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cut the carrots in to 2 inch chunks and put in a baking dish.
Add the olive oil, salt, pepper and garlic and put in oven, stirring half way through. Bake for 20 minutes.
Take the carrots out of the oven and add the fresh parsley and stir. Garnish with onion, serve.

name: Cashew Cream Cheese
instructions: Place cashews in a bowl. Add hot water to cover; soak for 5 to 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to a blender.
Add 1/2 cup water, lemon juice, vinegar, and salt; blend until creamy, stopping to scrape down the sides every now and then. Stir in chives.
Serve right away or let chill in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Cashew Mac And Peas
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Add potatoes, carrot, and onion to a large pot of boiling water. Cover and allow the vegetables to cook for 10 minutes, until the potatoes are fork-tender.
Remove boiled vegetables from water and reserve 1 cup of the water. Add potatoes, carrot, onion, cashews, and seasonings to a blender with half of the reserved water.
Blend, adding a few tablespoons of water at a time until the desired consistency is achieved.
Pour vegetable puree over the macaroni and stir in green peas before serving. Serve immediately.

name: Casserole With Broccoli And Bacon
instructions: Fry the bacon in a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat until crispy. Use a spoon to transfer to a paper towel lined plate to soak up some of the oil.
In the same pan, melt the butter, add the onion, tomatoes, and pepper, and cook until transparent.
Add the broccoli and season with salt and pepper and cook while stirring occasionally for about 3 minutes, or until just turning vibrant in colour.
Add in the garlic and stir it through the broccoli for 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Add the bacon and give everything a good mix to combine all of the flavours together. Top with the mozzarella.
Broil until cheese is bubbling and golden, and broccoli is done to your liking, 3 minutes.

name: Cauliflower & Mushroom Gratin
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Heat the olive oil in a large wide skillet over a medium high flame. Add shallots and thyme and saute for 1 minute.
Add the leeks and continue cooking until they start to soften and begin to brown.
Add the mushrooms and a pinch of sea salt, cook, stirring until they start to darken and wilt, about 5 minutes.
Add the water and cauliflower, cover, and turn the heat down to low. Cook for 5 minutes.
Melt the butter in a heavy-bottomed saucepan. Stir in the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until the paste cooks and bubbles a bit.
Add the hot milk, continuing to stir as the sauce thickens. Bring it to a boil. Add salt and pepper to taste, lower the heat, and cook, stirring for 2 minutes.
Tip the vegetables into a baking dish and pour the bechamel sauce over them. Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 10 minutes.

name: Cauliflower And Broccoli Gratin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 390°F.
Place cauliflower and broccoli into a large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to simmer, covered, for 8 minutes. Drain well. Place in prepared dish.

Meanwhile, to make sauce, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Blend in flour. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, for 1 minute. Do not brown. Remove from heat. Gradually blend in milk, until smooth.
Return to heat. Cook on high, stirring constantly, until sauce boils and thickens. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes. Season to taste.
Pour sauce over vegetables. Sprinkle with combined cheeses and breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Cauliflower Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.

Cook cauliflower in boiling, salted water for 10 minutes.  
Drain and allow to cool slightly.
In a medium bowl beat eggs well. Add yogurt, milk, Parmesan, and nutmeg.  Mix well.

Arrange cauliflower in a lightly oiled baking dish.
Pour egg mixture over the top and sprinkle with cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes, until soft and garnish with dill.

name: Cauliflower Frittata
instructions: Position a rack in upper third of oven; preheat broiler to high.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until starting to brown, 3 minutes.
Add cauliflower and water. Cover and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes.
Add kale, garlic, thyme and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper; cook, stirring often, until the kale is wilted, 3 minutes.
Whisk eggs, paprika, and the remaining salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add the vegetables to the egg mixture and gently stir to combine.
Wipe the pan clean; add the remaining 1 tablespoon oil and heat over medium heat. Pour in the egg mixture and top with cheese.
Cover and cook until the edges are set and the bottom is brown, 5 minutes.
Transfer the pan to the oven and broil until the top of the frittata is just cooked, 3 minutes.

name: Cauliflower Fritters
instructions: Place cauloflower in the food processor and puree with a little salt and pepper.
Once your cauliflower puree is done, in a mixing bowl, whisk together all your ingredients, except the 1 tbsp cooking oil.
Preheat killet and add oil. Add small rounds of batter. Cook like pancakes.

name: Cauliflower Omelet
instructions: Beat eggs with 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Heat oil in a heavy nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until it shimmers, then saute cauliflower until browned and tender, 5 minutes.
Pour eggs over cauliflower and feta. Cook, lifting edges to let uncooked egg run underneath and shaking skillet to loosen omelet, 5 minutes.
Slide out onto a large plate. Put the skillet over omelet and, firmly hold plate and skillet together,  invert omelet back into skillet and cook 2 minutes.
Slide out onto plate and sprinkle with some cauliflower and parsley.

name: Cauliflower Omelet In A Baking Dish
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease baking dish with butter.
Beat eggs, sour cream, milk, and salt in a bowl until blended. Stir in cauliflower florets. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dishes.
Bake for 20 minutes, sprinkle with cheese and bake for 2 minutes, until cheese is melted
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

name: Cauliflower Pizza Crust
instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F.
Blend the cauliflower florets in a food processor. Add the cauliflower rice to a microwave safe bowl, cover, and microwave for 5 minutes to soften.
Place the cauliflower rice in a large mixing bowl. Add the cheese, egg and seasonings. Use your hands to mix everything together to form the pizza dough.
On a parchment lined baking sheet, press the dough dough down into an even circle.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until slightly golden, then remove from oven.
Add sauce and slices of mozzarella, bake for additional 5 minutes, then serve garnished with basil leaves.

name: Cauliflower Salad With Sausages
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
