Heat a large oven-safe saute pan over medium-high heat. Add 1 tbsp of oil to the pan, followed by the sausage.
Add onion and garlic to the pan, season with salt and pepper, and saute for 3 minutes or until onions are translucent and meat is well-browned.
Increase heat slightly. Add the remaining oil to the pan.. Add cauliflower to pan, and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes.
Garnish with green onions, sesame seeds, and serve.

name: Cauliflower Soup
instructions: Melt butter in a large cast-iron pot over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in hot butter until tender, about 7 minutes.
Add cauliflower and garlic, cook, stirring, until garlic is fragrant and cauliflower starts to soften, 5 minutes.
Pour chicken broth, salt, and pepper into cauliflower mixture, cover pot and simmer until cauliflower is tender, about 25 minutes.
Pour cauliflower mixture into a blender no more than half full. Cover and hold lid down, pulse a few times before leaving on to blend.
Puree in batches until smooth. Return pureed soup to pot and bring to a simmer for 3 minutes.

name: Cauliflower Soup With Sausages
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine cauliflower, broth, water and garlic. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Pour half of the soup into the blender and blend. Return to the skillet.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook sausage and mushrooms over medium heat until sausage is no longer pink, for 5 minutes. Slice.
Add sausage to a cauliflower soup, stir in cream and pepper, and heat through.

name: Cauliflower Spinach Casserole
instructions: Turn on your broiler. Bring a medium sized pot of salted water to the boil. Add the cauliflower florets and boil for approximately 10 minutes.
While the cauliflower boils, caramelize the onion in a little bit of butter and oil until soft. Add spinach and nutmeg and cook until warmed through.
Add butter, season with salt and pepper. Mix together spinach onion and cauliflower and scoop into a small baking dish. Top with cheese.
Slide under the broiler until the cheese is golden brown and bubbly.

name: Cauliflower With Butter And Chives
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add the cauliflower florets to the water and cook for 10 minutes.
Drain the cauliflower well and then turn it out onto paper towels to dry completely.
In the same pot, add the cream cheese and garlic.  Saute the garlic until very fragrant, softened, but not browned.
In the bowl of a food processor, combine the cauliflower, cream cheese, and garlic mixture, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.

Pulse until the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
Spoon the mixture into a serving bowl.

Stir in the sour cream and sprinkle the top of the cauliflower with chives and a spoon of butter.
Serve immediately.

name: Cauliflower-Leek Soup
instructions: Heat the olive oil and butter in a large pot over medium heat, and saute the leeks, cauliflower, and garlic for about 10 minutes.
Stir in the vegetable broth, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 45 minutes.
Remove the soup from heat. Blend the soup with an immersion blender or hand mixer.
Season with salt and pepper and add nutritional yeast. Mix in the heavy cream, and continue blending until smooth.

name: Cauliflower-Turkey Meatloaf
instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Using your hands, mix the ingredients until everything is well blended.
Shape the meat on the prepared baking sheet in the shape of a meatloaf. Bake for 20 minutes. Internal temperature should read 165°F. Serve immediately.

name: Ceviche
instructions: In a large glass or ceramic bowl, gently toss the shrimp and scallops with the lime juice and lemon juice.
Mix in onion, cucumber, tomato, jalapeno, serrano, cilantro, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Cover bowl, and chill ceviche 1 hour in the refrigerator, until shrimp and scallops are opaque.

name: Cha Siu Bao
instructions: Add the yeast to water. Let stand for 10 minutes, or until mixture is frothy.
Sift the flour and baking powder into a large bowl. Stir in shortening and the yeast mixture, mix well.
Knead the dough until smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a greased bowl, and cover it with a sheet of cling wrap.
Let the dough rise in a warm place for about 2 hours, or until it has tripled in bulk.
Marinate for 30 minutes in a mixture made with half of  soy sauce and hoisin sauce. Grill the pork until cooked and charred.
Combine remaining tablespoons soy sauce, oyster sauce, and 1 cup water in a saucepan. Bring to the boil.
Mix in sesame oil, and white pepper. Cool, and mix in the roasted pork.
Remove the dough from the bowl, and knead it on a lightly floured surface until it is smooth and elastic.
Roll the dough into a long roll, and divide it into 6 pieces. Flatten each piece with the palm of the hand to form a thin circle.
The center of the circle should be thicker than the edge. Place one portion of the pork filling in the center of each dough circle.
Wrap the dough to enclose the filling. Pinch edges to form the bun. Let the buns stand for 10 minutes. Steam buns for 12 minutes. Serve.

name: Chakhokhbili
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
Add the chicken, season with salt and pepper and cook until browned, about 10 minutes.
Add in the chopped onion and cook further until translucent.
Then, add the garlic, bay leaf, cherry tomatoes, tomato passata, and bell pepper. Reduce the heat to medium.
Cover the skillet with the lid and cook for 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and veggies are tender.
Sprinkle with cilantro, add chili and serve.

name: Chana Masala
instructions: Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Grind onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, and chile pepper together in a food processor into a paste.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry bay leaves in hot oil until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour the paste into the skillet and cook until the oil begins to separate from the mixture and is golden brown in color, 2 to 3 minutes.
Season the mixture with chili powder, coriander, gram masala, turmeric, and salt; cook and stir until very hot, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir enough water into the mixture to get a thick gravy,  bring to a boil and stir chickpeas into the gravy.
Reduce heat to medium and cook until the chickpeas are heated through, 5 to 7 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

name: Char Siu
instructions: Mix cooking wine, hoisin sauce, kiwi, dark soy sauce, chile sauce, garlic, oyster sauce, and five-spice powder together in a large resealable plastic bag.
Add pork belly. Seal bag, pressing out as much air as possible.
Place bag on a plate and marinate pork belly in the refrigerator, flipping occasionally, for at least 2 days.
Preheat oven to 275°F with a rack in the upper third of the oven. Set a wire rack on a rimmed baking sheet.
Place pork belly on the wire rack, reserving marinade
Bake pork belly in the preheated oven until the internal temperature reaches 160°F about 50 minutes.
Remove pork belly from the oven, baste with reserved marinade. Move oven rack to the top position and preheat the oven's broiler.
Broil pork until it is dark and glossy and the edges start to blacken, about 5 minutes. Flip and baste on the second side.
Continue broiling until second side darkens and starts to blacken, about 5 minutes more. Slice with a sharp knife.

name: Cheddar Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Preheat an air fryer to 380°F.
Cook 1 strip of bacon in the air fryer for 2 minutes. Remove from air fryer and cut into small pieces.
Line the air fryer basket with parchment paper and increase the temperature to 400°F.
Combine cooked bacon, Cheddar cheese, and 1 tablespoon barbeque sauce in a bowl.
Use a long, sharp knife to make a horizontal 1-inch cut at the top of each chicken breast, creating a small internal pouch.
Stuff each breast equally with bacon-cheese mixture. Wrap remaining strips of bacon around each chicken breast.
Coat chicken breast with remaining barbecue sauce and place into the prepared air fryer basket.
Cook for 10 minutes in the air fryer, turn, and continue cooking until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 10 more minutes.

name: Cheese Sausage Strata
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a large skillet, cook sausage over medium heat until no longer pink and drain.
Add the eggs, milk, cheese, and mustard. Transfer to a greased baking dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.

name: Cheese, Zucchini And Cauliflower Gnocchi
instructions: In a large, deep skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute while stirring with a whisk.
Whisk in the milk and garlic. Bring to a boil. Add the zucchini and gnocchi. Simmer gently for 4 minutes.
Add the cauliflower, Pecorino and nutmeg. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well. Sprinkle with herbs and serve.

name: Cheesy Brussels Sprouts And Ham Pasta
ingredientLines: 8 oz brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
instructions: Bring water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Once water comes to a boil, add salt and cook pasta according to package instructions to al dente.
Stir egg in a small bowl. Once fully mixed, whisk in the cheese. Set aside.
Set a medium heavy skillet over medium-high heat and cook bacon, stirring often, until browned and crispy, about 5 minutes.
Add Brussels sprouts to the skillet and sauté in the bacon fat until crisp tender, scraping the bottom to release any browned bits, 3 minutes.
When the pasta is done, carefully remove 1 cup of pasta water. Drain pasta and return it to the pot.
Off the heat, gradually stir in the egg-cheese mixture, stirring constantly with tongs to cook eggs and coat noodles.
Stir in the Brussels sprouts, bacon and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Cheesy Cauliflower Bake
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Boil cauliflower florets over high heat for 5 minutes, or until just tender. Drain and place into baking dish. Add uncooked grated cauliflower.
Combine eggs and milk in a large bowl and beat with a fork until smooth. Add cheddar cheese, garlic powder, paprika, salt, pepper.
Pour egg mixture over cauliflower. Top with reserved cheese. Bake for 25 minutes.

name: Cheesy Mexican Casserole
ingredientLines: 3 corn tortillas, torn into pite size pieces
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Oil a baking dish.
Stir condensed soup, sour cream, green chilies, and milk together in a large bowl. Add beef, tortilla pieces, and taco seasoning, stir.
Mix tomato and half Mexican-style cheese blend into chicken mixture.
Spread chicken mixture out into the prepared baking dish and cover the dish with aluminum foil.
Bake casserole in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Discard aluminum foil.
Sprinkle remaining cheese over the top of the casserole and continue baking for 5 to 10 minutes more.

name: Cheesy Zucchini Bake
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Melt butter in a medium skillet. Add chopped onion and zucchini and saute over medium heat 5 minutes.
In a medium mixing bowl, beat eggs and then stir in spices.
Add a small amount of onion/zucchini mixture to eggs to temper them.
Add remaining zucchini, and stir in shredded mozzarella. Bake for 25 minutes, garnish with spring onion and serve.

name: Cheesy Zucchini Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large nonstick skillet, warm 2 tbsp of butter over medium-high heat.
Add in the zucchini, onion, garlic, Italian seasoning, and salt. Saute for 5 minutes or until vegetables have started to soften.
Spoon the zucchini mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 15 minutes until the casserole is bubbly.
Uncover casserole and sprinkle cheese over the top. Return to the oven, uncovered, and bake another 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped onions and serve.

name: Cherry Tomatoes Filled With Goat Cheese
instructions: In a medium-sized bowl, combine the cheese, basil, salt and pepper. Mix with a fork until well blended.
Cut the top off each cherry tomato. Using a small spoon, carefully scoop out the pulp to make a hollow, yet sturdy, shell.
Drain off any juice that may be in the tomato shells.
Using a small spoon, scoop about 1 teaspoon of the cheese mixture and carefully stuff into a tomato shell.
Repeat until tomatoes or cheese mixture is used up. Arrange the filled tomatoes on a platter to serve.

name: Chia Pudding With Mango
instructions: In a jar, mix coconut milk, pea proteins, chia seeds, and maple syrup. Refrigerate.
In a blender, combine mango and 1 tablespoon of honey and blend until smooth.
Layer chia pudding and pureed mango evenly among  small glasses.
Garnish with some raspberries and serve.

name: Chicha De Avena
instructions: Pour water into a tall pot; bring to a boil. Add oats; cook, stirring occasionally, in boiling water until a thin oatmeal forms, about 5 minutes. Remove pot from heat.
Stir cold water, condensed milk, and vanilla extract into oat mixture; transfer to a pitcher and chill in the refrigerator until cold, at least 1 hour.
Pour drink into glasses and sprinkle cinnamon over the top.

name: Chicken Adobo With Rice
ingredientLines: 3 cups cooked white rice, for serving
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together white vinegar, soy sauce, and honey. Stir in garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns, and pour into a large resealable plastic bag.
Add chicken and let marinate in the fridge, at least 30 minutes and up to overnight.
Preheat oven to 300°F.
Pour chicken and marinade into a large, heavy-bottomed pot and cover. Bake 40 minutes.
Remove, stir chicken in the pot, then return to oven and bake 40 minutes more.
Carefully remove chicken and place on a foil-lined baking sheet. (Keep the sauce in the pot).
Turn oven to 450°F and bake until chicken turns slightly golden and caramelizes 5 to 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat the pot with sauce over medium heat and let simmer until thickened slightly 8 to 10 minutes.
Return chicken to pot and toss with sauce. Garnish with green onions and serve with rice.

name: Chicken And Black Rice
ingredientLines: 8 oz boneless, skinless chicken breasts (2 chicken breastes)
1 piece fresh ginger, peeled and sliced
instructions: Season the chicken generously with salt on both sides.
Add the coconut oil to a pan and melt it on medium-high heat.
Add the chicken breasts and cook on medium-high heat for 4-6 minutes on each side.
Transfer the chicken to a plate and cover it with a lid. Set aside.
Add the rest of the coconut oil to the same pan, and melt it on medium-high heat.
Add the ginger and garlic and cook, stirring for 30 seconds, or until fragrant but not browned.
Add the rice and give it a good stir, coating each grain with coconut oil.
Add the water, coconut milk, crushed lemongrass stalk, and salt to taste.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, lower the heat to low.
Cover the pan with a lid and cook the rice for 20-30 minutes or until al dente (according to instructions).
5 minutes before the rice is cooked, add the chicken breasts to warm them up thoroughly.
Divide the rice and serve with chicken.

name: Chicken And Cheese Casserole
ingredientLines: 3 cups sharp cheddar cheese shredded, divided
instructions: Heat oven to 375°F.
Cook shells al dente according to package directions.
Cook onion and red bell pepper in butter until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in salt and chili powder.
In a large bowl combine soup, onion mixture, milk and 2 cups cheddar cheese and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Stir in chicken, pasta and green chiles.
Spread into a 9x13 casserole dish. Top with remaining cheese. Bake 30-35 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

name: Chicken And Mushroom Soup
instructions: Melt ghee in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add chicken, saute until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.
Add onion and garlic, saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms, saute until tender, 5 to 10 minutes.
Pour in chicken stock and tarragon, reduce heat to low. Season with salt.
Cover and simmer soup until flavors are combined, about 25 minutes.
Stir cream into the soup, cook until heated through but not boiling. Serve soup with pepper and parsley on top.

name: Chicken And Mushrooms
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Season chicken on all sides with salt and ground black pepper.
Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in an ovenproof skillet. Place chicken skin-side down in skillet and cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Turn chicken over; stir mushrooms with a pinch of salt into skillet. Increase heat to high.
Cook, stirring mushrooms occasionally, until mushrooms shrink slightly, about 5 minutes.
Transfer skillet to the preheated oven and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 15 to 20 minutes.
Transfer chicken breasts to a plate and loosely tent with foil; set aside.
Set skillet on the stovetop over medium-high heat; cook and stir mushrooms until brown bits start to form on the bottom of the pan, about 5 minutes.
Pour water into the skillet, and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits off of the bottom of the pan..
Cook until water is reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat
Stir in any accumulated juices from the chicken into the skillet.
Stir ghee into mushroom mixture, stirring constantly until butter is completely melted and incorporated.
Season with salt and pepper. Spoon mushroom sauce over chicken and serve.

name: Chicken And Pumpkin Pasta Bake
ingredientLines: 6 oz butternut pumpkin, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Toss pumpkin inolive oil and lay out on the tray. Bake for 15 minutes until golden. Set aside.
In a frying pan, heat the additional olive oil and fry the chicken until golden in small batches, setting aside each one as you go.
Return all chicken to the pan with the diced bacon to cook for 3 minutes. Set aside.
Using the same pan, melt the butter and sprinkle flour over the top. Stirring constantly, cook the flour for 3 minutes.
Whisk in the milk half a cup at a time until you have a smooth sauce.
Toss the chicken, pasta, sauce, pumpkin together. Pour into a large baking dish and sprinkle the parmesan cheese over the top. Bake for 25 minutes.

name: Chicken And Sweet Corn Soup
instructions: Combine stock, ginger, garlic, half the spring onion and 2 cups water in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to the boil. Add chicken. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat. Set aside, covered, for 10 mins. Remove chicken and finely shred.
Combine cornflour and 1 tabelspoon cold water. Strain the broth. Discard solids. Return to pan. Bring to the boil.

Add corn, soy sauce and cornflour mixture. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes or until soup thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in egg in a thin, steady stream. Stir in the chicken. Season to taste.

name: Chicken And Wild Rice Soup
instructions: Prepare rice according to directions listed on package.
Melt 1 tbsp butter over medium heat. Add onion, carrots and celery and saute 4 minutes, add garlic and saute 30 seconds longer.
Add chicken broth, and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Bring to a boil.
Cover pot with lid, reduce to medium-low heat and allow mixture to simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 15minutes.
Remove chicken and set aside on cutting board to cool 5 minutes then shred into small bite-size pieces.
Then while whisking vigorously, slowly pour milk into butter. Whisk in heavy cream. Cook mixture, stirring constantly until it thickens.
Add milk to soup mixture in pot along with shredded chicken, cooked rice, and lemon zest. Stir well and remove from heat. Let soup cool slightly and serve.

name: Chicken Bites With Parsley
instructions: Season chicken cubes with salt and pepper.
Melt the butter gently in the pan over medium-high heat until it liquefies and sizzle.
Add chicken cubes, marjoram, parsley, and saute—Cook for 5 minutes on each side.

name: Chicken Caprese
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400° F.
Season both sides of chicken with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Heat a large oven-proof skillet over medium high heat with the olive oil and butter.
Add chicken breasts and cook on each side for 3 minutes. Slather the tops of each chicken breast with the basil pesto, about 2 tbsp per chicken breast.
Top each chicken breast with a slice of mozzarella and a few slices of tomatoes and pepper.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and cook for 10 minutes.

name: Chicken Chickpea Curry
instructions:
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.
Add cumin seeds. Allow to splutter.
Add chicken, ground turmeric, ground coriander, and garam masala. Season with salt. Saute for 3 minutes or until browned.
Add onions, tomatoes, minced ginger and garlic. Pour in 1 cup water. Season with salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Add chickpeas, and ginger and stir to combine. Simmer for 5 minutes. Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Chicken Chimichangas
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat 2 tsp oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute for about 4 minutes. Add garlic and saute 30 seconds longer.
Add in tomato sauce, chicken broth, chili, cumin, paprika, coriander and salsa. Bring to a bubble, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently for 6 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, stir in sour cream and toss in chicken.
Spread some beans onto the center of each tortilla, leaving about a 2 ¼-inch border to the edge of tortilla. Layer with some cheese and chicken mixture.
Fold the sides in then snuggly fold bottom side up and roll to wrap, fasten end with toothpicks.
Fill a pot with remaining oil and heat over medium-high heat. Add tortillas and fry until golden brown on bottom, then turn over.
Remove and drain on paper towels, before serving.

name: Chicken Creole
instructions: Heat pan over medium-high heat. Add oil and chicken and cook about 4 minutes. Reduce heat to medium.
Add tomatoes with juice, chili sauce, green pepper, celery, onion, garlic, basil, parsley, cayenne pepper, and salt.
Bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low and simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Chicken Empanadas
ingredientLines: 2 lb chicken breast, shredded or ground
instructions: Preheat oven to 375° F.
In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and peppers and saute until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cilantro, stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chicken, along with water, chicken bouillon, tomato paste, onion powder, garlic powder and salt.
Bring liquid to a simmer, stirring often. Allow to cook until liquid has evaporated, but mixture is not dry, about 5-8 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
Fill the shells with the meat and veg mixture, brush the shells with olive oil and close them tight. Bake for 35 min or until golden brown.

name: Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Drop in the pasta all at once and quickly bring the water back to boil, stirring occasionally. Cook for 8 minutes.
In a medium skillet bring water to a boil and add broccoli. Cook for 5 minutes.
In a large saucepan melt the 2 tbsp of butter. Season the chicken with salt and pepper then add to the saucepan.
Cook until slightly golden and cooked through, about 8 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
In a pan add the ricotta cheese, heavy cream, Parmesan cheese and stir to combine everything together. Bring to a boil.
Add the chicken, broccoli, and fettuccine back to the saucepan and toss everything together and continue cooking until heated through.
Garnish with extra Parmesan cheese and lemon slices, and serve.

name: Chicken Francaise
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook according to the instructions, 8 minutes.
In a shallow dish, beat the egg. Separately, in another shallow dish, add the flour, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, melt the butter and olive oil. When the butter is sizzling and foaming, the pan is hot enough to add the chicken.
Dip each chicken breast in the egg, followed by the flour mixture. Use your fingers to press on a thick flour coating.
Place the chicken cutlets in the pan. After 5 minutes, use tongs to peak and make sure the chicken is getting golden brown.
Flip the chicken and cook for another 5 minutes on the second side.
After 5 minutes, pour the chicken broth, lemon zest and lemon juice into the skillet. Add wine and bring to a boil. Simmer for 3 minutes.
Serve with spaghetti.

name: Chicken Fricassee
instructions: In a medium skillet bring water to a boil and add rice. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Preheat the butter in a pot over medium heat. Then saute the onion until it turns translucent.
Slowly pour the chicken broth and heavy cream into the pot while continuously stirring.
Add the chicken breast and bay leaf. Cover the pot and let everything simmer for 10 minutes.
Add peas and stir everything and cover the pot. After 10 minutes, take out the chicken breasts and cut them into bite-sized pieces. Then add them back to the pot.
Now take out the bay leaf, thin the sauce with water if needed, add the lemon juice, and season the chicken fricassee with salt and pepper.
Serve chicken with rice and garnish with parsley.

name: Chicken Fried Steak
ingredientLines: 2 tsp salt, plus extra for salting the meat
1 ½ teaspoons black pepper, plus extra for salting the meat
instructions: Beat the eggs with one cup of milk and place in shallow dish.
Mix 3 cups flour with 2 tsp salt, paprika, cayenne and black pepper, place in shallow dish.
Season the meat with salt and pepper. Dip in flour, then milk mixture, then back in flour, coating thoroughly each time.
Place on empty plate until ready to cook. And save the flour and milk because we need them for the gravy.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Fry meat 3 pieces at a time until golden, about 2-3 minutes on each side.
Remove to paper towel lined plate and keep warm. After frying all the meat, pour out all grease except for ¼ cup and heat up the grease.
Sprinkle ⅓ cup of the flour mixture over the grease and whisk it together.
After a couple of minutes the flour mixture will turn brown. Whisking constantly, pour in 2 cups of the milk mixture.
Let gravy come to slow boil to thicken. Add more milk as needed if it gets too thick. This should take 5-10 minutes.
Generously season with salt and pepper. Place meat on plate and spoon gravy over. Serve with mashed potatoes and whatever other veggie you like.

name: Chicken In Spinach Mushroom Sauce
instructions: In a large skillet, add olive oil and heat it over medium high heat. When the pan is hot, add chicken and cook for about 5 minutes on each side.
Season chicken with salt and pepper right inside the pan. Remove it onto a plate and add the sliced mushrooms in.
Add in salt. In about 5 more minutes, your mushrooms should look nice and moist, and dark. Once cooked, remove them from the pan.
To make the sauce, add butter to the pan, allow it to melt and then cook garlic in it until slightly browned  Add 1 tablespoon flour, cooking cream, and broth.
Add salt slowly and taste the sauce to make sure the salt level is to your liking.
Add spinach to the sauce and allow it to wilt. Add the chicken and mushrooms back into the pan and mix in well. Serve.

name: Chicken Kale Cups
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Grease a muffin tin with a little olive oil.
In a food processor beat the eggs until fluffy. Stir in the chicken, pepper, zest, kale, and add the seasoning.
Transfer into the prepared muffin tin. Place in the oven for 20 minutes and serve.

name: Chicken Katsu
ingredientLines: 8 oz boneless, skinless chicken breast. sliced in half horizontally
instructions: Whisk tomato sauce, soy sauce, sherry, Worcestershire sauce, and garlic together in a bowl until sugar has dissolved. Set katsu sauce aside.
Preheat an air fryer to 350°F.
Meanwhile, lay chicken pieces on a clean work surface. Season with salt and pepper.
Place beaten eggs in a flat dish. Pour bread crumbs into a second flat dish. Dredge chicken pieces in egg and then in bread crumbs.
Repeat by dredging chicken in egg and then bread crumbs again, pressing down so that the bread crumbs stick to the chicken.
Place chicken pieces in the basket of the pre-heated air fryer. Oil the top.
Air fry for 10 minutes. Flip chicken pieces over using a spatula and spray the tops with nonstick cooking spray.
Cook for 8 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a cutting board and slice. Serve with katsu sauce.

name: Chicken Kebab
ingredientLines: 1 lb chicken breasts, cut into bit-sized pieces
instructions: In a small bowl, mix together the coconut aminos, honey, vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic powder.
Place the marinade and chicken into a large Ziploc bag and toss to coat. Marinate.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Place the marinated chicken, onion, and bell pepper alternately onto the skewers.
Grill the kabobs for approximately 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken reaches desired doneness

name: Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredientLines: 2 tbsp light soy sauce or (amino acids)
8 oz canned water chestnut, drained and diced small
¼- ½ tsp red pepper flakes, to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet.
Add in diced onion and cook until softened.
Now add in ground chicken, garlic and sesame oil. Cook until the chicken is no longer pink.
Combine hoisin sauce, amino acids (or soy sauce), rice vinegar, sriracha, ginger, water chestnuts, green onions (reserving some for topping the lettuce wraps) and red pepper flakes.
Heath through and then taste and season with salt and pepper, as desired.
Fill butter lettuce with chicken mixture and serve. Enjoy!

name: Chicken Marsala
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Add wine and broth to a saucepan. Heat over medium-high heat, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and let boil until reduced to ¾ cup.
Meanwhile season both sides of chicken with salt and pepper. Dredge each side in arrowroot powder.
Melt half of the butter with half of the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and let sear for 4 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken to a plate. Tent with foil. Reduce burner temperature to medium heat. Melt remaining butter with olive oil, add mushrooms.
Saute mushrooms, just tossing occasionally, until mushrooms have shrunk and are golden brown. Add garlic during last 1 minute of sauteing.
Remove pan from heat then pour in marsala reduction, thyme and oregano. Return to heat, bring to a simmer, while scraping up browned bits from the bottom.
Off heat stir in heavy cream, season sauce with salt and pepper to taste. Return chicken breasts to pan, spoon sauce over top.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Of The Pea
instructions: Use a potato masher to crush garbanzo beans in a large mixing bowl.
Add celery, onion, vegan mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, salt, garlic powder, olive oil, pickle juice, vinegar, and lemon juice.
Season with paprika, nori, seafood seasoning, hot sauce, cayenne pepper, and dill. Mix thoroughly.
Serve on toasted bread.

name: Chicken Orzo Lemon Soup
instructions: Cook orzo according to direction on package. Drain and set aside.
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add minced shallot, saute for 2 minutes, stirring often to avoid burning.
Add minced garlic, continue cooking 2 more minutes. Pour in broth and bring to a boil, then turn heat back down to medium.
Meanwhile, add eggs to a mixing bowl and whisk. Whisk in lemon juice.
Whisk the eggs in the mixing bowl with one hand while slowly pouring in 1/2 cup of hot broth with the other. Repeat this with another 1/2 cup broth.
Whisk tempered egg mixture into broth pot over medium heat. Add chicken and cooked orzo and allow to simmer for a few more minutes.
Garnish with slices of lemon and chopped parsley, and serve.

name: Chicken Orzo Salad
instructions: Bring a skillet of salted water to a boil. Cook the orzo according to the package instructions and cook until dente for about 8 minutes.
Season chicken breasts with salt, garlic powder, and pepper.
In a large non-stick pan, add butter and fry chicken breasts. Fry until they are cooked.
Drain and transfer the cooked orzo intoa large serving bowl, drizzle the pasta with olive oil and fluff the pasta.
Add the diced cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, red onion and feta cheese and stir all the ingredients together.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the orzo salad mixture, toss to coat.

name: Chicken Orzo Soup
instructions: In a saucepan, heat broth and chicken to boiling. Simmer uncovered about 10 minutes until juice of chicken is clear when center of thickest part is cut.
Meanwhile, in 10-inch skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Cook onion, carrots in oil, stirring occasionally, until tender.
Add cooked vegetables, pasta and water to saucepan with broth. Heat to boiling, reduce heat. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Add chicken and parsley to soup and heat until hot. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Chicken Paleo Salad
instructions: Heat the oil in a frying pan then add the chicken breasts and cook for 3 minutes. Then turn over, cover and cook on the other side for 10 minutes.
Place prepared vegetables into bowls, season to taste with vinegar, oil, salt and pepper.
Place in each bowl sliced chicken fillet and serve garnished with some pine nuts and basil leaves.

name: Chicken Parmigiana
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.  Lightly grease a medium baking sheet.
Pour egg into a small shallow bowl. Place bread crumbs in a separate shallow bowl.
Dip chicken into egg, then into bread crumbs. Place coated chicken on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink and juices run clear, about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven.
Pour 1/2 of the spaghetti sauce into a 7x11-inch baking dish. Place chicken breasts over the sauce, then cover with remaining sauce.
Sprinkle mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top. Continue baking until heated through and cheeses have melted, about 20 more minutes.

name: Chicken Patties With Mashed Potatoes
instructions: Add ground chicken, egg, red chili flakes, chopped scallions, chopped parsley, yogurt, salt, pepper, and garlic powder to large bowl.
Mix until thoroughly combined, then divide chicken mixture into balls.
Add flour to medium bowl. One by one, coat chicken balls in flour and set aside.
When all chicken balls are coated, press each one gently into patty shape.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add patties to hot oil and cook 3 minutes. Flip and cook on other side an additional 3 minutes.
Add the cauliflower into a pot of salted water. Bring it to a boil and cook it until tender. Drain and blend until smooth.
Add milk and butter, and serve with patties.

name: Chicken Pita
instructions: Combine artichokes with feta cheese, green onions, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Spoon into pita halves. Divide chicken slices and add to pita pockets.

name: Chicken Rice Porridge
ingredientLines: 1 lb chicken wings, split and tips discarded
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook and stir the onion, garlic, and ginger in the hot oil until fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add the chicken wings. Cook and stir together for 1 minute. Stir the fish sauce into the pot, cover, and cook another 2 minutes.
Pour the chicken broth into the pot. Add the sweet rice and stir. Bring the mixture to a boil. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with the green onion and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Soup
instructions: Heat the olive oil until shimmering over medium heat in a large soup pot. Add the onion, chicken, carrots, celery, and salt and pepper.
Cooking, stirring frequently, until the vegetables are very soft, about 15 minutes.
Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the stock and bring to a boil.
Add the noodles and cook 6 minutes, then add the chicken and cook about 2 minutes more, until the noodles are cooked through.

name: Chicken Souvlaki
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb skinless, boneless chicken breast, halves- cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Prepare kabobs: Combine olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, oregano, and salt in a large resealable bag.
Add chicken, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air and seal the bag; marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Soak wooden skewers in a bowl of cold water for about 15 minutes. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Remove chicken from marinade and thread onto the soaked skewers. Discard unused marinade.
Cook the skewers on the preheated grill, turning frequently until browned on all sides and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 7 to 8 minutes per side.

name: Chicken Tabaka
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Rub the chicken with the salt, oil, and chili powder. Place in a large ziplock bag and drizzle with lemon juice. Marinate.
Coat skillet with oil and place chicken on a skillet skin side down, and place a cast-iron pan.
Cook the chicken for about 15 minutes, or until its skin is crispy and golden brown. Add the crushed garlic, thyme, pepper, and lemon slices.
Roast the chicken for about 10 minutes.

name: Chicken Tacos With Red Cabbage Slaw
ingredientLines: ⅓ cup nonfat plain Greek yogurt
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Combine yogurt, sugar, lemon juice, vinegar, salt, pepper and hot sauce in a large bowl. Add cabbage and toss until fully coated.
Combine chicken and barbecue sauce in a medium microwavable bowl, toss until chicken is coated. Microwave on High until heated through, about 1 minute.
Heat tortillas according to package directions. Fill each tortilla with some chicken and top with the slaw and avocado. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

name: Chicken Taquitos
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet. Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add green chiles and Mexican tomato sauce; stir to combine. Add chicken and Mexican cheese blend.
Cook and stir until cheeses have melted and mixture is completely warmed, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Heat tortillas in a skillet or directly on the grates of a gas stove until soft and pliable.
Place 3 tablespoons of chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla. Fold over and roll into taquitos.
Preheat an air fryer to 400°F.
Place taquitos in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching, and sprinkle with avocado oil.
Cook in batches if necessary. Cook until golden brown and crispy, 6 to 9 minutes.
Turn taquitos over, mist with avocado oil, and air fry for an additional 3 to 5 minutes.

name: Chicken Teriyaki
instructions: Add the rice, a pinch of salt and the measured water to a pan with a lid and bring to a boil over a high heat. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, honey, ginger paste and garlic.
Heat a pan over a medium high heat with a drizzle of oil. Add the chicken pieces with a pinch of salt and fry for 5 minutes.
Add the teriyaki sauce and cook for 3 min further until the sauce is thickened and coating the chicken.
Cook the broccoli in lightly salted boiling water for 5 min or until tender. Drain once cooked.
Serve the chicken teriyaki over the rice with the broccoli to the side. Garnish with sesame seeds and the spring onion.

name: Chicken Thighs And Potatoes
instructions: Mix paprika, garlic, onion powder, Greek seasoning, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
Reserve 1 tablespoon seasoning in a small bowl, cover and set aside until needed for the potatoes.
Place remaining seasoning in a 1-gallon resealable bag with water, 4 tablespoons olive oil, and vinegar.
Add chicken thighs. massage to coat with seasoning, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight.
Preheat the air fryer to 400°F for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, place 1 tablespoon reserved seasoning in a small bowl with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, stir to combine.
Toss potatoes and carrots in and stir until well coated. Combine potatoes and thighs in the air fryer basket.
Cook in the preheated air fryer until potatoes are tender and chicken is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 28 minutes.

name: Chicken Tortilla Lasagna
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, cook and stir until fragrant, about 5 minutes.
Add ground chicken, stirring and breaking into crumbles until browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
Pour diced tomatoes and their liquid into the skillet and add taco seasoning. Stir to incorporate.
Combine 8 ounces enchilada sauce, 4 ounces queso fresco, Mexican crema, and egg in a bowl.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce into the bottom of a glass casserole dish. Trim tortillas to have a straight edge if desired.
Lay two tortillas in the enchilada sauce in the dish. Place some chicken mixture on top and ladle some enchilada sauce mixture over.
Repeat layers. Top with remaining queso fresco and Cheddar cheese.
Bake, covered, in the preheated oven for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 minutes more. Let rest for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

name: Chicken Vegetable Korma
ingredientLines: 6 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
instructions: Heat ghee in a large pot over medium heat, cook and stir onion until tender, about 5 minutes.
Stir garlic, curry powder, cumin, ginger, salt, turmeric, cardamom, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, and nutmeg into onion, cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir chicken into onion mixture, cook for 2 minutes. Stir carrots, corn, green beans, coconut milk, cashews, and tomato paste into chicken mixture, simmer for 5 minutes.
Stir cauliflower into chicken mixture, simmer, covered, until vegetables are tender and chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Stir peas, red bell pepper, and cream into chicken mixture, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until heated through, about 10 minutes.

name: Chicken Walnut Cheese Wrapped In Bacon
ingredientLines: 6 oz boneless, skinless chicken breasts, halved
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Pound chicken slices until they are even in thickness and about 1/4-inch thick.
Spread blue cheese and walnuts on top of each chicken piece. Roll chicken breasts over filling.
Place 2 bacon slices side by side on a work surface. Place each chicken roll at one end of bacon slices and roll bacon around chicken; secure with toothpicks.
Repeat with remaining chicken rolls and bacon.
Heat a skillet to medium-high heat and cook bacon-wrapped chicken rolls in the hot skillet until the bacon is browned and crisp, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Transfer chicken rolls to preheated oven; bake until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 25 to 35 minutes.

name: Chicken With Cheese And Tomato Sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine the herbs in a shallow bowl with salt and pepper and oil. Coat both sides of each chicken fillet with the oil.
Add the fillets and pan fry on each side until golden. Spoon the tomato sauce and cheese over chicken filets.
Bake for 10 minutes and serve.

name: Chicken With Lemon-Caper Sauce
instructions: Cook the pasta in a pot of water accordinign to the instructions on the packagaging.
Mix together flour and salt in a medium dish or resealable plastic bag. Coat chicken in flour mixture; shake off excess.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken in hot oil. 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to a plate; cover and keep warm.
Pour white wine into the skillet; allow to boil while scraping the cooked bits from the bottom of the pan. Add lemon juice, boil until reduced by half, 2 to 3 minutes.
Add ghee into boiling sauce. Swirl and shake the pan vigorously until ghee is completely incorporated and sauce thickens.
Remove from heat and stir in capers. Pour lemon-caper sauce over chicken, serve with lemon wedges and garnish with basil.

name: Chicken Wraps
ingredientLines: 6 oz boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into strips
Freshly cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Mix the chicken with the lime juice, chilli powder and garlic in a zipper bag, leave to marinate for 10 minutes.
Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan on medium-high, fry the chicken for 2-3 minutes, or until cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside.
Add the rest of the olive oil to the frying pan. Add the sliced onion and bell peppers, season with salt and pepper, and stir fry for 2-3 minutes.
Add the chicken back to the pan to warm it up.
Meanwhile warm the tortillas in a separate non-stick pan on medium heat. Once nice and hot, remove from the heat.
Divide the vegetable-chicken mixture and add it to the warm tortillas. Enjoy immediately.

name: Chicken, Spinach, And Artichoke Soup
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat a stock pot over medium heat and add ghee. Add onion and stir to coat, cook 2 minutes. Add garlic, season with salt and pepper and cook for 1 minute.
Add the arrowroot powder to the mixture and stir, then slowly pour in the broth, stirring continuously. Bring to a boil, stirring.
Once boiling and thick, lower to a simmer and stir in the chicken, coconut cream, nutritional yeast, and lemon juice. Raise the heat to medium and cook 3 minutes.
Stir in the spinach in batches, then the artichoke hearts, and simmer another 2 minutes. aste and season with salt and pepper as desired. Serve hot.

name: Chicken-Broccoli Stir Fry
ingredientLines: 8 oz chicken breasts, cut into cubes
instructions: In a skillet or wok heat the olive oil and add the chicken. Toss for 5 minutes until thoroughly cooked.
Add the water and onions and mix together. Cover and cook the wok for 3 minutes.
Add the mushroom, broccoli, tomato puree and stir well. Add the salt, pepper, oregano, red chili powder and stir for 3 minutes.
Cook for 5 minutes or until the broccoli is soft. Serve warm.

name: Chicken-Zucchini Enchiladas
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add zucchini, and onion, and cook, stirring often, for about 10 minutes. Add garlic, and cook 1 more minute.
Add chicken, salt, pepper, and half of the cheese. Stir to combine. Cook until hot and cheese melts, about 1 minute. Remove from heat, and cover to keep warm
Warm tortillas according to package directions. Place some chicken mixture in center of each tortilla, fold tortilla around filling, and place in a baking dish.
Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and broil in the preheated oven about 3 minutes. Serve immediately, garnished with parsley.

name: Chickpea Flour Omellete With Asparagus
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to  350°F. Roast the asparagus for 10 minutes.
While the asparagus is cooking, mix the chickpea flour with all dry ingredients in a medium mixing bowl. Add the water and chives.
Check the batter and add water by the tablespoon if it is not a pourable consistency. It should be like thick pancake batter.
Preheat oil in an iron skillet over high heat. Once it’s hot, reduce the heat to medium and pour half of the batter into the center of the skillet.
Cover tightly and cook for 4 minutes. Add half the asparagus to one side of the omelet and fold the other half over it. Cover and cook for another 3 minutes.
Repeat with remaining ingredients for one more omelet. Serve warm.

name: Chickpea Stew With Saffron And Yogurt
ingredientLines: 8 oz canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a medium-large pot over medium-high heat, combine the olive oil, onion, and salt. Cook until the onions soften.
Stir in the chickpeas, and then add the vegetable broth, water, and garlic. Bring to a simmer and remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, whisk the saffron and egg yolks, then whisk in the yogurt.
Slowly add a big ladleful, at least 1 cup, of the hot broth to the yogurt mixture, stirring constantly.
Return the pot to medium heat and cook, stirring continuously for another 5 minutes or so, until the broth thickens.
Ladle into individual bowls and serve sprinkled with a touch of paprika.

name: Chickpea Tikka Masala
ingredientLines: 15 oz canned chickpeas, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, warm the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and the salt, stir and cook for 3 minutes. Add the jalapenos, ginger, and garlic, cook for 2 minutes.
Add the spices and the tomato paste then stir together and cook for 2 more minutes. Add the  canned tomatoes with their juices and 1 cup vegetable stock into the pot.
Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes, stirring intermittently. Reduce heat to a simmer then stir in the coconut milk and chickpeas.
Cook until heated through. Serve warm, leftovers can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

name: Chile Garlic Bbq Salmon
instructions: Trim the tail and fins off of the salmon. Make several shallow cuts across the salmon's skin.
Place salmon on 3 large, slightly overlapping sheets of aluminum foil.
In a bowl, stir together soy sauce, chile sauce, ginger, and garlic. Mix in lime juice and lime zest. Spoon sauce over the salmon.
Fold the foil over the salmon, and crimp the edges to seal.
If using a gas grill, place the fish on one side, and turn off the flames directly underneath it; close the lid.
Cook for 25 to 30 minutes. Remove to a serving platter, and pour any juices that may have collected in the foil over the top of the fish. Sprinkle with green onions.

name: Chili
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef, onion, 5 to 7 minutes.
Transfer meat mixture to a slow cooker, add tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, and jalapenos.
Add Worcestershire, taco seasoning, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, salt, and pepper and stir to combine.
Cover and cook, adding water as needed to thin out chili, on Low for 8 hours. Serve and top with cheese and green onion.

name: Chili Con Carne
instructions: In a pot over medium heat, add the olive oil. Once the oil is hot, add the onion, red chili, and the crushed garlic.
Cook until the onion is translucent, roughly 3 minutes. Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Add the tomato paste, diced tomatoes, chickpeas, cumin, paprika, marjoram, and stir to combine.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, and serve.

name: Chili Con Carne Salad
instructions: Season meat with salt, pepper, paprika powder, and cumin. Heat 1 tsp oil in a frying pan. Fry the meat over high heat for 5 minutes until crumbly. Set aside.
Mix all vegetables with oil, vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Add minced meat and mix. Serve.

name: Chili Lime Chicken Drumsticks With Avocado Oil
instructions: In a large bowl, mix avocado oil, chili powder, lime juice and garlic powder until evenly distributed.
Toss chicken drumsticks in mixture to evenly coat. Cover and let marinate for a minimum of 15 minutes.
While the chicken is marinating, preheat grill to a medium-high heat. Place chicken on the grill grates, and cook, turning, about 30 minutes.
Salt to taste and serve immediately.

name: Chili Tomato Mediterranean Shrimp Stew
instructions: Warm olive oil in a large skillet over a medium heat. Add the onion and saute for about 10 minutes to soften.
Add the garlic and chili and cook another 2 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes, water, cumin, caraway seeds and salt. Cover and let simmer 15 minutes.
Add the peeled shrimp to the tomato mixture making sure to fully submerge the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 2 minutes.
Sprinkle the chopped parsley over the top. Taste and season with more salt if needed. Serve immediately.

name: Chilled Parsley And Pea Soup
ingredientLines: Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large stockpot, heat a knob of coconut oil. Add onions, a couple pinches of salt, cook for 5-10 minutes until onions have browned.
Add garlic, stir to coat, cook three minutes. Add 3 cups vegetable stock and peas, bring to a simmer and turn off the heat.
Add parsley and fold in to wilt leaves. When the parsley has wilted, transfer the soup to a blender and blend on high until smooth, add the remaining broth.
Add lemon zest, juice, and olive oil, blitz. Season to taste and serve as is.

name: Chimichangas
instructions: Heat oil in a medium skillet. Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, 4 to 6 minutes.
Add chicken, soft cheese, diced chiles, chicken broth, taco seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Cook and stir until mixture is well combined and soft hceese has softened been incorporated.
Heat tortillas in a large skillet or directly on grates of a gas stove until soft and pliable.
Place 1/3 cup chicken mixture down the center of each tortilla and top with a heaping tablespoon of Mexican cheese.
Fold top and bottom of tortillas over the filling, then roll each into a burrito shape. Mist with cooking spray and place in the basket of an air fryer.
Air fry at 400°F for 4 to 6 minutes. Flip each chimichanga over, mist with cooking spray, and air fry until lightly browned, 2 to 4 minutes more.

name: Chinese Braised Spare Ribs
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then add the spareribs, and cook uncovered for 3 to 5 minutes. Drain in a colander and set aside.
Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat. Stir in the ginger, green onions, and cinnamon, cook and stir until fragrant.
Stir in the spareribs and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Pour in the water, soy sauce and rice wine. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cover. Simmer until the spareribs are tender, about 40 minutes.

name: Chinese Corn Soup
instructions: In a saucepan, combine the cream style corn and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
In a small bowl or cup, mix together the cornstarch, yeast and water, pour into the boiling corn soup, and continue cooking for about 2 minutes.
Gradually add the beaten egg while stirring the soup. Remove from heat and serve.

name: Chinese Egg Dumplings
instructions: Whisk together the eggs, cornstarch, water, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt in a bowl, and let stand for 25 minutes.
Mix the pork, water chestnuts, green onions, ginger, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and toasted sesame oil in a bowl.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and let rest in refrigerator until needed.
To make wrappers, spray a nonstick skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium heat.
Slowly pour about 1 tablespoon of the egg mixture into the skillet, and tilt the skillet to spread the batter, forming a flat circle about 3 inches in diameter.
Let the egg wrapper cook until firm on the bottom but still moist on top, about 1 minute.
Stack the finished egg wrappers on a wax-paper-lined plate as you finish them, and let cool.
Stir together the chicken broth, soy sauce, sherry, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and black pepper in a saucepan, and heat to a simmer over medium-low heat.
Place about 1 teaspoon of the pork filling into the center of each wrapper.
Fold the wrapper over to make a half-moon shape, and gently press the wrapper together to seal.
Drop the filled dumplings into the seasoned chicken broth and simmer them until the filling is cooked through, 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with broth.

name: Chinese Egg Soup
instructions: Bring chicken broth and peas to a boil in a large saucepan.
Slowly add egg and carrot, shiitake to the boiling broth, stirring constantly.

name: Chinese Fried Rice
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil, add rice, and cook according to package directions, 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
Heat 2 tbsp oil and saute garlic and onion. Add carrot and corn and saute on high flame.
Add 2 tbsp vinegar, 2 tbsp soy sauce and 1 tsp chilli sauce. saute on high flame for 30 seconds.
Add in cooked basmati rice along with salt and crushed pepper.
Mix all together and serve garnished with cilantro.

name: Chinese Mabo Tofu
instructions: Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl, set aside.
Brown ground pork in a small skillet over medium-high heat, about 5 minutes. Drain fat.
Heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or wok. Cook the garlic and ginger root in the oil until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir in tofu and cook for 2 minutes. Season with the soy sauce and hot bean sauce, stir to combine.
Stir in the cooked pork and green onion. Sprinkle with the cornstarch and water mixture, cook and stir until thickened, about 2 minutes.
Stir the sesame oil into the thickened mabo tofu.

name: Chinese Meatballs
instructions: Combine ground pork, eggs, soy sauce, green onions, garlic, and ginger in a large mixing bowl. Mix well.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator 1 to 2 hours.
Bring a saucepan of water to a boil.
Using a 1 teaspoon cookie scoop or a teaspoon, form pork mixture into small meatballs.
Cook meatballs in small batches in boiling water until they float to the top and stay there for 3 minutes.
Remove cooked meatballs from water with a slotted spoon.

name: Chinese Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Oil a casserole dish.
Place potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water, bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
Drain and transfer to a bowl. Mash potatoes using a potato masher or fork.
Stir ground beef and white sauce together in a bowl, spread into the prepared casserole dish. Layer corn over beef mixture.
Measure about 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese and set aside. Sprinkle the remaining Cheddar cheese over corn layer, top with mashed potatoes.
Sprinkle reserved 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese over potatoes.
Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.

name: Chinese Poached Black Cod
instructions: Pour water and olive oil into a large saucepan over medium heat.
Arrange cod fillets in a single layer in the pan, bring water to a simmer. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Arrange ginger, red pepper flakes, black pepper and green onions on top of the cod and replace lid, poach for 5 minutes more.
Mix soy sauce and sesame oil into the poaching liquid, spoon over the cod. Transfer cod and liquid to a serving bowl, ladling sauce over the top.

name: Chinese Pork Fried Rice
instructions: Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instuctions on the packaging.
Mix rice wine, soy sauce, and cornstarch together in a bowl. Add pork, toss until evenly mixed.
Preheat a wok or deep saucepan over medium-high heat. Pour in peanut oil.
Cook pork in the hot oil in batches until evenly browned, 2 to 3 minutes per batch.
Transfer to a plate using a slotted spoon. Cook onion in the remaining oil until softened, 2 to 3 minutes.
Mix curry powder and water in a bowl to form a paste.
Stir curry paste, spring onion, and salt into the wok. Add rice, stirring to break up any lumps. Stir in peas and pepper.
Return pork to the wok. cook and stir until rice and pork are heated through, 4 to 5 minutes.

name: Chinese Pork Ribs
instructions: Heat a cast iron pan over medium-high heat. Add oil, ginger and pork rib tips, in that order, to the hot pan.
Stir-fry ribs until the surface of the ribs turns golden on all sides, about 5 minutes
Pour enough boiling water on top of the ribs so the ribs are just covered with water. Cover with a lid and cook for 10 minutes.
Remove lid and keep cooking until the water is almost absorbed, 5 to 20 minutes more.
Be careful not to burn the ribs. Add vinegar, and soy sauce. Stir until well combined and cook until sauce thickens, 1 to 2 minutes.

name: Chinese Prawn Toast
instructions: Add prawns, yeast, chestnuts, green onions, ginger root, garlic and salt to a food processor.
Whisk egg white, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sesame oil together in a small bowl and drizzle over the top of the shrimp mixture.
Pulse until smooth, but not pureed, into a prawn mousse.
Trim crusts off the bread and equally spread the prawn mousse all the way to the edge of each bread slice.
Cut diagonally into halves, and lightly sprinkle with sesame seeds
Add oil to a pan and heat up. Add 4 of the toasts, prawn-side down, not crowding the pan.
Fry until toast is golden brown, 30 to 45 seconds, flip and cook bread side for another 15 seconds.
The toasts cook very quickly, so keep your eye on them. Repeat for next batch.
Transfer to a paper towel-lined rack and serve warm with sweet chili sauce.

name: Chinese Shrimp Wonton
instructions: Mash green onion and ginger in a bowl with water. Mix in pork, 2 tablespoons rice wine, soy sauce, 2 teaspoons salt, sesame oil, and white pepper.
Combine shrimp, 1 tablespoon rice wine, 1 teaspoon salt, mushrooms, and celery in a bowl. Add to the pork mixture, stir until filling is well combined.
Separate and place wonton wrappers onto your work surface. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the pork-shrimp filling onto the center of each wrapper.
Use your finger or a pastry brush to lightly moisten edges of wonton wrappers with water.
Fold one corner of the wrapper over the filling onto the opposite corner to form a triangle. Press edges together to seal.
Bring the chicken stock to a rolling boil. Add wontons and cook until they float to the top, about 5 minutes.

name: Chinese Spicy Hot And Sour Soup
instructions: Soak the dried mushrooms in warm water for 20 minutes.
After trimming off any tough stems, slice the mushrooms. With the fingers, shred the tiger lily stems.
Place the mushrooms, stock, bamboo shoots, and shredded pork into a saucepan. Bring to a boil, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce, salt, white pepper, and vinegar. Add to soup. Heat to boiling, stirring. Add the bean curd, and cook 1 to 2 minutes.
Just before serving, turn off the heat. Stir the egg in gradually. Mix in sesame oil. Sprinkle each serving with scallions.

name: Chinese Steamed Buns
instructions: Mix together yeast, 1/4 cup flour, and 1/4 cup warm water. Allow to stand for 30 minutes.
Mix in 1/2 cup warm water, flour, salt and vegetable oil. Knead until dough surface is smooth and elastic.
Roll over in a greased bowl, and let stand until triple in size, about 2 hours.
Punch down dough, and spread out on a floured board. Sprinkle baking powder and nutritional yeast evenly on surface, and knead for 5 minutes.
Divide dough into 2 parts, and place the piece you are not working with in a covered bowl. Divide each half into 6 parts.
Shape each part into a ball with smooth surface up. Put each ball on a wax paper square. Let stand covered until double, about 30 minutes.
Bring water to a boil in wok, and reduce heat to medium; the water should still be boiling. Place steam-plate on a small wire rack in the middle of the wok.
Transfer as many buns on wax paper as will comfortably fit onto steam-plate.
Cover wok with lid. Steam buns over boiling water for 15 minutes.
REMOVE LID BEFORE you turn off heat, or else water will drip back onto bun surface and produce yellowish "blisters" on bun surfaces.
Continue steaming batches of buns until all are cooked.

name: Chinese Style Meatballs
instructions: Combine ground pork, eggs, soy sauce, green onions, garlic, and ginger in a large mixing bowl.
Using gloves, mix together with your hands until all ingredients are incorporated well.
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator 1 to 2 hours.
Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Using a 1 teaspoon cookie scoop or a teaspoon, form pork mixture into small meatballs.
Cook meatballs in small batches in boiling water until they float to the top and stay there for 3 minutes.
Remove cooked meatballs from water with a slotted spoon.

name: Chinese Tomato Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Blanch the tomatoes in boiling water to peel off their skins for a few seconds, then cut them into chunks.
Heat half of the oil in a frying pan. In a medium bowl, whip the eggs with salt, then stir-fry in the pan. Remove medium-well done eggs from the pan and set aside.
Heat the remaining oil in the pan. Stir-fry the tomatoes until the red tomato juice comes out. Season with salt and mix in tomato paste, soy sauce and water.
Add the eggs to the pan, and stir-fry with the tomatoes sauce. Plate and top with parsley. Serve immediately.

name: Chips On A Stick
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and grease with oil.
Slice each potato into long spirals using a spiralizer fitted with the straight-flat blade. Cut each spiral into 3 shorter pieces.
Thread a skewer through the middle of each potato spiral. Gently push down to fan out spiral.
Set skewers on the prepared baking sheet; spray generously with cooking spray. Sprinkle taco seasoning on top.
Roast in the preheated oven until browned and crisp, 17 to 18 minutes. Season with sriracha sauce and sea salt.

name: Chocolate Coated Rice Cakes
instructions: Preheat oven 350°F.
Place rice cakes on rack and toast in the oven for 5 minutes to crisp up.
Let cool completely.
Melt chocolate chips in microwave-safe bowl for 1 minute.
Stir.
Microwave at 15 second intervals until chocolate chips are completely melted, stirring after each 15 seconds.
Spread melted chocolate onto rice cake evenly with back of spoon.
Place on rack.
If desired, top rice cakes with chopped nuts, fruits, seeds, etc., pressing gently into chocolate.
Move to the refrigerator for the chocolate to harden completely.
Store rice cakes in an airtight container in the fridge.

name: Chorizo Black Bean Chili
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, saute chorizo in a large skillet over medium-high heat until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
Transfer chorizo to the pot with the onions. Add black beans, diced tomatoes, corn, tomato paste, bell pepper, and chile powder, stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Transfer to a slow cooker and cook on Low for 6 hours or High for 3 hours.

name: Chorizo Breakfast Burritos
instructions: Cook and stir chorizo over medium high heat until well browned and crumbled.
Beat eggs in a bowl, and add to chorizo mixture. Reduce heat to medium-low, and continue cooking and stirring until eggs are scrambled.
Warm flour tortillas in the microwave for 30 seconds. Spoon mixture into the middle of each tortilla.
Roll up like a burrito and serve with sour cream.

name: Chunky Paleo Guacamole
instructions: Place avocados in a bowl. Squeeze lime juice on top and roughly smash with a fork until thoroughly mashed.
Add jalapeno pepper, garlic, onion, tomato, cilantro, salt, and pepper; gently combine with a fork.

name: Cilantro-Lime Chicken
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together 1 tbsp of oil, lime juice and zest, cumin, chili powder, garlic, salt, pepper, and chopped cilantro.
Combine the marinade and chicken thighs in a bowl or shallow dish. Marinate chicken for at least 15 minutes.
Heat the remaining oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken for 5 minutes with the skin side down, until they're golden brown.
Then flip the chicken and sear the other side for 2 minutes. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake the chicken thighs for 15 minutes.
Remove the chicken from the oven, let it rest for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Cinnamon Curry Tuna Salad
ingredientLines: 7 oz tuna in water, drained and flaked
instructions: In a bowl, mix the tuna, mayonnaise, mustard, relish, lemon juice, cinnamon, curry powder, pepper, and salt.
Serve on top of bread on a bead of lettuce

name: Cloud Eggs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place slices of bread on a hot pan. Drizzle with some oil and bake for 2 minutes on each side.
Separate the whites and yolks, leaving the whites in a large bowl and the yolks in 4 small bowls.
In the large bowl, use a hand mixer to whip the whites until stiff peaks form.
Fold in salt, pepper. Be careful not to break down the whites. Spoon the egg whites into 4 mounds on the baking tray. Make a well in the middle with the spoon, about the size of the yolk.
Bake for 3 minutes. Gently place a yolk into each well. Bake for 3 minutes, until yolks are just set. Top slices of bread with eggs and serve.

name: Cocktail Meatballs
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, egg, water, bread crumbs, and minced onion. Roll into small meatballs.
Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, turning once.
In a slow cooker or large saucepan over low heat, blend the cranberry sauce, chili sauce and lemon juice.
Add meatballs, and simmer for 1 hour before serving.

name: Coconut Balls
instructions: In a high-speed blender, food processor or mixing bowl, combine your ingredients and blend until a dough is formed.
Using your hands, form them into small balls. Put in almonds and roll balls in extra shredded coconut.

name: Coconut Curry
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a medium skillet. Add onion and saute for a minute.
Add the garlic and ginger and let cook 30 seconds, then add the red curry paste and red pepper flakes. Stir to combine and let cook 1 additional minute.
Add the carrots and bell pepper and stir to coat with the spices and curry.
Stir in the coconut milk and chickpeas, then bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Cook for 15 minutes.
Stir in the soy sauce and rice vinegar. Serve and garnish with chopped parsley.

name: Coconut Poached Cod With Ginger And Lime
instructions: On a clean cutting board, thoroughly pat both sides of fish dry. Sprinkle with salt. In a small bowl combine 2 tbsp lime juice and chilis. Set aside.
Set a paper towel lined plate aside for the fried ginger. In a deep skillet set over medium-high heat, add the oil. Saute the ginger for 30 seconds
Remove pan from heat and pour ginger and oil into a sieve set over a bowl. Scatter the strained ginger from the sieve to a plate and set aside. Reserve the oil.
Wipe the pan clean, removing any residual browned bits of crisped ginger. Add strained ginger oil back into the pan and set to medium-low heat.
Stir in coconut milk, fish sauce, the lime zest, and the remaining 1 tbsp of lime juice to the pan. Boil for 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat and stir in the bok choy. Cook for 2 minutes. Divide among bowls. Add the dish and cook for 6 minutes. Remove and add to the bok choy.
Simmer the coconut milk for an additional 3 minutes. Divide the hot poaching liquid into each bowl equally. Top with the ginger, chilies, lime, and cilantro. Serve.

name: Coconut-Pumpkin Smoothie
ingredientLines: 1 oz unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend on high until everything is smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Cocotte Julienne
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Saute the chicken and mushrooms on butter, put into a separate container.
Melt the butter in a frying pan, add the onion and cook it. Add the flour and continue to cook, stirring constantly.
When the flour obtains golden color, pour a small amount of cream into the pan, stirring constantly. Bring the sauce to a boil and cook for 30 seconds.
Lay out the chicken and mushrooms into the cocottes, cover them with cream sauce and sprinkle with the cheese.
Place the cocottes on the grille on the third level of the oven. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Cod Fish Tacos
instructions: Preheat broiler to high, with oven rack positioned 6 inches from heat. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with foil.
Cut lime in half crosswise. Juice 1 lime half into a medium bowl and cut the remaining lime half into wedges for garnish.
Add cabbage, cilantro, sour cream, tomato, cumin and salt to the bowl with the lime juice and use your hands to mix the cabbage until evenly combined. Set aside.
Thoroughly pat fish dry with paper towels and place on the prepared baking sheet. Season all over with chili powder and some salt.
Broil until the fish is cooked through and a thermometer inserted in registers 145°F, about 4 minutes. Remove from oven and flake with a fork.
Divide the fish and the cabbage slaw evenly among tortillas. Serve immediately.

name: Cod With Olives And Capers
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Lightly oil a baking dish. Arrange the cod fillets on the oil. Drizzle a little more oil on top. Season with salt, pepper, paprika, garlic powder, capers, and olives.
Bake for 20 minutes and serve.

name: Cod Zé Do Pipo
ingredientLines: ½ tsp fresh ground black pepper
instructions: Place the salted cod in cold water (enough to cover) for at least 24 hours in the refrigerator. Change the water 4 times or more. Drain well and dry with a paper towel.
Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a large, non-stick skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, cook until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add garlic, cook for another minute, stirring constantly.

Transfer the cooked onion and garlic to a small bowl. Reserve. Cut cod fillets into smaller pieces. Using the same skillet where the onion was cooked, heat the remaining oil and cook the cod over medium heat for about 7 to 8 minutes, turning them at least once.
Remove from heat and shred with a fork. Season with salt, pepper and powdered chicken stock. Stir and add the lemon juice and chopped chives, stirring again. Reserve.

Combine the shredded cod with cooked onion and garlic mixture. In a large pot, cover the peeled potatoes with cold salted water and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until tender (about 20 minutes).
Drain the boiled potatoes and mash them well. Lightly heat the cream and milk together over medium heat. Add to the mashed potatoes and stir until smooth.
Add salt, pepper, nutmeg, and melted butter. Stir well and let it cool. Mix the yolk and set aside.
In a pan, stack the shredded cod in the center of the pan, fill the edges around the cod with mashed potatoes, reserving about ⅓. Make sure the pile of cod and potatoes are almost evenly level.
Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until mashed potatoes are lightly browned. Decorate with olives and serve.

name: Cod-Stuffed Piquillo Peppers
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to to 425°F.
Heat up a pan with half of the olive oil and cook the onions until they are transparent. Add the garlic and stir for a few seconds.
Add the cod. When it start cooking you can press with a wooden spoon and separate the flakes.
Add the arrowroot powder and stir until it has some color. Start adding the milk slowly while you stir. Add salt. Let it cool, then fill the piquillo peppers.
Heat up a pan with the remaining olive oil and cook the shallots until they are transparent. Add the red bell peppers and stir for 2 minutes.
Add the white wine and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the cream and stir. Blend the whole mix and put back on the pan to cook for a few minutes. Season well.
Put the peppers in an oven proof recipient and pour the sauce in. Cook for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Colorful Sandwiches
instructions: Spread the cottage cheese on slices of bread. Top with prosciutto, slices of peach, blueberries and garnish with basil leaves. Serve.

name: Colorful Summer Salad
instructions: Place sliced nectarines and tomatoes on the plate.
Season with salt, peppet, olive oil and lemon juice. Garnish with some feta cheese, dill, and drizzle of balsamic vinegar.

name: Cordon Bleu
instructions: Place each chicken breast on a cutting board between 2 pieces of parchment paper.
Being careful not to pound all the way through, use a mallet or a foil-wrapped brick to flatten each breast to a thickness of 1/4 inch.
Cut ham and Swiss cheese slices in half so you have 4 pieces of each. Stack 1 piece ham and 1 piece of cheese in the middle of each flattened chicken breast.
Roll up like a jelly roll, tucking the ham and cheese inside the breast as you roll.
Secure the ends and sides with toothpicks so the cheese won't run out. Transfer to the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes, or up to 4 hours.
Preheat an air fryer to 350°F.
Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Place beaten egg in second bowl. Place bread crumbs in a third bowl.
Dip each chicken bundle in flour mixture, then in egg, and finally in bread crumbs to coat.
If you notice any spots that are just coated in flour, lightly pat with beaten egg and bread crumbs.
Gently pat each bundle with melted butter and place in the air fryer basket.
Air-fry until crust is nicely browned and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes.

name: Corn Chowder
ingredientLines: 1 strip bacon, or 1 tsp bacon fat
½ large yellow onion, chopped (about 3/4 cup)
⅓ cup diced red bell pepper
4 to 5 ears sweet corn, kernels removed from the cobs (about 3 cups), cobs reserved
4 ½ cups milk, whole or low fat
2 medium Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and large (1-inch) diced (about 3 cups)
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Place butter and bacon into a large, heavy-bottomed soup pot.
Heat on medium heat until the bacon renders its fat, 3-4 minutes.
Add the chopped onions, red bell pepper, carrot, and celery, lower the heat to medium low and cook until vegetables soften, about 5 minutes.
Break the corn cobs in half (after you've stripped off the corn) and add the cobs to the pot.
Add the milk and the bay leaf.
Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a bare simmer.
Cover the pot and cook for 20 minutes.
Make sure the heat is as low as can be and still maintain a gentle simmer (on our stove we had to use the "warm" setting) to prevent scalding the milk on the bottom of the pan.
After 20 minutes, add the potatoes, salt, and thyme to the pot. Increase the heat to return the soup to a simmer, then lower the heat to maintain the simmer and cook for another 10 minutes.
Discard the cobs, the bacon strip, and the bay leaf.
Add the corn kernels and black pepper.
Again raise the heat to bring the soup to a simmer, then lower the heat and cook for another 5 minutes, until the potatoes are fork-tender.
Add more salt and pepper to taste.

name: Cottage Cheese Wrap
instructions: Blend the cream cheese, eggs, salt, cinnamon, vanilla extract in a blender until smooth.
Heat butter on a pan over medium heat. Swirl blend mixture on the pan and cook for 1 minute, until bubbles start to form at the edges and flip.
Cook about 1 minute on the other side and top with strawberriess and cottage cheese, and serve on a plate.

name: Cous Cous
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Place tomatoes directly on the middle rack of the preheated oven and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes. While the tomatoes are roasting place couscous in a heat-proof bowl.
Add green onion and olive oil. Bring vegetable broth to a boil in a small saucepan.
Pour boiling stock over couscous mixture and cover tightly with foil. Let sit for 5 minutes.
Uncover and stir in roasted tomatoes, cotija cheese, lime juice, and basil. Season with chili-lime seasoning.

name: Couscous And Tofu Salad
ingredientLines: 10 oz firm tofu, cut into cubes
instructions: In a saucepan bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add the couscous and salt. Stir once around the pan then cover and remove from heat. Steam and fluff with a fork.
