In a medium bowl, whisk together the almond meal, Italian seasoning, and a pinch of salt. Beat the eggs in another medium bowl with a splash of water.
Add the rice flour to another medium bowl. Coat the salted eggplant rounds in the rice flour, then in the egg, then in the seasoned almond meal.
Set the rounds on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Drizzle on both sides with olive oil.
Bake the eggplant, flipping halfway through for even browning, for 20 minutes.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 3 minutes. Add basil and stir.
Add the crushed tomatoes and stir to combine. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
To assemble, spread a bit of sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch dish, then add a layer of eggplant.
Top with more sauce and sprinkle with the mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. Bake for 10 minutes, serve immediately.

name: Muffins With Ham And Cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a medium size mixing bowl combine the eggs, cream, baking powder, salt and pepper.
Beat the mixture until completely combined. Stir in the chopped ham and shredded cheese until evenly distributed.
Spoon the mixture using a 1/4 cup measuring cup into a  muffin tin with parchment paper.
Bake 20 minutes until the muffins have set and a toothpick comes out cleanly.

name: Mushroom And Zucchini Frittata
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, mustard, salt, and pepper.
Pour egg mixture over in the skillet, top with zucchini, goat cheese, dill, and mushrooms. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve.

name: Mushroom Couscous
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the onion and mushrooms in oil, over medium heat, until all of the liquid has evaporated.
Remove half of the mushrooms from the skillet and reserve for later.
Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute. Then add the couscous, salt, pepper, and veggie broth.
Bring the broth to a boil, cover it with a lid, and then turn off the heat. Let it rest for 5 minutes. Open the lid and add the mushrooms back in. Stir and serve immediately.

name: Mushroom Gnocchi
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the gnocchi and cook for 2 minutes until the first few gnocchi begin to float to the surface.
In a large skillet, melt the butter on medium heat and add the mushrooms and garlic. Cook until mushrooms begin to soften and brown.
Add the cooked bacon, then add the cream cheese and stir until it's melted.
Add the milk, chives, salt and pepper to the skillet with the mushrooms and bacon and stir to combine all the ingredients.
Drain the gnocchi and add to the skillet. Stir to combine and add the Parmesan cheese.
Heat for about 2 minutes until the sauce begins to thicken and the cheese is melted. It will continue to thicken after being removed from the heat.

name: Mushroom Soup
instructions: In a large saucepan, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Saute mushrooms and onion until tender.
Mix flour, salt, pepper and broth until smooth; stir into mushroom mixture.
Bring to a boil. Cook and stir until thickened, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat; stir in cream. and carrot.
Simmer, uncovered, until flavors are blended, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Mushroom Stroganoff
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add egg noodles, and cook until al dente, about 7 minutes. Remove from heat, drain, and set aside.
At the same time, melt ghee in a large heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion, and cook, stirring until softened.
Turn the heat up to medium-high, and add sliced mushrooms. Cook until the mushrooms are limp and browned. Remove to a bowl, and set aside.
In the same skillet, stir in vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, and cook until the mixture has reduced by 1/3. Reduce heat to low, and return the mushrooms and onion to the skillet.
Remove the pan from the heat, stir in the sour cream then blend into the mushrooms. Return the skillet to the burner, and continue cooking over low heat.
Stir in the parsley, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked egg noodles.

name: Mushrooms With Quail Eggs
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Clean mushrooms and remove the stalks. Break a quail egg in the mushroom.
Season with salt, pepper and bake for 15 minutes.

name: Mushrooms, Chickpea, Spinach Stir-Fry
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic in the oil until they start to become tender.
Add the mushrooms, and fry until they begin to shrink, about 3 minutes. Toss in the spinach and chickpeas, and fry, stirring constantly for a few minutes.
Add the vinegar, stirring constantly until absorbed, then stir in the white wine. Reduce heat, and simmer until the wine has almost completely absorbed.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve hot.

name: Mustard Baked Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 375ºF.
Season chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper, and Italian seasoning, and place in a large baking dish with butter.
Top with mustard and cheese, and cover with aluminum foil.
Place in a oven and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Mutton Bhuna
instructions: Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Heat oil in a pressure cooker.
When it is hot, add crushed cloves, black peppercorns, black cardamom, green cardamom, bay leaf and cinnamon and fry for a few seconds.
Add onions and green chillies and fry until they turn slightly brown.
Add ginger and garlic and fry till onions turn golden brown.
Now add mutton and cook on high heat for 3-4 minutes. Add ½ cup water and salt to taste to the cooker.
Put on the lid of the pressure cooker and cook till mutton is almost done. Remove the cooker from heat and let it cool.
Remove the lid of the pressure cooker. Add curd, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder and in the mutton.
Cover with a regular lid and cook on low flame till oil separates and masala is nicely browned.
Add garam masala powder and fresh coriander and mix well. Serve hot with basmati rice.

name: Napolitan Spaghetti
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to the package directions, 8 minutes.
Meanwhile, mince the garlic clove and slice onion, sausages, and bell pepper.
In a large skillet or saute pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute, just until golden and fragrant.
Add the onions to the pan and saute for 2 minutes.
When the onions are wilted, add the sausages and saute for 1 minute. Add the bell peppers and saute until all is cooked.
Add ketchup and Worcestershire sauce. When the sauce thickens, add the pasta cooking water. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
As soon as the pasta is cooked and drained, add to the pan and toss to combine using tongs.

name: No-Bake Energy Balls
instructions: Stir oats, chocolate chips, flax seed, peanut butter, honey, cranberries, and vanilla extract together in a bowl.
Roll dough into balls with your hands. Arrange balls on a baking sheet and freeze until set, about 1 hour.

name: Noodle Pancit With Chicken
instructions: Place the rice noodles in a large bowl, and cover with warm water. When soft, drain, and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until soft. Stir in chicken cabbage, carrots and soy sauce.
Cook until cabbage begins to soften. Toss in noodles, and cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Transfer pancit to a serving dish and serve immediately.

name: Nuggets
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb chicken tenders, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: Place chicken in a bowl, sprinkle with ranch seasoning, and toss to combine. Let sit for 5-10 minutes.
Place flour in a resealable bag. Place egg in a small bowl and panko bread crumbs on a plate.
Preheat air fryer to 390°F.
Place chicken into the bag and toss to coat.
Lightly dip chicken into egg mixture, letting excess drip off. Roll chicken pieces in panko, pressing crumbs into the chicken.
Oil basket of the air fryer with oil and place chicken pieces inside, making sure not to overlap.
You may have to do two batches, depending on the size of your air fryer. Lightly mist chicken with cooking spray.
Cook for 4 minutes. Turn chicken pieces and cook until chicken is no longer pink on the inside, about 4 more minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Oat Apricot Banana Balls
instructions: In a food processor, add the oats, and pulse for 20 seconds in order to break the oats down slightly.
Add the rest of the ingredients and pulse until fully combined.
Roll into 12 balls and refrigerate, then serve.

name: Old Fashioned Potato Salad
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain, cool, peel and chop.
While potatoes cook, place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil.
Cover, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water, cool, peel and chop.
Combine the potatoes, eggs, celery, onion, relish, mayonnaise, mustard, garlic salt, celery salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Mix together well and refrigerate until chilled.

name: Omelet Muffins With Spinach And Broccoli
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
Beat eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper in a bowl with an electric mixer.
Fold in kale, broccoli, and onion until evenly mixed.
Pour mixture into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

name: One Pan Orecchiette Pasta
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add onion with a pinch of salt; cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in sausage and cook until browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
Pour 1 1/2 cups chicken broth into sausage mixture and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
Add orecchiette pasta, cook and stir pasta in hot broth, adding remaining broth when liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes.
Stir arugula into sausage-pasta mixture until arugula wilts. Ladle pasta into bowls and sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

name: One Pot Lemon Garlic Butter Shrimp
instructions: In large pan, heat olive oil on medium high until shimmery.
Add shrimp to pan.
Season with salt if desired, and toss shrimp to prevent sticking.
Add garlic and butter and stir.
When garlic is soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes with occasional stirring to prevent burning, add lemons and chili paste and stir to mix.
Toss to coat shrimp evenly with chili and butter sauce.
When shrimp is just opaque and no longer grey, it is cooked. Be careful not to overcook!
Remove from heat and serve immediately.

name: One-Pan Creamy Chicken & Gnocchi
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Season chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1 tbsp oil.
Add chicken and cook until golden, 4 minutes per side. Remove from skillet. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil.
Add shallot and mushrooms and cook until golden, 5 minutes. Add garlic, thyme, and oregano and cook until fragrant, 1 minute more.
Add broth, then slowly add in half and half. Bring to a simmer and add salt, pepper, and pepper flakes. Stir in gnocchi and return chicken to pan.
Let simmer for 10 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet. Add cheeses and stir until melted, then add spinach and stir until wilted.
Slice chicken and return to skillet. Season with more salt and pepper to taste. Serve imemdiately.

name: One-Pot Shrimp Scampi Orzo
instructions: Combine olive oil, lemon juice and dried parsley in a small bowl. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Marinate for 15 to 20 minutes.
Melt ghee in a pot over medium-high heat. Add olive oil. Stir in orzo and onion, toss to coat, and cook, 4 to 5 minutes.
Mix in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour in chicken broth and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until orzo is tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes.
Add shrimp with marinade to the pot, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until shrimp are light pink, 3 to 4 minutes.
Divide between 2 dishes and garnish with lemon slices.

name: Orange Chicken
ingredientLines: 12 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, sliced
instructions: Cook rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Meanwhile heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir chicken, garlic, and red pepper flakes for 5 to 7 minutes.
Whisk soy sauce, honey, orange juice, and orange zest together in a small bowl; pour over chicken.
Cook and stir until sauce coats chicken, about 1 more minute. Serve over cooked rice. Sprikle with chives.

name: Orange Chicken With Rice
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil. Add rice and cook according to package directions, for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
In a medium pot, add orange juice, vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and red chili flakes. Heat for 3 minutes.
In a small bowl whisk together 1 tbsp cornstarch with 2 tbsp of water and form a paste.
Add to orange sauce and whisk together. Continue to cook for 5 minutes. Add orange zest.
Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture and then flour mixture. Place on plate.
Cook several chicken pieces at a time for 3 minutes and place on a paper towl.
Toss chicken with orange sauce and serve with rice.

name: Oven Fried Zucchini Sticks
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread olive oil on a large baking sheet.
Mix water and flour together in a bowl to form a thick, pancake-like batter.
Stir bread crumbs, herbes de Provence, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper together on a shallow plate.
Dip zucchini spears into the batter. Roll in bread crumb mixture to coat.
Place spears cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet, all facing the same direction.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden, about 10 minutes. Turn to other cut side and bake for 10 minutes.
Turn spears so they are skin-side down, continue baking until browned, about 5 minutes more.
Transfer zucchini spears to a platter. Serve with vegan mayonnaise and ketchup.

name: Paelo Breakfast Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a muffin pan with paper liners.
Combine bacon, onion, and green bell pepper in a medium mixing bowl.
Divide bacon mixture among the muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Crack 1 egg into each cup. Sprinkle chives and a pinch of salt over each egg.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, about 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Bacon Sweet Potato Stew
instructions: Cook and stir onion in olive oil in a soup pot over medium-high heat for 5 minutes.
Add bacon and continue cooking, stirring frequently, for another 3 minutes.
Add celery and carrots, continue stirring and cooking until vegetables have softened slightly, about 3 minutes.
Add cumin, paprika, turmeric, kosher salt, ground black pepper, saffron threads, and garlic.
Cook and stir until garlic is fragrant and slightly soft, 3 more minutes.
Add sweet potatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until sweet potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice, adjust salt and ground black pepper to taste. Blend until smooth.

name: Paleo Banana Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolks, bananas, almond flour, and baking powder.
In a separate large bowl using a hand or standing mixer, whip egg whites until stiff peaks form, 4 to 5 minutes. Gently fold whipped egg whites into batter until evenly combined.
Grease a large nonstick pan with cooking spray and place over medium-low heat. Pour about ¼ cup pancake batter onto the pan, spreading it out evenly.
Cook until both sides are lightly golden, enjoy!

name: Paleo Butternut Squash Porridge
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place butternut squash halves, cut-side up, in a baking dish, fill dish with 1/4 inch of water.
Bake in the preheated oven until softened, 50 minutes. Cool squash.
Scoop squash flesh into a bowl and mash with a fork or potato masher until smooth. .
Stir coconut milk and cinnamon into squash adn top with blueberries

name: Paleo Carrot Leek Soup
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large pot over high heat, add olive oil. When the oil is hot, turn the heat down to medium and add onions and leeks. Saute for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
Add carrots, potatoes, paprika, cashews, turmeric, coriander, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Mix everything well.
Add vegetable broth and bring it to a boil. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes. Using an immersion hand blender puree the veggies.
Taste and add any extra seasonings. Serve immediately.

name: Paleo Cauli Couscous
instructions: Process cauliflower in batches by pulsing in a food processor until it has the consistency of rice.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute red bell pepper in hot oil until hot, about 2 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic and saute until soft, about 2 minutes
Stir cauliflower with the vegetables in the skillet; cook and stir until the cauliflower is hot, 3 to 5 minutes.
Pour chicken broth over the cauliflower mixture, season with salt and thyme. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes.
Stir lemon zest and lemon juice into the mixture, continue cooking until the lemon flavor penetrates the cauliflower, about 2 minutes more.
Remove skillet from heat, add olives and parsley, and toss to mix.

name: Paleo Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Place cauliflower chunks in a food processor and pulse until broken down into rice-size pieces.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, add cauliflower 'rice', cumin, salt, and pepper.
Cover skillet and cook until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove lid and fluff 'rice' with a fork.

name: Paleo Chicken Marsala
instructions: Slice chicken breasts in half widthwise using a sharp knife.
Cover with plastic wrap, pound with the flat side of a meat mallet to 1/4-inch thickness. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 2 teaspoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 3 chicken pieces; cook until golden, about 5 minutes per side.
Transfer to a large platter. Cook remaining chicken pieces in batches, adding 1/3 tablespoon olive oil and 2 teaspoons ghee for each batch.
Cook and stir shallot in the hot skillet until shallots soften, about 1 minute. Add mushrooms, cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Pour in Marsala wine, cook until slightly reduced.
Pour in chicken stock, simmer until slightly thickened, about 1 minute.
Stir 1 tablespoon ghee into the skillet. Return chicken to the skillet, simmer until heated through, about 1 minute. Garnish with chopped parsley.

name: Paleo Chicken Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place chicken breast cutlets between 2 sheets of heavy plastic on a solid, level surface.
Firmly pound with the smooth side of a meat mallet to 1/4-inch thickness. Season on both sides with salt and pepper.
Mix almond flour, oat flour, parsley,  basil, thyme, and oregano together in a shallow bowl.
Whisk eggs in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken cutlets in whisked eggs to coat both sides. Dredge in almond flour mixture on both sides.
Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken cutlets in batches until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
Cover a large baking pan with a thin layer of tomato sauce, arrange chicken on top.
Spoon some sauce over each cutlet. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top and add tomatoes.
Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Chicken Stew
ingredientLines: 6 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic in hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir chicken, sweet potatoes, crushed red pepper, paprika, and sea salt with the onion and garlic in the saucepan.
Pour as much chicken broth into the saucepan to make the mixture as soup-like or stew-like as you'd like it.
Bring the broth to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is no longer pink in the middle and the sweet potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.

name: Paleo Chicken-Cauliflower Rice Casserole
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Trim the inner core of the cauliflower and break into florets. Transfer to a food processor. Pulse the food processor in until broken down into rice-sized grains.
Squeeze the cauliflower rice in a dry, clean dishcloth to remove excess liquid. Transfer the cauliflower rice to a 9" x 13" baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a skillet heat half of the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook 5 minutes per side.
Transfer the chicken to a cutting board to cool. When cool enough to handle, shred into bite-sized pieces. Add the chicken to the cauliflower rice in the baking dish.
In the same skillet, heat the remaining olive oil. Add onion and saute for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and saute until cooked, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach in batches and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper, and remove from heat. Transfer the mixture to the baking dish.
Whisk together the chicken broth, coconut milk, eggs, nutmeg and remaining salt and black pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the chicken and vegetables.
Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool before serving.

name: Paleo Chili
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.
While meat is browning, melt ghee in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper, and garlic cook, 3 to 5 minutes.
Dice 2 tomatoes and add to the saucepan with the onion and bell pepper.
Place remaining  tomatoes in a blender and puree, transfer puree to the saucepan with the vegetables.
Stir green chiles, cumin, chili powder, salt, garlic powder, and black pepper into the chili.
Stir browned beef into the saucepan with the chili. Simmer until heated through, about 30 minutes.

name: Paleo Fish Piccata
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Pat the fish dry, then season with salt and pepper. Add flour to a large shallow bowl. Dredge the fish lightly in the flour, shaking off the excess.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil and 1 tbsp ghee over medium high heat. Add fillets and cook until 3 minutes per side. Set aside.
Wipe the skillet clean, then add remaining ghee to the skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and stir for about 1 minute, add the garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add the broth, mushrooms, capers and lemon juice. Cook for bout 3 minutes to reduce the mixture by half. Return the fish to the skillet and cook for about 30 seconds.
Serve immediately, topped with the sauce.

name: Paleo Friendly Banana Shake
instructions: Puree bananas and vanilla extract in a blender until smooth. Add coconut milk gradually until desired consistency is reached.

name: Paleo Hash
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir chicken sausage and chorizo sausage in the hot oil, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease.
Stir sweet potato, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper into sausage mixture, add chicken broth and simmer, 10 to 15 minutes.
Mix zucchini into sweet potato-sausage mixture and simmer until zucchini is tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Drain excess liquid.
Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and keep the water at a gentle simmer.
Crack an egg into a small bowl then gently slip the egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl just above the surface of the water.
Poach the egg until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
Remove egg from the water with a slotted spoon. Repeat with the other eggs.
Top sweet potato-sausage mixture with poached egg.

name: Paleo Kale Chips
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Oil a baking sheet with olive oil.
Put kale in a bowl and add coconut oil, mix with your hands until evenly coated.
Spread coated kale onto the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle garlic salt, salt, and pepper over kale.
Place baking sheet in the oven and turn off oven. Leave kale in the oven until crisp, about 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Kick Butternut Squah Soup
ingredientLines: 1 butternut squash, peeled, deseeded and chopped
instructions: Melt coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in the hot coconut oil until golden brown, 7 to 10 minutes.
Stir squash, chicken broth, almond milk, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, nutmeg and ginger together in the pot with the onion.
Bring to a boil and cook until the squash is fork-tender, about 30 minutes.
Puree soup with an immersion blender. Add avocado in small batches, pureeing each before adding the next.

name: Paleo Omelet Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 °F. Grease 6 muffin cups or line with paper liners.
Beat eggs together in a large bowl. Mix ham, bell pepper, onion, salt, black pepper, and water into the beaten eggs.
Pour egg mixture evenly into prepared muffin cups. Bake in the preheated oven until muffins are set in the middle, 18 to 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Orange Chicken
ingredientLines: 1 lb chicken breasts, cut into bit-sized pieces
instructions:
Season the chicken with sea salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Dip the chicken pieces in the egg, shake off the excess.
Working in batches, place a single layer of chicken into the pan. Cook for a few minutes on each side.
Remove the chicken from the pan and cover with foil to keep warm.
In the same skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
Add the coconut aminos, sesame seeds, wine vinegar, orange zest, and ground ginger.
Bring the sauce to a gentle boil, reduce the heat, and simmer for 10 minutes, until the volume is reduced, and the sauce thickens and looks glossy.
Return the chicken to the pan and toss to coat. The sauce will thicken as it cools from hot to warm. Garnish with parsley.

name: Paleo Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine peanut butter, stevia, egg, and vanilla extract in a bowl and mix well until a dough is formed.
Roll dough into 12 balls. Place on the prepared baking sheet and press down twice with a fork in a criss-cross pattern.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 12 minutes. Cool for 1 minute before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Paleo Pumpkin Chili
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat a large soup pot over medium-high heat and add oil. Once oil is heated through, add ground meat. Cook for 3 minutes. Drain excess fat and set aside.
Add, onion, garlic and bell peppers to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until they are all tender, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, cacao powder and spices.
Stir in broth, scraping any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Stir in pumpkin and ground meat and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Cook over medium low heat for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve immediately.

name: Paleo Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Beat eggs in a bowl. Stir in coconut milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat, pour in egg mixture. Cook and stir until fluffy and firm, 5 to 7 minutes.

name: Paleo Shepherd'S Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Melt 1 tablespoon coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add carrots and onion, season with salt and pepper.
Cook and stir until onion is translucent and carrots begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Stir peas, garlic, curry powder, garlic powder, turmeric, paprika, oregano, and cumin into the pot, cook until combined, about 2 minutes.
Add extra coconut oil as needed. Stir in ground beef, cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and stir until fully incorporated, about 2 minutes.
Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil.
Add cauliflower, cover, and steam until tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and pat dry with paper towels.
Combine drained cauliflower, ghee, and cream cheese in a large bowl. Mash with an immersion blender until smooth.
Spread beef mixture evenly in a large casserole dish. Cover with mashed cauliflower. Brush beaten egg lightly on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until hot, about 10 minutes. Turn on oven broiler, cook until top is browned in places, about 5 minutes.

name: Paleo Slow Cooker Teriyaki Chicken
instructions: Place chicken thighs in a 4-quart slow cooker.
Mix coconut aminos, dry sherry, water, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic together in a small bowl. Pour over chicken.
Cook chicken on High until tender, 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
Transfer chicken to a serving dish, reserving cooking liquid in the slow cooker.
Serve chicken with a garnish of sesame seeds.

name: Paleo Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.. Place squash, cut side up, on a baking sheet.
Bake squash in the preheated oven until tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Scoop out flesh and shred squash into strands using a fork.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook and stir bacon in the hot oil until browned and cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes.
Add shredded squash; cook and stir until squash is softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Stir salt, and pepper into squash mixture, remove skillet from heat.
Stir egg yolks into squash mixture, without letting the egg yolks touch the skillet, until mixture is creamy.
Transfer squash carbonara to a serving bowl, garnish with basil sprigs.

name: Paleo Stuffed Cabbage
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine tomatoes, chicken broth, 1 clove garlic, and 1 teaspoon parsley in a saucepan, bring to a boil.
Add tomato paste. Fill the can 1/4 of the way with hot water; swirl to dissolve any tomato paste remaining in the can and pour into the saucepan.
Season sauce with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Simmer until flavors combine, about 30 minutes.
Mix beef, pork, onion, 3 cloves garlic, basil, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon parsley, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper together in a large bowl.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add 2 tablespoons sea salt. Add cauliflower; cook for 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon.
Add 1 head of cabbage to the boiling water; cook for 5 minutes. Remove with the slotted spoon. Repeat with second cabbage. Separate cabbage leaves.
Shred cauliflower and zucchini in a food processor fitted with the shredder disk.
Add enough to the beef mixture so there is an equal ratio of both. Stir in eggs and almond flour.
Lay 1 cabbage leaf on a flat surface. Roll 1 tablespoon of the beef mixture into a log and place in the middle of the leaf.
Overlap with the bottom of the leaf; fold in opposing edges and roll up. Repeat with remaining leaves and beef mixture.
Coat the bottom of a large baking dish with a layer of tomato sauce. Arrange cabbage rolls seam-side down in the dish.
Cover with remaining tomato sauce. Cover dish with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling, about 1 hour.

name: Paleo Sweet Potato Casserole
ingredientLines: 1 lb sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Boil the sweet potatoes until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and return to pot.
Pour in the remaining ingredients for the mash and blend with an immersion blender. Place in a 1.5-quart baking dish.
For the streusel, pulse the bacon and pecans a few times in a food processor. Mix with the coconut sugar and coconut oil, and sprinkle over the sweet potatoes.
Bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Paleo Sweet Potato Soup
instructions: Place potatoes, cut sides down, in an 11 x 7-inch microwave-safe baking dish. Add water and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave on high for 15 minutes.
Heat a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add oil, swirl to coat. Add onion, saute 1 minute or until translucent. Stir in cumin and red pepper.
Add stock to pan and bring to a boil. Place sweet potato and stock mixture in a blender and puree until smooth. Pour pureed soup into a large bowl. Stir in salt.
Divide among bowls and serve, topped with parsley.

name: Paleo Taco Salad
instructions: Mix together chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and ground black pepper in a small bowl.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook ground beef, stirring often, until the meat is crumbly, about 10 minutes.
Mix in onion and garlic, cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir spice mixture into ground beef mixture and cook until fragrant, 2 to 3 more minutes.
Combine salsa and lime juice in a small bowl.
To serve, spread shredded romaine lettuce onto a serving platter and top with meat mixture, salsa mixture, cherry tomatoes, Cheddar cheese, and chopped cilantro.

name: Paleo Taro Chips
ingredientLines: 1 taro, peeled and sliced into sticks
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Place taro in a 1- to 2-inch deep dish. Brush evenly with olive oil and sprinkle with salt
Bake in the preheated oven until tops of chips are crisp, about 15 minutes, flip chips and continue baking until second side is crisp, about 15 more minutes.

name: Paleo Turkey Cashew Chili
instructions: Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan with a lid over medium-high heat. Saute onion in hot oil until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Stir garlic and sofrito into the onion; saute until the garlic is fragrant, about 3 minutes more.
Push the mixture to the side of the saucepan.
Break turkey into pieces and add to the saucepan in the space free of the onion mixture, cook for 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir tomatoes, water, and about 3/4 of the tomato paste into the turkey mixture until even in color.
Add cashews, chili powder, cumin, and cocoa powder. Stir mixture to incorporate seasoning, place the lid on the saucepan.
Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer, stirring frequently and adding water to thin as desired, until the tomatoes are breaking down, about 1 hour.
Season with salt and pepper.

name: Paleo Vegan Acai Bowl
instructions: Place mango, pineapple, acai, water, chia seeds, agave nectar and lime juice in a blender; pulse until smooth and creamy.
Pour mixture into 2 bowls and top with banana, kiwi and strawberries.

name: Paleo Zucchini-Beef Meatballs
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Place green onion, zucchini, basil, and garlic in the bowl of the processor and pulse to break up a bit. Add ground beef, salt, and pepper, and pulse to combine.
Place sliced green onion, grated zucchini, minced basil, and minced garlic on a cutting board. Mince with your knife further, until the veggie mixture is very fine.
Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add ground beef, salt, and pepper and stir with your hands or a fork until the veggie mixture is well distributed.
Scoop mixture and roll into meatballs. Place in a baking dish and pour sauce over meatballs to coat. Shake the pan a bit to distribute the sauce.
Bake for 20 minutes, then serve.

name: Pan Fried Chinese Dumplings
instructions: Soak dried prawns in a bowl of hot water for 30 minutes. Drain and finely chop.
Soak rice vermicelli in a bowl of warm water for 10 minutes. Drain, squeeze out excess water, and finely chop.
Beat eggs and 1 pinch salt together in a bowl until light and foamy. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat, add eggs.
Cook until set, about 2 minutes. Flip the omelet and cook 1 minute more. Cool omelet on a work surface, cut into small pieces.
Combine egg, prawns, vermicelli, chives, mushrooms, 1 tablespoon oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, sesame oil, and black pepper in a bowl.
Wet the edge of a wonton wrapper with water and place 1 tablespoon egg mixture in the center.
Fold wonton wrapper in half and pleat the edges with your fingers. Repeat with remaining wrappers and egg mixture.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; add half of the dumplings and fry for 2 minutes.
Pour in boiling water, cover, and cook until bottoms of dumplings are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove and keep warm. Repeat with remaining dumplings.

name: Panzanella Bread Salad
instructions: To make the bread cubes, heat the olive oil in a large saute pan. Add the cubed bread and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Mix everything together and let marinate, covered, at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.

name: Panzanella Salad With Bread Crumbs
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F.
Bake bread cubes for 15 minutes.
Combine the olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a jam jar. Shake vigorously. Alternatively, combine ingredients in a small bowl and whisk to combine.
Combine the bread and chopped vegetables in a large mixing bowl. Pour the vinaigrette over top and use a spatula to thoroughly combine.
Garnish with arugula and serve.

name: Parmesan Creamed Corn
instructions: Cook corn according to the package directions and set aside.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour. Cook until bubbly, about 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in the cream and milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens. Turn heat to low and add salt, and pepper. Stir in cooked corn.
Pour the corn mixture into a small greased casserole and top with hParmesan. Broil until bubbly.

name: Parmesan Lemon Chicken
instructions: Preheat an oven to 350°F. Coat a baking sheet with 1 tablespoon of oil.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes.
Meanwhile mix together the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, lemon herb seasoning, garlic powder, 1 tbsp parsley, and pepper in a large bowl. Beat egg in a small bowl.
Dip chicken breasts in egg, then in bread crumb mixture to coat. Place coated chicken on greased baking sheet and top evenly with ghee. Dress with parsley.
Bake in the preheated oven until crispy and cooked through, about 7 minutes per side. Drain chicken on paper towels to remove excess oil before serving.

name: Parmesan With Fennel
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F and lightly grease a medium baking dish.
Clean the fennel by cutting off the stalks, then cut the bulb in half lengthwise.  Remove the hard core in the middle,  then cut thin slices.
In a small bowl mix together the parmesan, bread crumbs, salt, pepper and oregano.
Line the slices in the prepared baking pan and sprinkle with the parmesan mixture.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for approximately 20 minutes.

name: Parmesan Zucchini Crisps
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a metal baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.
Arrange zucchini in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Place 1 tsp grated Parmesan cheese on each slice.
Bake for 15 minutes and serve.

name: Parsley-Avocado Smoothie With Lemon
ingredientLines: 2 tbsp unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend on high until everything is smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Parsley-Walnut Pesto Fusilli
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a food processor combine all ingredients except pasta and tomatoes, and blend on high until well combined and the mixture reaches a fairly smooth puree.
Stir pasta in the pesto and serve, topped with tomato slices.

name: Pasta And Cheese Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Cook the pasta according to package directions.
In the casserole stir the soup, cheese, and milk. Stir in the cooked elbow pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes.
Garnish with some cherry tomatoes and chopped onion.

name: Pasta Fagioli
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute carrot, celery and onion until soft. Add garlic and saute briefly.
Stir in tomatoes with sauce, chicken broth, pepper, parsley, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add ditalini pasta and cook for 8 minutes or until al dente and drain.
Add beans to the sauce mixture and simmer for a few minutes. When pasta is done, stir into sauce and bean mixture.

name: Pasta Mollicata
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water for 10 minutes.
Add a splash of olive oil to a nonstick frying pan. Once hot add the onion, garlic and anchovies with a splash of oil from the anchovy jar.
Gently cook until the anchovies have melted down and the onion and garlic is just soft.
Add the breadcrumbs with a splash of red wine and the diced tomato. Turn up the heat a little to reduce the juices from the tomato.
Once the pasta is cooked, drain and then add to the frying pan and toss to coat in the sauce.
Finish with chopped parsley and Parmesan.

name: Pasta Puttanesca
instructions: In a medium skillet bring water to a boil. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions and save a few tablespoons of the cooking water.
Heat some olive oil and saute some garlic, red onion, pepper flakes  and capers. Add some cherry tomatoes, sauce and black olives for several minutes.
Toss the cooked pasta with the veggies in the pan, along with the reserved pasta water. Squeeze in some fresh lemon juice and serve hot, garnished with basil.

name: Pasta With Broccoli And Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 375˚F.
Arrange salmon fillets on parchment paper–lined baking sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and slice.
Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup pasta water.
In separate pot of boiling water, cook broccoli for 3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain and pat dry.
Arrange pasta on serving plate, broccoli, salmon,  basil, lemon juice, and grated Parmesan.

name: Pasta With Carrot And Leek
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and prepare the pasta as directed on the package. Drain and set aside.
In a pan heat olive oil and add carrots, leeks, and pine nuts and cook until the carrots become tender, about 5 minutes.
Add the stock and cook just long enough to bring to a low simmer.
Add the cooked pasta and toss. Finish with salt and pepper to taste, and serve.

name: Pasta With Shrimp And Cabbage
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil, add penne and cook according to package directions, about 10 minutes.
In a pan heat oil. Add ginger, red pepper flakes and garlic.
Add cabbage. Stir well to coat the cabbage in the oil and seasonings and cook for 3 minutes until tender.
Add the shrimp to pan and toss to combine. Season to taste and continue to cook until the shrimp turn pink and are piping hot through.
Mix with pasta and serve.

name: Pasta With Shrimp And Mozzarella
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain.
Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat until sizzling. Add garlic and oregano. Saute 1 minute or until softened.
Add shrimp, saute stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.
Add cooked pasta, lemon juice, oil, tomatoes, mozzarella and cucumber.
Stir until coated and heated through. Garnish with basil leaves.

name: Pasta With Tomatoes And Beans
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet or saucepan. Add the onion. Cook, stirring, until tender, about five minutes.
Add the garlic, and stir together until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the tomatoes with juice. Raise the heat, and cook, stirring, until the tomatoes are bubbling.
Lower the heat to medium-low, and cook gently, stirring and mashing the tomatoes often with the back of your spoon until they have cooked down into a thick, fragrant sauce, 15 minutes.
Stir in the beans and the herbs, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Keep warm.
When the pasta water comes to a boil, salt generously and add the pasta. Cook al dente.
Drain the pasta, toss with the sauce and serve, passing the cheese for sprinkling.

name: Pasta With Truffles
instructions: Cook the past in a tall pot of boiling water. Drain after reaching al dente.
While pasta is boiling, melt the butter in a large saucepan or frying pan with tall sides.
Mix into the melted butter the Parmigiano cheese and cream. Add the cooked pasta, toss well, sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Put the pasta mixture into a large serving bowl and place the truffle over the pasta.
Serve additional grated Parmigano cheese to pass around the table also.

name: Pasta With Tuna, Tomato And Olives
instructions: Add dry pasta to the pot of boiling salted water. Cook uncovered according to package directions, about 10 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a saute pan. Add onion, garlic and chili. Cook for 3 minutes.
Add tuna and stir in tomatoes, olives, salt and pepper. Bring to a simmer and reduce heat.
Serve pasta and top with sauce.

name: Pasta With Vegetables Ragout
instructions: Put a large pot of water on to boil and cover it with a lid. Add salt and the pasta shells and cook until the shells are almost done, 8 minutes
In a medium skillet add onion, garlic, and 2 tbsp of olive oil. Cook until tender and gold.
Add peas, carrots, broth and season with salt and pepper. Cook until tender, 5 minutes,
When water evaporates, add butter, cook for 2 minutes and mix all together with pasta. Serve.

name: Pea And Broccoli Risotto
instructions: Put your stock or broth into a saucepan, and bring it to a simmer over low heat with a ladle nearby or in the pot.
Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a wide, heavy skillet or in a large, wide saucepan.
Add the onion and a generous pinch of salt, and cook gently until it is just tender about 3 minutes.
Add the rice and the garlic, and stir until the grains separate and begin to crackle. Add the wine, and stir until it has been absorbed.
Begin adding the simmering stock, a couple of ladlefuls (about 1/2 cup) at a time. Cook, stirring often until it is just about absorbed.
Stir in the diced broccoli and peas. Continue to add broth and stir the rice for another 5 minutes. Continue to add broth and stir the rice for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, Parmesan, stir for a minute and serve.

name: Pea And Mint Soup
ingredientLines: Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Finely chop the shallot, mint and garlic.
Heat the olive oil over low heat in a small pot and add the mint, shallot and garlic mix. Let it cook softly for about 2-3 minutes, until the shallots turn translucent.
Add the peas and vegetable stock. Stir and let it simmer for about 15 minutes. Take off the heat and set aside.
Blend the soup using a stick blender until creamy. Season with salt, pepper to taste, and a drizzle of olive oil. Garnish with mint leaves before serving.

name: Pea Cutlets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F and line a baking tray with greaseproof paper.
Add the peas to a medium saucepan, cover with water and boil, according to packet's instructions and drain well.
Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and saute the onion and garlic for a few minutes, until softened.
Add the peas, onions and garlic to a food processor and pulse until it becaomes a thick paste.
Stir in the chickpea flour, bicarbonate of soda.Make patties and brish fritters with oil. Bake for 15 minutes.

name: Peanut-Raspberry Toasts
instructions: Place bread in a toaster, and bake for 3 minutes.
On the slices of toast spread peanut butter, raspberry jam, and top with almonds and walnuts.

name: Pecan Crusted Chicken Tenders
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
Pound chicken breast to about 1/2” thickness cut into strips.
To make the first coating, pulse ½ cup of pecans in a food processor. Place them in one of the bowls and add both flours salt, pepper and spices, set aside.
Pulse the remaining pecans into coarse crumbs, place them in a separate bowl. Lastly, whisk the 2 eggs in the third bowl.
Coat each chicken strip in the first pecan mixture with the spices, shaking off any excess. Then, dip in whisked egg, allowing excess to drip off.
Then, roll the chicken in the coarsely ground pecans and place the chicken strips on the prepared baking sheet, repeating with all the chicken.
Bake for 8 minutes, then turn each piece continue baking until the outside is crisp and the centers are cooked through, about 6 minutes more.
Serve with tomato paste.

name: Pecan Crusted Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet and season with salt and black pepper.
Combine pecans, vinegar, paprika, chipotle powder, and onion powder in a food processor, pulse until texture is crumbly.
Spoon pecan mixture on top of each salmon fillet, coating the entire top surface.
Bake salmon in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 12 to 14 minutes.

name: Penne Arrabbiata
instructions: In a boiling water add salt and penne pasta. Cook according to instructions.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat and saute the onion and garlic in it until translucent for 3 minutes.
Add pepper flakes, red bell pepper and cook 3 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, oregano, basil, rosemary, tomato paste and mix.
Add the diced tomatoes and tomato sauce, bay leaf, mix and simmer for 20 minutes. Mix with penne and serve.

name: Penne With Zucchini And Tomatoes
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add salt and pasta. Cook according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute fot 2 minutes or until garlic turns golden in color.
Add zucchini, parsley, and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Add tomato sauce and toss.
Mix the pasta with zucchini sauce and serve.

name: Persimmon Salad
instructions: In a bowl, combine arugula, hachiya persimmon, and Parmesan cheese. Toss to combine.
Top with lemon juice, black pepper, salt, and balsamic vinegar.

name: Pesto Bruschetta Chicken
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Add basil leaves, Parmesan, salt and pine nuts to blender or food processor. Pulse a few times until ingredients are blended into a coarse mixture.
Drizzle in 2 tbsp of olive oil and pulse blender until all ingredients are well mixed. Add 1 tbsp lemon juice and again pulse. Taste and adjust salt.
Mix 2 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp lemon juice, salt, pepper and capers together in a bowl.
Slice chicken breasts into evenly thick cutlets and place in greased baking pan. Drizzle with the remaining oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes. Slice mozzarella into four thick slices and place atop chicken cutlets. Return to oven for a few minutes to allow cheese to slightly melt.
Atop cooked chicken cutlets, spread a good sized dollop of pesto. Top with bruschetta toppings and tomatoes. Serve immediately.

name: Pesto Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Season chicken breasts and thighs with salt and pepper.
Melt ghee in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken in the hot butter until golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes.
Transfer to a baking dish. Add feta cheese and garlic. Mix heavy cream and pesto together in a bowl. Pour over the chicken mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven, uncovered, until top is golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes.

name: Pesto Chicken Salad
instructions: Pat chicken breast dry and season with salt and pepper on both sides.
In large cast iron skillet, heat a little bit of oil. Add chicken to the heated skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3 minutes on each side.
Place arugula and tomatoes on a plate, season with oil, salt and lemon juice.
Top with chicken breasts and pine nuts. Serve.

name: Pineapple Baked Rice
instructions: Rinse jasmine rice and place in a rice cooker with water. Cook rice according to manufacturer's instructions, 15 to 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 300°F.
Cut pineapple in half lengthwise. Cut out flesh, leaving a thin layer on the skin. Chop 1/2 cup of the flesh, place in a bowl.
Reserve remaining flesh for another use. Place pineapple 'bowls' on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Remove from the oven.
Increase oven temperature to 350°F.
Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour in beaten eggs, cook until set, about 5 minutes.
Transfer to a plate and cut into small pieces. Use a paddle to fluff the cooked rice.
Cook and stir Chinese sausage in a separate, dry skillet until fat renders, about 5 minutes. Transfer sausage to a bowl, reserving fat in the skillet.
Stir remaining 2 tablespoons oil into the skillet used to cook the sausage. Heat it until you can feel the heat above the skillet.
Stir in carrot for 1 minute. Add onion, peas, and corn, stir-fry until onion softens, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add 1/2 of the rice; stir well to combine. Mix in remaining rice. Add egg pieces and sausage slices. Mix in pineapple cubes evenly.
Transfer fried rice to the pineapple bowls. Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 15 minutes.

name: Pineapple Burger
ingredientLines: 5 oz canned Pineapple, drained and shredded
instructions: Mix the coleslaw with vegan mayo and salt.
Heat up a little oil in a frying pan on medium heat, saute the pineapple for 3 minutes.
Add the BBQ sauce, light soy sauce, cumin seeds, garlic powder, and ground black pepper.
Mix the seasoning and pineapple together, cook for a further 3 minutes on low heat until the sauce becomes sticky then take off the heat.
Heat up a griddle pan and toast the burger buns on both sides until golden brown.
Scoop the BBQ pineapple mixture onto the bottom bun, top with coleslaw, and then the place the other bun half on top.

name: Pineapple Fried Rice
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil. Add rice and cook according to package directions. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
In a medium bowl, toss the chicken with the oil and season with salt and pepper.
Heat a pan over medium heat and add 1 tbsp olive oil. Let the pan heat for 2 minutes then add the chicken and cook, stirring, until the chicken is cooked.
Add the onion, garlic, curry, and ginger and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion softens, about 2 minutes.
Add the carrots and cook 1 more minute until they've softened slightly. Stir in the celery, rice, peas and chopped pineapple.
Season the rice with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Pineapple Pasta Salad
ingredientLines: 8 oz pineapple chunks, drained and chopped
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Add ham, cheese, pineapple chunks, and onion to a large bowl.
In another small bowl, whisk the garlic powder, vinegar, salt, pepper, Greek yogurt, and pineapple juice until creamy.
Pour the dressing over the salad, and mix to combine.

name: Pineapple Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 400° F.
Place the pineapple rings on top of the foil in rows of 2, place the salmon on top of the pineapple rings.
Into the bowl with the pineapple, complete the marinade by adding melted butter, sesame oil, lemon juice, honey, light brown sugar, minced garlic clove, and salt. Mix well.
Spread the marinade over the top of the salmon, making sure it gets onto the salmon's entire surface.
Cook salmon for 20 minutes.

name: Pinto Beans
instructions: Place pinto beans in a large pot and pour in enough water to cover by 2 inches.
Add tomatoes with juice, onion, jalapeno pepper, chili powder, cumin, and garlic powder.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in cilantro, salt, and pepper. Taste the liquid and add more of any of the spices you feel will make it taste better.

name: Pisto Machengo
instructions: In a large saucepan over high-medium heat, add a generous coating of olive oil. Once oil is hot, add onion, salt and continually stir.
Add peppers, zucchini, and another splash of olive oil. Cook for a few minutes then add the garlic.
Add the chopped tomatoes, which will contribute some  moisture.
Cook tomatoes down until they seem to have released all of their water. Garnish with parsley and serve.

name: Pizza Pe Blat De Lipie Cu Legume
instructions: Mix the tomato paste with the dried basil and spread it on the sticks.
Add the tomato slices, mushrooms, bell pepper, onion, corn and olives. Arrange them as you wish.
Preheat the oven to 180°C. Put the pizza in the oven and let it bake for 20 minutes.

name: Poached Egg And Avocado Bruschetta
instructions: Fill a skillet with water and bring to a boil. Add the vinegar.
Add avocado, half the lime juice, the pepper sauce and some salt. Using the back of a spoon, roughly smash the avocado, until chunky but spreadable.
Brush the sourdough slices with the oil on both sides and toast for 2 minutes on each side.
Poach the eggs in the pan of boiling water for 3 minutes, until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny. Remove with a slotted spoon,
Spread the sourdough toasts with the smashed avocado. Top each with a poached egg and season with some freshly cracked black pepper.

name: Poo Cha
instructions: In a bowl, mix all the ingredients of the filling and blend well.
The texture of the filling should be sticky. Stuff the filling into the empty crab shells using a spoon.
Smooth out the surface with the back of the spoon. Steam the stuffed crab for 5 minutes.
Discard the water that seeps out. Cool the stuffed crab to room temperature after steaming.
Heat up a wok with some oil. When the oil is heated, dip each crab shell into the beaten eggs.
Make sure the filling is well coated with the beaten eggs. Transfer the stuffed crabs into the wok and fry them.
As soon as the surface turns light to golden brown, dish out and serve immediately.

name: Pork Chops In Creamy Mushroom Sauce
instructions: Combine paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pat the pork chops dry with kitchen paper then season generously with the spice mix.
Heat olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium-high until butter is melted.
Sear the pork chops for 5 minutes per side until well browned on both sides. Transfer the pork chops to a warm plate and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the mushrooms and stir fry until golden brown, scraping up any bits leftover from the chops.
Add garlic and Italian seasoning then stir fry for another 30 seconds before pouring in the broth.
Add the cream, give a good stir then allow simmering for 3 minutes until slightly thickened and adjust seasoning if needed.
Place pork chops and their juices back into the sauce and allow to simmer for 3 minutes, and serve.

name: Pork Loin With Mango
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Combine chili powder and cocoa powder in a bowl, sprinkle over both sides of pork loin
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and brown pork loin on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer pork and juices to a baking dish.
Roast in the preheated oven until pork is slightly pink in the center, about 12 minutes.
Combine mango, shallot, cilantro, and lemon juice in a bowl. Slice pork loin and top with juices from the baking dish and mango mixture. Top with cheese slices.

name: Pork Stew With Sweet Potatoes
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb boneless pork loin roast, cubed
instructions: Place pork, sweet potatoes, onion, tomatoes, chiles, chicken broth, cumin, salt, and pepper into the bottom of a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on Low for 6 to 7 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the pork should read at least 145°F.
Add lime juice and stir well before serving.

name: Portobello Mushrooms With Bulgur
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Start by cooking the bulgur as instructed on the package.
When the bulgur is cooked, rinse the portabella mushrooms and place them on a baking sheet lined with baking paper.
Mix all the diced vegetables in a mixing bowl and add the cooked bulgur.
Season the bulgur and veggies with salt, pepper, nutritional yeast, tamari, cayenne pepper, smoked paprika, thyme, and garlic. Stir together.
Brush the portabella mushrooms with olive oil and top each mushroom generously with the bulgur topping.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese on top and bake in the oven for 20 minutes or until the bulgur is golden and the mushrooms are ready.

name: Potato And Peppers Gratin
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F and lightly grease a baking dish with baking spray.
Place the potatoes in a large microwave-safe bowl and add 1 cup water. Cover and microwave for 5 minutes.
Drain the potatoes. Spread half of them in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Mix together the bell pepper, garlic, and Parmesan cheese.
Spread this mix over the potatoes.
Whisk together the eggs, then whisk in the milk and some Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour about half of this egg mixture over the potatoes. Lay the rest of the potatoes on top. Pour the rest of the egg mixture and Parmesan over the potatoes.
Bake for 30 minutes, slice and serve.

name: Potato Frittata With Chorizo
instructions: Preheat oven 350°F.
Place potatoes in a microwave-safe bowl, cover with water, and microwave on high for 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain and reserve.
In the meantime, heat oil in a large, oven proof, non-stick frypan over medium heat.
Add the onion to the pan and fry for 5 minutes until softened but not coloured.
Add sliced chorizo sausage and bell pepper. Fry for 5 minutes until the fat in the chorizo has rendered.
Add the potato and toss to combine. Fry the potato in the chorizo for 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
In a bowl add eggs, grated parmesan, and salt and pepper to season. Pour egg mixture evenly over potatoes.
Cook over gentle heat for 5 minutes until starting to bubble around the edges. Put into oven and bake for 15 minutes.

name: Potato Gnocchi With Cheese Sauce
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Cook the gnocchi as directed in heavily-salted boiling water.
Meanwhile, heat a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the fontina cheese, cream, butter and Parmesan cheese.
Stir constantly until the cheese is melted and smooth. When the gnocchi are cooked, drain well and place on individual serving dishes.
Top the cooked gnocchi with the warm cheese sauce and serve immediately with fresh cracked pepper.

name: Potato Salad
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb red potatoes, cut into chunks
instructions: Place the potatoes in a pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork.
Drain, and transfer to a large bowl to cool.
In a medium bowl, mix the sour cream, mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, eggs, pickle, celery, green onions, and hot sauce.
Season with dill, garlic powder, onion salt, salt, and pepper. Pour over the potatoes, and gently toss to coat. Chill at least 3 hours in the refrigerator before serving.

name: Potato Soup
instructions: Heat oil in a pot and add onion. Saute for 3 minutes, add garlic, celery, carrots, potatoes, and spices. Saute for 1 minute more.
Pour in vegetable broth, 1 cup water and bring the soup to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Pour about 1/2 soup into a different pot and blend this part until smooth.
Pour the blended soup back into the large pot, add coconut cream and stir to combine. Let simmer for 5 minutes, season and serve.

name: Potato, Zucchini, And Tomato Gratin
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Coat baking dish with 1/2 tbsp olive oil and sprinkle with garlic.
Arrange potatoes, zucchini, and tomatoes in overlapping layers around prepared dish, and sprinkle with the salt and pepper.
Drizzle with remaining oil, and sprinkle with thyme and cheese. Bake for 35 minutes.

name: Potato-Leek Soup
instructions: Preheat the oven to 390°F.
Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until the onion softens.
Add the potato and leek and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add the stock and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Place bread in a roasting pan. Drizzle with remaining oil and toss until bread is evenly coated. Toast in preheated oven, shaking pan occasionally, for 10-15 minutes.
Transfer one-third of the potato mixture to the jug of a blender and blend until smooth. Transfer to a clean saucepan. Repeat in 2 more batches with the remaining potato mixture.
Place the soup over medium heat. Add the cream and stir to combine. Cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until hot. Taste and season with salt.
Ladle the soup among serving bowls. Top with croutons and chives, serve immediately.

name: Pozole Rojo
instructions: Place hominy in a large pot, cover with water. Add 1 head garlic and salt to taste. Cook over medium heat for 2 hours.
Place pork shoulder and pork loin in the hominy mixture and cook until meat is tender and cooked through, about 1 hour.
Place tomato and guajillo chiles in a pot and add enough water to cover, bring to a boil. Cook until chiles have softened, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain.
Place tomato and chiles with salt, 1 clove garlic, oregano, and cumin in a blender, add 2 cups water.
Blend until smooth. Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve and set chile sauce aside.
Transfer pork to a work surface and shred with 2 forks. Discard the pork bones.
Pour chile sauce into hominy mixture, bring to a boil. Return shredded pork to pot. Simmer pozole until flavors have blended, about 3 minutes.
Ladle pozole into serving bowls and top with lettuce, radish and onion and serve lime wedge on the side.

name: Prawn Omelette With Peas
instructions: Heat a non-stick frying pan. Add butter and olive oil. Once the butter is foaming, add in the prawns.
Season and then saute gently for 3 minutes. Remove to a plate and keep warm.
Break the eggs into a bowl and add the water, and a little salt and black pepper and lightly beat.
While the butter is still foaming, pour in half the egg mixture, tilting the pan from side to side.
Stir gently with a fork or wooden spatula, drawing the mixture from the sides to the centre as it sets.
When the eggs have almost set, scatter over half the pea and prawns. Cook for another minute.
Slide on to a warmed plate. Repeat to make the second omelette. Garnish with some Parmesan and serve.

name: Prawn Soup
instructions: Roast peppercorns, mustard, curry leaves and fenugreek seeds. Add them to a spice blender and grind to a fine powder.
Heat oil the oil in a pan on medium heat. Add onions, curry leaves, garlic and ginger. Stir fry for 2-3 minutes, adding a couple dashes of water if necessary.
Add dry masala and red chilli paste. Cook for 4 minutes before adding the stock. Add prawns and cook until tender.
Add lime juice and coconut milk, stir well and enjoy.

name: Prosciutto E Melone
instructions: Remove the flesh from the rind of the cantaloupe; wrap each piece of cantaloupe with a slice of the ham. Serve cold.

name: Protein Omelette
ingredientLines: 4 oz canned corn, rinsed and drined
instructions: In a nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium high heat and cook chicken with salt and pepper for about 8 minutes or until golden brown.
In a bowl, whisk together egg whites and milk. Stir in spinach and corn. Stir in cooked chicken.
Return skillet to medium low heat and add egg mixture, stirring gently.
Cook, lifting edges with spatula to let egg flow under to cook for about 6 minutes or until golden brown and set on top.

name: Pulled Pork Bbq
instructions: Cut roast in half. Rub each half with salt and pepper, and place in the slow cooker. Pour broth and coffee over the meat.
Turn the slow cooker to Low, and cover. Cook for 5 to 6 hours, or until the roast is fork tender.
Carefully remove the roast to a cutting board. Pull the meat off the bone with a fork
Serve in burger buns.

name: Pumpkin And Chicken Casserole
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, add 1tbsp olive oil, onion, shallots, and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add in cubed pumpkin or squash and cook until almost tender, about 10 minutes.
Add in cubed chicken, salt, and pepper to taste. Continue cooking for about 10 minutes.
In a small bowl mix yogurt, powders, puree, salt, pepper, thyme, and almond milk together and set aside.
In a casserole dish lay in pumpkin and chicken mixture, tomato, and top with the sauce and Parmesan. Bake for 10 minutes.

name: Pumpkin And Lentil Salad
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Place pumpkin on a baking dish. Toss with oil, garlic, thyme, salt and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes.
Bring water to a boil and prepare lentils as per packet directions. Drain.
Place pumpkin and lentils on a plate and serve with a drizzle of balsamic vinegar and sesame seeds.

name: Pumpkin Apple Smoothie
instructions: Combine pumpkin puree, applesauce, apple juice, and soy milk in a blender; blend until smooth.

name: Pumpkin Bread Pudding
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray.
Place the cashews in a high-powered blender with w cups water and blitz until very smooth.
In a food processor or a large bowl, whisk together the cashew milk, maple syrup, pumpkin puree, tofu, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves and vanilla extract.
Arrange the cut pieces of bread in a single layer and pour over the custard evenly. Let the pudding stand at least 10 minutes.
Just before baking, give the pudding a quick stir. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Pumpkin Pancakes
instructions: In a food processor, add all your ingredients, and pulse until a thick batter remains.
Transfer your pancake batter into a bowl and let sit for 10 minutes to thicken. If the batter is too thick, add a little extra almond milk.
Pre-heat your non-stick pan on medium heat, and spray it lightly with cooking spray. Once hot, pour scant 1/4 cup portions of batter.
Cover the pan and allow to cook for 3 minutes, until the edges bubble and are slightly golden. Flip, cover and repeat for 3 minutes. Serve.

name: Pumpkin Risotto
instructions: Turn on the pressure cooker and set it to brown mode and add the olive oil, garlic, and onion. Cook the onion until is translucent.
Add the pumpkin and cook until the pumpkin and until it starts to brown.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil and cook for a few minutes.
Add the white wine and cook, stirring constantly until the wine is absorbed.
Add the vegetable stock and stir well before switching your pressure cooker into pressure cooker mode and use the Low-Pressure setting for 5 minutes.
When the time is up open the lid and add the baby spinach and parmesan and stir to combine.

name: Pumpkin Soup
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and add garlic.
Saute until onion is beginning to soften, 2 to 3 more minutes. Stir in pumpkin pie spice, and salt.
Pour in chicken stock and stir to combine. Whisk in pumpkin puree, cover, and simmer over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Blend soup carefully until smooth using an immersion blender. Stir in 2 cups heavy cream and adjust salt, if necessary.
Garnish with a drizzle of heavy cream and parsley.

name: Pureed Asparagus Soup
instructions: In a medium skillet cook slices of bacon until crispy, 3 minutes. Drain and set aside.
In a pan heat olive oil, add onion and garlic and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the asparagus, potatoes, and broth to the pot and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add the soup in a blender and season with salt and pepper.
Brong soup back to the pot and add coconut milk. Cook for 5 minutes, season with salt and pepper. Pour soup into bowls and garnish with bacon.

name: Pureed Cauliflower Soup
instructions: In a heavy bottom pan, heat the butter over medium heat, add the onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute more.
Add the cauliflower, thyme, salt and pepper, and 2 cups water.
Bring the chunky soup to a boil, cover, reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes, or until cauliflower is fork tender.
Stir in the milk and lemon juice. Once soup is done, blend until desired consistency.
Season and serve into bowls, and garnish with some florets.

name: Quick And Easy Vegetable Ramen Soup
instructions: Using a damp paper towel gently clean the mushrooms then cut into slices.
Chop the shallot, ginger, and green onions.

Heat the sesame oil in a soup pot, and add the chopped shallot, the white parts of the green onion, two slices of ginger and the chopped mushroom.  After 2 minutes, add the rice vinegar and soy sauce.
Next, add the dry ramen noodles then top with the vegetable broth.
Bring the pot to a boil on high heat, uncovered.
Once at a boil, lower the heat to medium and allow the soup to simmer for about 4 minutes or until the noodles are fully cooked.
Taste the soup and adjust seasoning with salt or a bit more soy sauce if needed. Add the soft-boiled eggs.
To serve, add the green parts of the green onion, carrot and fresh sliced chilis for a spicy kick.

name: Quick Turkey Taco Salad
instructions: Cook turkey in a skillet over medium heat until completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes, season with taco seasoning mix.
Add green bell pepper; cook and stir until pepper is tender, about 5 minutes
Arrange salad greens onto 2 plates. Fill tortilla cups with greens, cheese, and onion. Spoon turkey over the each salad. Top with salsa and sour cream.

name: Quick Vegan Eggplant Pasta
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook penne in the boiling water, about 12 minutes. Drain.
Heat olive oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-low heat and cook onions until soft and translucent, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add eggplants and garlic and cook until softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and capers, cook until eggplant is soft, about 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper and stir in fresh basil. Serve eggplant sauce over spaghetti.

name: Quinoa Salad
instructions: In a medium saucepan over high heat, add quinoa and 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Place on a plate, add spinach, tomatoes, season with balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper, and garnish with Parmesan.

name: Quinoa Salad With Goat Cheese And Apricots
ingredientLines: 4 oz white goat cheese, in small chunks
instructions: Warm the olive oil in a heavy 2-quart saucepan over medium heat.
Add the cumin and turmeric and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the quinoa and stir for a minute or two until you hear faint popping sounds.
Add the boiling water and salt.
Cover the pan, reduce the heat to low and simmer until the liquid evaporates and the germ ring shows like a white comma in the grains, about 15 minutes.
Spoon the quinoa into a large bowl and let cool.
Gently stir in the apricots, goat cheese, cilantro and lemon juice.
Taste for seasoning, and adjust if needed.
Sprinkle with the sliced almonds.

name: Quishe Bites
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, and cook 5 minutes.
Add spinach and cook 5 minutes, or until spinach begins to wilt. Transfer vegetables to bowl and let cool. Add cheese.
Whisk milk and eggs in large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Pour eggs over veggies and stir well to combine.
Divide the mixture evenly among prepared muffin cups and bake 20 minutes, or until puffed up and set. Serve with chopped green onion.

name: Radish And Cucumber Salad
instructions: In a small bowl, stir together the olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
In a medium mixing bowl, add the cucumber, radishes, and dressing. Stir to combine.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.

name: Raisin-Banana Mug Cake
ingredientLines: 1 tbsp unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Mix oil, egg, sliced banana, flour, raisins, protein powder honey, milk and baking powder. Give it a good whisk with a fork. Make sure the banana gets crushed.
Pop the mug or bowl into the microwave for 1 minute 30 seconds, using a 1000w microwave. Take it out, turn it round and give it another 1 minute blast.
Serve immediately.

name: Raspberry And Lemon Protein Smoothie
ingredientLines: 1 oz unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Place everything in a blender and process until smooth and creamy. Serve immediately.

name: Ravioli With Spinach Pesto
instructions: In the bowl of a blender add the spinach, arugula garlic, pine nuts, cheese, salt, pepper, and blend. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil while pulsing.
Place the pan over medium heat. Add oil, butter, onion, and garlic. Saute until butter begins to bubble, about 1 minute.
Add lemon, salt, and pepper. Add half the ravioli and stir gently until well coated with the sauce.
Add the rest the ravioli and stir until everything is coated with the butter sauce. Cook for 5 minutes.
Garnish with spinach pesto and serve.

name: Red Cabbage Slaw
ingredientLines: Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Add shredded cabbage and carrots to a large bowl.
Stir together mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar, salt and pepper in a separate bowl, then combine.
Toss well to coat the veggies, then serve.

name: Red Curry Rice And Lentil Stew
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a pot on medium-high heat then add the onion ginger and garlic and let cook for 2 minutes.
Add the carrot and celery and cook for 5 minutes until all the veggies are tender.
Add in the lentils, rice, red curry paste, soy sauce lime juice, and vegetable broth and mix together.
Bring to a boil then reduce heat to low and let simmer for 20 minutes until the lentils are tender.

name: Red Fish Cutlets
instructions: Chop onions and carrots with a knife or a blender, let them simmer in a frying pan with a small amount of oil and cool.
Pour milk over the loaf, allow some time to swell and squeeze.
Mince the fillet, bread, onion, and carrot through a meat grinder, put an egg in there, salt and pepper. Form patties. Roll in crackers.
Fry under cover until cooked, 10 minutes.

name: Rice Noodles With Chicken And Cucumbers
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions, omitting salt and fat. Drain and rinse under cold water.
In a pan heat 1 tbsp olive oil, add chicken breasts, and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes on each side, until tender.
Combine rice vinegar, oil, soy sauce, honey, and garlic paste in a large bowl, and stir with a whisk.
Add noodles, chicken, and cucumbers to the bowl. Toss gently to coat. Top with green onions.

name: Rice With Zucchini And Rice
