instructions: Put olive oil into a pan and heat. Then add garlic. When the garlic starts to color, add the rice. Stir for a while. Then add the water and salt.
Cook over high heat for 5 minutes, then reduce and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet. Add the onion and mushrooms and fry over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring often.
Add the zucchini and continue to cook for 5 more minutes. Season with a small sprinkling of salt.
Finish by adding rice. Stir the ingredients, let cook for 2 more minutes, and then serve on a plate.

name: Ricotta Spinach Rye Sandwich
instructions: In a medium bowl, mix ricotta, lemon zest and juice. Set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Once pan is hot, add olive oil and the minced garlic. Saute garlic, stirring constantly.
Add the Spinach and cook until spinach wilts. This will take about 5 minutes or even less.
Then on a cutting board roughly chop the cooked spinach.
Transfer the cooked Spinach into the ricotta bowl and give it a good stir. Taste and add more flavor if needed.
Place slices of bread in a toaster and toast until done. Spread the ricotta-spinach mixture over the bread and serve.

name: Risotto With Shrimp And Zucchini
instructions: Heat the 2 tbsp of butter in a heavy saucepan with the oil. Add the onions and cook until translucent over medium heat.
Add the rice and stir until it is well coated with the butter and oil. Begin to add the wine, and stir continually over medium heat until it is absorbed.
Add broth and stir continuously. About 10 minutes into the cooking time, add the zucchini and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
Add the shrimp, and continue to cook until the rice is cooked, but remains slightly firm to the teeth.

name: Roast With Gravy
instructions: Heat olive oil in stock pot over medium heat; sear roast in the hot oil until slightly browned, about 2 minutes per side.
Remove roast from pot and place on a plate. Cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot oil until onion is lightly browned, 10 to 15 minutes.
Return seared roast to the stock pot; pour coffee and 1 1/2 cup water over roast. Add beef bouillon, basil leaves, 1 tablespoon salt, and pepper.
Bring broth to a boil; reduce heat to medium low, cover stock pot, and simmer until meat is falling apart, 2 to 3 hours.
Remove and discard basil leaves. Transfer roast to a serving dish and cover with a lid or aluminum foil, keeping the broth in the stock pot over medium heat.
Whisk flour and 1/2 cup water together in a bowl until smooth. Slowly whisk flour mixture into broth until gravy is smooth and somewhat clear, season with salt.
Pour about half the gravy over the roast and pour the rest into a gravy boat for serving.

name: Roasted Balsamic Chicken With Figs
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Mix balsamic vinegar, olive oil, mustard, and garlic together in an oven-safe baking dish, season with salt and pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in the vinegar mixture. Marinate chicken in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Roast chicken in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes. Add figs to the baking dish and continue cooking for 10 minutes more.
Sprinkle lemon zest and drizzle lemon juice over the chicken.

name: Roasted Broccoli And Carrots
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Combine oil, garlic and chili flakes in a small bowl. Toss with broccoli and carrots. Sprinkle with salt.
Spread onto a parchment lined pan and bake vegetables 15 minutes or until tender crisp.
Beat eggs on top of the vegetables and bake for 5 minutes more.

name: Roasted Cabbage Steaks
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Cut the stems off the cabbage heads and then cut each one in half, then in half again. Place the cabbage steaks on a baking sheet.
Brush the cabbage with the olive oil, coating them thoroughly. Then sprinkle the salt, garlic powder, yeast, flaxseed and paprika on the cabbage steaks.
Flip the cabbage over and repeat, brushing them with oil and sprinkling the seasonings.
Bake the cabbage steaks at for about 25 minutes, until the leaves are browned and the center is tender.
Mix sour cream, chopped onion and parsley in a smal bowl and serve along the cabbage steaks.

name: Roasted Eggplant
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place eggplant slices in a single layer on the baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder, smoked paprika, and Italian seasoning.
Roast in the preheated oven until golden and crispy, about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with salt.

name: Roasted Italian Herb Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place chicken breasts in a baking dish. Oil and coat with seasoning.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.

name: Roasted Pumpkin With Burrata
instructions: Preheat the oven on 450°F.
Wash and cut the pumpkin into half, scrap the seeds and then cut it into the wedges.
In a mixing bowl, add pumpkin wedges, add olive oil, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Toss and place on a baking sheet. Roast for 30 minutes.
Place on a serving platter and serve with burrata cheese.

name: Roasted Tomato Soup
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Spread tomatoes, onion, and red bell pepper in 1 layer onto the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle olive oil over tomato mixture and season with salt and pepper.
Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, add garlic and continue roasting until tomato mixture is tender, about 15 more minutes.
Bring chicken broth, basil, and parsley to a boil in a large stockpot; reduce heat and simmer.
Put half the tomato mixture into a blender. Cover and hold lid down, pulse a few times before leaving on to blend until smooth.
Pour pureed tomato mixture into stockpot with chicken broth. Puree remaining half of tomato mixture and add to chicken stock mixture, mixing well. Simmer for 5 minutes.

name: Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs
ingredientLines: 9 oz skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together the olive oil, ranch dressing, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary, salt, lemon juice, white vinegar and pepper.
Let stand for 5 minutes. Place chicken in the bowl, and stir to coat with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Preheat the grill for medium-high heat. Thread chicken onto skewers and discard marinade.
Lightly oil the grill grate. Grill skewers for 8 to 12 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center, and the juices run clear.

name: Rustic Omelet
instructions: In a skillet, saute the salmon, onion, green beans, and 1 tbsp butter. Remove and set aside.
In a small bowl, beat eggs. Melt remaining butter in same skillet over medium heat; add eggs. As eggs set, lift edges, letting uncooked portion flow underneath.
When the eggs are set, spoon salmon mixture over one side, then sprinkle with cheese.
Fold omelet over filling, cover and let stand for 2 minutes.

name: Salad With Mushrooms And Veggies
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a bowl add all the mushrooms and veggies. Drizzle with olive oil then add Italian seasoning, salt, pepper and toss until well combined.
Dump the veggies to a baking sheet and place in the preheat oven. Roast for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are golden brown.
Mix all together and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

name: Salad With Mussels, Beans And Paprika
instructions: Place wine in a large heavy-based saucepan over high heat. Bring to the boil. Add mussels. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Remove mussel meat from the shell. Discard shells. Place mussel meat in a large glass bowl. Add parsley and paprika. Toss to combine.
Cook beans in a large saucepan of boiling salted water for 2 minutes, or until just tender. Drain, refresh under cold water.
Add to mussels, toss to combine. Whisk reserved cooking liquid, oil, juice in a small bowl.
Place in serving plates.

name: Salad With Prosciutto
instructions: In a small bowl combine pumpkin seeds, olive oil, and salt, and cook in hot olive oil for 5 minutes.
Place vegetables on a serving platter,
Top with prosciutto, roasted pumpkin seeds and garnish with basil leaves.

name: Salad With Salmon And Egg
instructions: In a skillet bring water to a boil and add 1 tsp vinegar. Break eggs into a bowl and slip into the water, one at a time. Cook for 3 minutes.
Place fresh spinach into serving bowl. Season with salt, pepper, olive oil.
Top with sliced salmon and poached eggs, and serve.

name: Salmon And Eggs Scramble
instructions: Prepare eggs by whisking together 4 large eggs, milk, dill, salt, and pepper until combined.
Heat a medium-size skillet to medium heat and add olive oil and garlic. Pour in the egg mixture and cook for 2 minutes, using a spatula to scramble
Continue stirring until the eggs have reached desired texture, for about 3 minutes. Season with some pepper, garnish with salmon, and serve.

name: Salmon And Guacamole Bruschetta
instructions: In a medium bowl stir in avocado, onion, garlic, lime juice, salt and pepper.
In a second bowl mix together salmon, remaining onion and tomato.
Place bread in toaster and toast for 5 minutes, until browned.
Spread the guacamole on the bread, then add salmon mix. Garnish with green onions and serve.

name: Salmon And Spinach Patties With Couscous
instructions: Bring salted water to a boil. Add couscous, cover the pot and remove from heat.  Let it stand for 5 minutes, covered, then remove the lid and fluff with a fork.
Combine the salmon, minced onion, spinach, almond flour, eggs, salt and pepper together in a mixing bowl. Mix  and form into 6 patties.
Melt the butter in a large skillet, once hot brown the patties about 5 minutes per side. Drain.
Garnish with parsley and serve patties and couscous with some tomato sauce to dip in.

name: Salmon Carpaccio
instructions: Rinse the arugula throughly, remove the tough stems, trim, and pat dry.
Rinse the salmon thoroughly and pat dry. Thinly slice, then arrange on a plate with the arugula.
Mix the juice on one lemon with the olive oil and salt.
Drizzle over the salmon and serve with tomatoes and Parmesan immediately.

name: Salmon Coconut Curry
instructions: Preheat the oven to 430°F.
In a large, deep pan or pot set over medium heat, melt the butter and add the onion.
In a large, deep pan or pot set over medium heat, melt the butter and add the onion.
Cook for a few minutes until soft and translucent. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds.
Add all the spices and cook for a minute until the pan looks dry and smells aromatic.
Stir the tomato paste in and cook for another minute then pour in the coconut milk and stock.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper then reduce the heat and allow to simmer for 10 minutes until the sauce is slightly reduced.
Drizzle oil over the salmon and season generously with salt and pepper.
Place in a hot oven and allow to roast for 5 minutes until the salmon is firm but not fully cooked. Remove from the oven and set aside.
Once the sauce has reduced slightly, add the salmon to the sauce and allow to simmer for another 5 minutes until the salmon is just cooked but still juicy.

name: Salmon Curry
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add green beans and saute until nearly tender, about 3 minutes. Pour in stock and bring to a boil.
Add salmon, curry powder, and garlic powder. Add coconut cream, reduce heat, and simmer, 3 to 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.

name: Salmon Florentine
ingredientLines: 12 oz frozen and chopped spinach, thawed, drained and patted dry
¼ tsp crushed red pepper flakes
12 oz salmon fillet (if from frozen, thaw first)
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and cook green onions in until soft for about 1-2 minutes.
Add in garlic and let it cook for a minute.
Add the spinach, tomatoes, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper.
Cook, stirring, for 2 more minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes.
Stir in the ricotta and set aside.
Keep warm.
In another pan, melt butter and fry salmon fillet until brown on both sides.
Turn off heat and season with ground pepper on top.
Drain from oil and transfer on top of the cooked veggies.
Enjoy!

name: Salmon Omelet
instructions: In a skillet, saute the salmon, onion, and green beans with 1 tbsp butter. Remove and set aside.
In a small bowl, beat eggs. Melt remaining butter in same skillet over medium heat; add eggs. As eggs set, lift edges, letting uncooked portion flow underneath.
When the eggs are set, spoon salmon mixture over one side, then sprinkle with cheese and pepper. Cover and let stand for 1 minute.

name: Salmon Risotto
instructions: Place stock in a medium saucepan and bring to the boil on high. Reduce heat and keep warm.
Melt butter in a large, heavy-based saucepan on medium. Saute onion 3 minutes, until tender.
Add rice, stirring for 1 minute to coat well. Pour in wine and simmer for 1 minute, until absorbed.
Add stock, 1 cup at a time, stirring, making sure all stock is absorbed.
Remove risotto from heat. Stir in half the salmon and Parmesan through. Season to taste.
Divide among serving bowls and top with remaining salmon.

name: Salmon Sashimi
instructions: Cut wafer-thin slices on the diagonal, as you would smoked salmon.
Arrange a layer of the salmon over a large shallow dish, then spoon over a little of the lemon juice and olive oil.
Season with black pepper.

name: Salmon Soup
instructions: Melt the butter in a large, heavy-bottomed pot and saute the leek for 5 minutes over medium heat until it softens.
Add the carrot and potatoes to the pot, then cover them with the fish stock. Continue to cook for 10 minutes until the potatoes are almost fork-tender.
Add the salmon chunks and double cream to the pot and simmer for 5 minutes, until the salmon is cooked through.
Stir in the parsley and simmer for another minute. Season to taste and serve.

name: Salmon Steak With Orange Sauce
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, folding up the edges to keep sauce in.
Combine orange juice, oil, zest, soy sauce, and honey in a bowl. Whisk well.
Pour a few spoonfuls of sauce on the prepared baking pan. Place salmon skin up and pour remaining sauce over it.
Bake for about 5 minutes and carefully flip salmon skin down. Spoon some sauce over the top of the salmon.
Bake for 20 minutes, until salmon, is done.

name: Salmon Teriyaki
instructions: In a small saucepan bring soy sauce, mirin, garlic and ginger to a gentle boil. Lower the heat and simmer, uncovered, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
In a medium skillet bring water to a boil and cook rice according to package directions. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
Heat 1 tbsp oil, add spinach and 1 tbsp water. Cover pan and leave it for 2 minutes. Uncover and stir. Spinach will be mostly wilted.
Add salmon on a pan and cook 5 minutes on each side. Place it in salmon sauce.
Serve rice with salmon and spinach, topped with sesame seeds and avocado slices.

name: Salmon Teriyaki Kebabs
instructions: Combine teriyaki sauce, soy sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic powder, ginger, and sesame seeds in a large glass bowl.
Add salmon and pineapple to the marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Thread salmon, bell peppers, onion, and tomatoes onto skewers and place on the prepared baking sheet. Cover wooden skewer ends with aluminum foil.
Bake skewers in the preheated oven just until salmon flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes.

name: Salmon Vegetable Soup
instructions: Add oil, onion, potato, carrot, and salt to a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until veggies are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add in the tomato paste, coconut milk, broth, and salmon. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring regularly, making sure fish gets fully cooked.
Taste and salt more if needed. Serve.

name: Salmon With Cauliflower And Broccoli
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Arrange broccoli and cauliflower florets on a sheet pan. Season with olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes.
Remove sheet pan from oven and arrange salmon fillets in the centre of the pan.
Season the salmon with olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Bake for an additional 10 minutes.

name: Salmon With Mashed Sweet Potato
ingredientLines: 2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Place sweet potato chunks in a large pot. Add about 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, cover and reduce heat. Allow to simmer for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium-high. Once hot, place salmon skin side down and allow to cook for 5 minutes.
Flip salmon and turn off heat, allowing to cook for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from pan and set aside.
By now, the potatoes should be ready. Drain most of the water, leaving about 1/2 cup of water in the pot.
Season with salt and pepper, then mash together with a potato masher.
Plate sweet potato mash and top with salmon.

name: Salmon With Spinach And Cream
instructions: Heat the oil in a pan, season the salmon on both sides, then fry for 5 minutes on each side until golden.
Leave to rest on a plate while you cook the spinach.
Tip the leaves into the hot pan, season well, then cover and leave to wilt, stirring once or twice. Spoon the spinach onto plates, then top with the salmon.
Gently heat cream in the pan with a squeeze of the lemon juice, and season to taste.
Spoon the sauce over the fish, then serve with lemon wedges.

name: Salmon With Spinach And Roquefort
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place fresh spinach in an iron skillet. Add about 3 tbsp water, garlic powder, salt, and olive oil. Put a lid over it. Simmer until wilted.
Season salmon with salt and pepper and place on a skillet with the spinach. Top with some roquefort cheese and bake for 20 minutes.

name: Salmon-Artichoke Kebabs
instructions: To assemble, thread 1 artichoke, 1 piece of salmon, and repeat on each toothpick.

name: Satsivi Chicken
instructions: Place the chicken in a medium pot cover with 4 cups of cold water, add a bay leaf, and 2 tspof salt. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 more minutes.
Remove the pot from the stove, discard the bay leaf and drain the liquid, reserving about 1 1/2 cups of it.
Slice the chicken into 3/4 inch thick strips and return to the pot.
Melt the butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent, not brown, for about 5 minutes.
Add the spices and cook stirring for 1 more minute, then remove from the heat.
In a food processor, combine the walnuts, garlic, and spiced onion, pulse until finely ground.
Start slowly adding the reserved chicken broth until your sauce is smooth and velvety.
Pour the walnut sauce over the chicken and return the pot to the stove. Bring to a simmer. Adjust the seasoning to taste and simmer for 3 minutes.
Serve cold or slightly warm drizzled with chili oil.

name: Saucy Chicken Puttanesca
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels, then season all over with salt. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high until shimmering.
Cook chicken, turning occasionally, for 7 minutes.  Transfer chicken to a plate. Spoon out all but 3 tbsp fat from pan.
Reduce heat to medium and add garlic and anchovies to skillet. Cook, stirring often, for 2 minutes. Sprinkle in red pepper flakes, then stir in tomato paste.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until tomato paste begins to split and stick to pan, about 3 minutes. Add olives, wine, capers, and bay leaves. Cook for 5 minutes.
Snuggle chicken into sauce in a single layer. Pour in 1 cup water and bring to a simmer. Transfer skillet to oven and bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a platter and spoon sauce over. Drizzle with oil and serve immediately.

name: Sauerkraut Soup
instructions: Drain the sauerkraut and squeeze out any excess liquid.
Heat oil in a pot and add the chopped onion pieces and saute on medium heat for around 5 minutes.
Add the chopped potato and garlic. Saute them for 2 minutes as well.
Next, add the tomato paste and paprika powder. Stir everything together.
Now add the sauerkraut to the pot and give everything a stir. Then pour in enough vegetable broth so that it covers the contents in the pot.
Bring the contents of the pot to a boil, then place the lid on the pot and turn down the heat. Let the soup simmer for around 20 minutes.
Add sliced tomato, salt and pepper to taste and remove the pot from the heat.

name: Sausage And Broccoli Frittata
instructions: Heat oven to 400° F.
In a large bowl, beat the eggs with ¼ teaspoon each salt and pepper.
Heat the remaining tablespoon of oil in a medium cast-iron, add sausage and cook until browned through, 5 minutes.
Add the broccoli to the skillet and cook until softened, 3 minutes. Add the egg mixture and cook, stirring gently, until beginning to set, 2 minutes more.
Transfer the skillet to oven and bake until the frittata is set in the center, 10 minutes.

name: Sausage Apple Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Place sausage in a skillet. Add Apple and onion and saute, until sausage is cooked through.
In a casserole dish add sausage, ham, apples. Pour in pumpkin puree, season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with cheddar cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes and serve.

name: Savory Buckwheat Crepes With Eggs
instructions: Mix together theflour, 1 egg, salt and milk with a blender.  Warm a large skillet over a medium-high heat. When warm, add the butter.
Pour ¼ cup of the mixture into the warm skillet and swirl. Fill any gaps with a little extra batter.
After a couple minutes, turn the crepe over with a spatula. Cook a couple more minutes on the other side.
Remove to a plate with a clean dish towel on top and cover with the towel. Repeat with the rest of the batter - you should get 4 crepes.
Grate the cheese and separate into 4 piles. Break up the ham if larger pieces. Fry the eggs in a medium-high heat skillet with oil.
Re-heat a crepe in the skillet. Add the cheese in the middle, leaving, top with the ham then the egg leaving the sides without any filling.
Fold in two opposite sides over the filling but leaving the yolk of the egg visible. Fold in the two other sides so that you form a pocket. Repeat with rest of crepes.

name: Savory Coconut Rice
instructions: Melt coconut oil in a medium saute pan on medium low heat. Add the finely chopped onion and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic, cayenne, and salt, and cook a minute more.
Stir the rice into the onion mixture to coat with the butter and cook for 3 more minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in water and coconut water.
Addcinnamon. Increase heat to bring the rice mixture to a simmer. Lower the heat the low, cover, and simmer gently for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat and let the rice steam in the residual heat, covered, for 10 more minutes. Fluff with a fork and serve immediately.

name: Savory Oat Risotto
instructions: Heat chicken stock in a small saucepan over medium heat until simmering, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cover to keep warm.
Measure out 2 tablespoons spring onion tops and reserve.
Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a large skillet over medium heat until melted.
Add remaining spring onions to the skillet, cook and stir until wilted, about 1 minute.
Add spring garlic, cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir oats into the skillet for 30 seconds. Add 2 tablespoons butter; cook and stir until oats are toasted, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Pour in wine; cook and stir until wine has evaporated, about 3 minutes.
Ladle enough chicken stock into the skillet to cover oats, cook, stirring often, until stock is nearly absorbed, about 3 minutes.
Repeat with remaining stock, stirring often until each addition is nearly absorbed before adding more, until oats are tender and creamy, about 24 minutes.
Stir in reserved spring onion tops and cook, about 1 minute.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in ghee and Parmesan cheese until melted, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Savory Summer Squash Waffles
instructions: Shred the squash and zucchini, sprinkle with sea salt, and set aside for 10 minutes.
In a large bowl beat together the eggs, almond flour, and herbs.
Fold a paper towel around the squash and squeeze out as much of the liquid as possible.
Place the squash in the bowl with the almond flour mixture and use your hands to combine.
Grease the waffle iron to the manufacturer's specifications and preheat it to medium.
Place a heaping ½ cup of the squash mixture into the center of the waffle iron.
Use the back of a measuring cup or spoon the gently spread and press the mixture into the iron.
Close the lid and allow to cook for 7 to 10 minutes.
The waffle will be a lovely golden brown color and cooked all the way through when done.
Use a spatula to gently lift the waffle off the iron.
Repeat with the rest of the mixture.
Serve warm.

name: Savory Vegan Dumpling
instructions: Combine warm water and yeast in a small bowl and allow to sit until frothy, 10 to 15 minutes.
Place mushrooms and tomatoes in a bowl and cover with warm water; let stand for 5 minutes. Drain mushrooms and tomatoes, chop coarsely, and set aside.
Combine flour and cane sugar together in a large bowl. Add yeast mixture and olive oil. Stir well until mixture becomes kneadable, knead until well-blended.
Add another 1 or 2 tablespoons of water only if needed to make dough moist enough. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead well for 5 minutes.
Grease a bowl with olive oil. Form dough into a ball and place in the bowl, roll around to coat with oil.
Cover the bowl with a damp towel and allow dough to rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
While dough rises, heat canola oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly golden, 1 to 2 minutes.
Add green onions and cook for 1 minute. Add celery and cook for 1 minute. Add drained and chopped mushrooms and tomatoes, cook for 1 minute.
Add zucchini and cook for 1 minute. Add bok choy and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach and cover the pan. Cook until wilted, 3 to 5 minutes.
While vegetables cook, combine miso paste, nutritional yeast, tamari, and liquid aminos in a bowl. Add mixture to the saucepan with the vegetables and mix well.
Remove saucepan from heat and allow dumpling filling to cool until safe to handle, 10 to 15 minutes.
Punch dough down in the bowl, let rest 15 minutes more. Transfer dough to a floured work surface and roll into a log.
Cut log into 12 even pieces. Use a rolling pin to roll each piece into a  circle.
Place steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
Bring water to a boil. Steam dumplings until they appear shiny, 10 to 12 minutes.

name: Scampi With Butter And Lemon
instructions: In a skillet, saute garlic in butter and oil for 2 minutes.
Add the shrimp, lemon juice, and pepper. Cook and stir until the shrimp turn pink, 5 minutes.

name: Scramble A La Mexicana
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large frying pan on medium high heat. Add the onions and brown them for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and peppers and cook for 4 mintues.
Add the oregano and jalapeño. Crack eggs directly into the pan with the sauce. Add salt. Stir the mixture to scramble the eggs.
Remove from heat when the eggs are cooked to the desired consistency. Serve immediately, topped with cilantro.

name: Scrambled Eggs Sandwiches
instructions: Crack the eggs into a medium bowl and add the milk or water. Whisk until smooth and combined, with no streaks of egg white remaining.
Brush a small nonstick skillet with olive oil and bring to a medium heat.
Pour in the eggs, and let them cook for a few seconds without stirring.
Pull a rubber spatula across the bottom of the pan to form large, soft curds of scrambled eggs.
Continue cooking over medium-low heat, folding and stirring the eggs every few seconds.
Remove the pan from the heat when the eggs are mostly set, but a little liquid egg remains.
Season to taste with salt and pepper and garnish with chopped onions, and serve on the slices of bread.

name: Scrambled Eggs With Kale And Mozzarella
instructions: Heat olive oil in a stick-free frying pan on medium high heat. When the oil is hot, add the chopped onion and red pepper flakes. Cook for one minute.
Add the thinly sliced kale to the pan, toss with the onions and olive oil. Cook for a few minutes, until the kale is just wilted.
Lower the heat to medium. Add the beaten eggs to the pan. Stir until the eggs begin to set.
Stir in the shredded mozzarella cheese and Italian seasoning.
Remove from heat and continue to stir a few times until the cheese is melted and the eggs are cooked. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

name: Scrambled Eggs With Kale And Parmesan
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a stick-free frying pan on medium high heat. When the oil is hot, add the chopped onion and red pepper flakes. Cook for one minute.
Add the thinly sliced kale to the pan, toss with the onions and olive oil. Cook for a few minutes, until the kale is just wilted.
Lower the heat to medium. Add the beaten eggs to the pan. Stir until the eggs begin to set. Stir in the cheese and Italian seasoning. Season with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and continue to stir a few times until the cheese is melted and the eggs are cooked. Serve immediately.

name: Scrambled Eggs With Mushrooms
instructions: Melt the butter in a non-stick pan over medium low heat.  Add the mushrooms and a pinch of salt.  Saute them untill they begin to turn golden brown.
Remove the mushrooms from the pan directly onto a serving plate.
Mix the egg, cream and oil together very well.  Pour the egg mixture into the pan and scramble the eggs.
Add the cooked eggs to the mushrooms and mix.

name: Scrambled Eggs With Salmon
instructions: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Mix the eggs lightly with a fork. Cook until just beginning to scramble.
Add the cream cheese and mix until everything is a smooth texture. Season and serve with salmon.

name: Seafood Paella
ingredientLines: 1 medium green bell pepper, deseeded and diced
1 medium red bell pepper, deseeded and diced
½ lb raw shrimp, shells on
instructions: Heat the oil in a paella pan or large skillet over medium heat and cook the onions for 3-4 minutes.
Add the bell peppers and garlic and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the rice and stir to coat each grain in oil.
Add wine and bring it to a boil for one minute. Add smoked paprika and salt, stir until completely combined and fragrant.
Spread the rice mixture into an even layer across the bottom of the pan. Add the chicken stock (do not stir the rice during next steps).
Tuck the clams into the rice hinge side down, distributing them evenly in the pan. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes, moving the pan around and rotating it so that the rice cooks evenly.
After 10 minutes have passed, lay the shrimp on top and continue cooking for 8 minutes more, turning the shrimp when they have become pink on the first side.
Add the mussels and cook, turning the pan every few minutes until the mussels have opened and the rice has formed a crispy crust on the bottom, about 5-10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and tent the pan with some aluminum foil for about 10 minutes. Remove the foil and serve immediately with fresh parsley and lemon wedges.

name: Seafood Pajeon
instructions: Combine the chopped seafood, pinch of salt and a pinch of ground black pepper in a small bowl. Mix it well and set aside.
Combine flour, starch, salt, and stock in a large enough to accommodate the green onions. Mix with a whisk until smooth.
Heat 2 tbsp of oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and swirl to coat evenly.
Add the green onions to the batter to coat them. Using tongs or your hand, place them side by side in the skillet.
Add the seafood to the leftover batter in the bowl. Using your hands or tongs, spread the battered seafood on top of the battered scallions, scraping out any excess batter remaining in the bowl.
Add the sliced chili and pour the beaten eggs over top of the pancake in the skillet.
Reduce the heat to medium and cook for about 6 minutes, until the bottom is light brown and crispy.
Lift one edge of the pancake, and cook on another side for 3 minutes.
Transfer to a large plate, with the egg and seafood side up.

name: Seafood Pasta
instructions: Bring salted water to a boil and add pasta. Cook for 10 minutes, until al dente and set aside.
In a large pan, add a splash of oil and allow to heat up. Season the seafood with salt and pepper then cook in batches until golden brown.

Remove the seafood from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, melt the butter and add the garlic and chilli flakes.
Cook until fragrant then pour in the lemon juice and wine. Bring to a simmer and allow to reduce by half.
Pour in the cream and allow to come to a simmer. Allow to cook for 5 minutes or until the sauce coats the back of a spoon.
Add the seafood and stir to combine. Toss the sauce with cooked pasta and a splash of the pasta cooking water and toss to coat the pasta.
Garnish with basil leaves and serve.

name: Seafood Salad
instructions: In a medium skillet cook shrimp and seafood, for about 5 minutes.
Mix together salad mix, cucumber, cherry tomatoes in a salad bowl. Season with olive oil, lemon juice and salt.
Put cooked seafood in a salad bowl and mix. Serve in bowls and garnish with some sesame seeds.

name: Seaweed Soup
instructions: Soak seaweed in water to cover. When soft, drain, and cut into 2 inch pieces.
Heat a saucepan over medium heat, add beef, sesame oil, 1/2 tablespoon soy sauce, and a little salt, and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in seaweed and remaining soy sauce, cook for 1 minute, stirring frequently.
Pour in 2 cups water, and bring to a boil. Stir in garlic and remaining water.
Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes. Season to taste with salt.

name: Sesame Chicken
instructions: Combine sesame oil, soy sauce, honey, sriracha, and vinegar in a large bowl.
Add chicken and stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat an air fryer to 400°F. Drain marinade from the chicken.
Place chicken thighs skin-side up in the basket of the air fryer. Cook for 5 minutes. Flip and cook an additional 10 minutes.
Transfer chicken to a plate and let rest 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with green onion and sesame seeds.

name: Sesame Chicken And Zucchini Stir-Fry
ingredientLines: 12 oz chicken breasts, cut into bit-sized pieces
instructions: Heat large skillet on medium heat. Add oil, then garlic. Cook garlic until translucent and fragrant, then add chicken.
Cook chicken for about 2 minutes, then add sesame seed oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar and oyster sauce.
Cook mixture for about another 5 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Add zucchini and cook until tender, about 2 minutes.
Before serving, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and ground black pepper.

name: Sesame Miso Roasted Potatoes
instructions: Add cubed potatoes to a bowl filled with cold water and soak. Preheat the air fryer to 375°F.
Drain soaked potatoes and pat each cube dry with a towel. Toss with oil and place in the air fryer basket. Cook for 20 minutes.
When the potatoes are about 5 minutes from being done, add the remaining ingredients to a saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium low heat.
Add potatoes and mix until the potatoes are evenly coated. Add potatoes back to air fryer basket and roast an additional 2 minutes.
Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and serve.

name: Sesame Seared Tuna
instructions: In a small bowl, stir together the soy sauce, mirin, and sesame oil. Divide into two equal parts. Stir the rice vinegar into one part and set aside as a dipping sauce.
Spread the sesame seeds out on a plate. Coat the tuna steaks with the remaining soy sauce mixture, then press into the sesame seeds to coat.
Heat olive oil in a cast iron skillet over high heat until very hot. Place steaks in the pan, and sear for about 30 seconds on each side.
Serve immediately, garnished with lemon slices.

name: Shandong Chinese Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and brush the foil with ghee.
In a medium bowl, mix together the vinegar, water, mayonnaise, horseradish, salt and pepper until well blended.
Coat each piece of chicken heavily with the sauce, and place onto the prepared baking sheet.
Bake, uncovered, for about 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Baste occasionally with remaining sauce.
Chicken is done when the juices run clear, and the meat is no longer pink. Top with sesame seeds and parsley.

name: Sheet-Pan Shrimp Fajitas
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Combine oil, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder and salt in a large bowl. Transfer 4 tsp of the mixture to a small bowl and set aside.
Add red, yellow and green bell peppers and onion to the large bowl; stir to combine. Spread the vegetables on a large baking sheet and roast for 13 minutes.
Meanwhile, add shrimp and the reserved chili mixture to the large bowl and toss to combine.
Once the vegetables have softened, remove from the oven and stir in the shrimp. Continue roasting for about 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.

name: Shrimp And Bacon Chowder
instructions: In a large pot, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon, let cool, and crumble.
Add onion to a pot with the bacon. Grease and cook until lightly sauteed. Add chicken stock, corn, heavy whipping cream, salt, and pepper,
Bring to a boil until mixture begins to thicken. Add shrimp and crumbled bacon.
Simmer until shrimp are pink and chowder is desired consistency. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with green onions.

name: Shrimp And Crab Chowder
instructions: Add the butter to the saucepan with all of the rough-cut vegetables and allow to cook until they begin to soften.
Add the flour to the vegetables and mix well, to make a roux, allow this to cook for at least 5 minutes to get rid of the raw flour taste.
Add the seafood stock and blend. Add heavy cream and season. Allow chowder to simmer 20 minutes.
Add the chopped shrimp pieces and allow to cook in the chowder for 3 minutes. Before serving add in crab meat.

name: Shrimp Cauliflower Fried Rice
ingredientLines: 3 oz red bell pepper. thinly sliced
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat 2 tsp of sesame oil in a large heavy skillet over high heat. Add eggs and cook, without stirring, until fully cooked on one side, about 30 seconds.
Flip and cook until just cooked through, about 15 seconds. Transfer to a cutting board and cut into ½-inch pieces.
Add 2 tsp of sesame oil to the pan and heat over high heat. Add cauliflower in an even layer. Cook, undisturbed, until lightly browned, 3 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Add 2 tsp of oil to the pan , heat over high heat. Add shrimp and cook, stirring often, until just opaque, about 3 minutes. Transfer to the plate with the cauliflower.
Add the remaining sesame oil to the pan and heat over high heat. Add bell pepper and garlic. Cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly charred, 4 minutes.
Stir in soy sauce, water, vinegar and pepper. Bring to a boil and boil for 30 seconds. Remove from the heat. Stir in the reserved eggs, cauliflower and shrimp.
Serve imemdiately.

name: Shrimp Ceviche
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add shrimp to boiling water and cook for 2 minutes, or until shrimp turn a light pink color and are cooked through.
Combine lime juice, lemon juice, olive oil, shrimp and salt in a large bowl. Marinade shrimps.
Mix vegetables in with the shrimp. Add cilantro and avocado, toss and serve.

name: Shrimp Cocktail
ingredientLines: 3/4 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Place clam juice and oregano in a saucepa, bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp and stir just until shrimp turn pink and are not quite cooked through, about 2 minutes.
Transfer shrimp to a bowl with a slotted spoon. Reserve liquid. Let shrimp cool to room temperature.
Place chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, celery, red onion, and jalapenos is a mixing bowl.
Add ketchup, cooking liquid from the shrimp, lime juice, cilantro, and hot sauce. Gently mix until ingredients are well blended.
Chop shrimp into bite-size pieces, leaving a few whole for garnishes. Stir chopped pieces into the vegetable mixture.
Wrap mixing bowl with plastic wrap. Place reserved shrimp in a bowl, wrap with plastic wrap.
Refrigerate shrimp cocktail and reserved shrimp until thoroughly chilled, 2 to 3 hours.
If mixture seems a bit thick, add a little tomato juice or pickle juice. Stir in avocado cubes.
Serve, if possible, in clear glass bowls. Top with reserved whole shrimp and some cilantro leaves.

name: Shrimp Fajitas
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Oil a rimmed baking sheet with 2 tbsp olive oil.
Combine shrimp, bell peppers,onion, remaining olive oil, chili powder, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and paprika in a large bow, toss to combine.
Spread mixture on the prepared pan evenly and cook in the preheated oven until shrimp are bright pink and firm, about 8 minutes.
Turn on the oven's broiler and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Squeeze lime juice over mixture.

name: Shrimp Pasta Salad
instructions: Cook the pasta in well salted water until al dente. Rinse the pasta in cold water to stop the cooking. Drain well and put into a large bowl.
On a medium pan fry shrimps for 3 minutes, until lightly crispy.
Add them to the bowl with the pasta and mix. Add the remaining ingredients and gently mix until well combined.

name: Shrimp Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta in lightly salted boiling water until al dente, according to package instructions. Drain. Set aside.
In a medium saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat until hot and rippling. Add the shrimp and season lightly with salt and pepper.
Cook for about a minute and flip or stir the shrimp and cook for another 30 seconds or so until the shrimp start to turn pink but don’t cook all the way.
Add broth, oregano, and sun-dried tomatoes and simmer for 3 minutes until the shrimp are cooked through.
Stir in pasta and pesto and toss until evenly combined. Season to taste with salt and pepper, if needed. Garnish with basil leaves and serve.

name: Shrimp Salad In Lettuce Wraps
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook the shrimp until just opaque throughout, about 3 minutes.
Drain and transfer to a bowl of ice water to cool. Roughly chop the shrimp.
In a medium bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, horseradish and black pepper.
Add the shrimp, scallions, celery, cucumber, and dill, and toss to combine. Spoon into the lettuce leaves and serve.

name: Shrimp Snack
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium.
Season the shrimp with salt, pepper, garlic, oregano, and paprika in a medium bowl. Toss to combine.
In a small bowl, combine the melted butter, garlic, lemon juice. Brush lemon butter sauce on both sides of shrimp, reserving some for later.
Grill for 3 minutes on each side and serve.

name: Shrimp Soup
instructions: Add chicken broth to a large soup pot and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to medium and add heavy whipping cream, butter, and cheese.
Reduce heat and prepare shrimp as directed in a separate pot. Once shrimp is cooked add to soup, season and serve.

name: Shrimp With Tomatoes And Feta
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
½ lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring, until starting to soften, about 2 minutes.
Add garlic, crushed red pepper, salt and pepper and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Stir in tomatoes and wine. Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring, until slightly reduced, about 3 minutes. Add shrimp and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with feta and basil. Serve immediately.

name: Sicilian Citrus Salad
ingredientLines: Freshly cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Peel the oranges and cut them into segments. Add them to a large mixing bowl. Add onion, radicchio, vinegar, olive oil. Savor with salt and pepper to taste and toss well to combine.
Add the chopped parsley, mix the salad again and serve.

name: Simple Baked Eggs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Whisk together eggs, milk, and heavy cream in a bowl until well combined.
Place 1/2 bacon into each prepared ramekin. Pour 1/2 egg mixture into each ramekin. Season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven until domed on top, golden, and baked through, about 25 minutes.
While eggs bake, toast bread slices in a toaster to desired doneness. Slice into thin strips; spread with butter. Serve with baked eggs.

name: Simple Mexican Rice
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, cook and stir until onion is translucent.
Stir in the chili powder and cumin, and cook for about 30 seconds.
Add the rice, chicken broth and tomato paste, and bring to a boil. Transfer to a 1 quart casserole dish, and cover with aluminum foil or a lid.
Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until liquid has been absorbed and rice is tender.

name: Simple Polenta
ingredientLines: Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: Place eggs in a medium pot and cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil, then cover the pot and turn the heat off.
Let the eggs cook, covered, for 9 to 12 minutes. Transfer the eggs to a bowl of ice water and chill for 14 minutes. Peel and cut the eggs in half
Cook the polenta in lightly salted water according to package instructions, adding the tablespoon of butter at the end and stirring well.
Divide the polenta between two bowls, add the greens, egg and cherry tomatoes, enjoy!

name: Simple Tuna Melt
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Place bread slices in the oven to toast while it preheats, and while you make the tuna salad.
In a small bowl, mix together the tuna, mayonnaise, salt, balsamic vinegar, mustard and dill pickle until well blended.
Remove bread from the oven, and pile the tuna mixture onto one slice. Sprinkle cheese over the other slice of bread.
Bake for 7 minutes in the preheated oven, or until cheese is melted and tuna is heated through.
Place the cheese side of the sandwich on top of the tuna side. Cut in half and serve immediately.

name: Singapore Mei Fun
instructions: Rinse the shrimp and pat dry. Make a thin omelet by cooking eggs in a hot oiled wok
Transfer to the cutting board and cut the omelet into thin strips about 2 to 3 inches long and set aside. Julienne the napa cabbage, carrot, and scallion.
Heat the wok on the highest setting and add oil, ham and shrimp and stir-fry for about 10 seconds.
Add the dried chili peppers, carrot, napa cabbage and onion and stir-fry for about 30 seconds.
Add the rice noodles, salt, and mix well. The noodles should be taking on the rich color of the curry powder.
Add the soy sauce, scallions and egg. Mix for another minute, and serve.

name: Slammin' Salmon
instructions: Stir balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, and soy sauce with salt, paprika, pepper, and red pepper flakes until the salt has dissolved.
Stir in garlic, green onions and peanut oil until well combined.
Pour marinade into a resealable plastic bag or glass bowl. Add salmon and pineapple to marinade and gently toss to coat. Place into refrigerator and marinate.
Prepare an outdoor grill for medium-high heat.
Drain excess marinade from salmon fillets and pineapple. Grill until firm and opaque, about 4 minutes per side.

name: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
instructions: Place beef stew meat and butter into the bottom of a slow cooker. Put onion, baby carrots, potatoes, and bay leaf atop the beef.
Stir tomato soup, water, steak sauce, and onion soup mix together in bowl, pour over the beef and vegetables in the slow cooker.
Sprinkle lemon pepper seasoning over the mixture. Cook on High - Medium 2 to 3 hours.

name: Slow Cooker Salisbury Steak
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, onion soup mix, bread crumbs, and milk using your hands. Shape into 3 patties.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dredge the patties in flour just to coat, and quickly brown on both sides in the hot skillet.
Place browned patties into the slow cooker stacking alternately like a pyramid.
In a medium bowl, mix together the cream of chicken soup, mushrooms and water.
Pour over the meat. Cook on the Medium setting for 1 1/2 or 2 hours, until ground beef is well done.
Cook the noodles in a pot water according to instructions on the packaging.

name: Slow Cooker Yellow Chicken Curry
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large slow cooker add coconut milk, broth (or water) peanut butter, soy sauce, garlic, and freshly grated ginger.
Whisk to combine, then stir in spices: curry powder, turmeric, pepper, and salt.
Add chicken breast to slow cooker followed by onions. Gently stir so that the sauce covers all of the chicken and vegetables.
Cook on high for 3-4 hours or on low for 6-7 hours. Remove chicken with a slotted spoon and shred with two forks.
Add shredded chicken back to slow cooker.
Before you’re ready to serve, stir in julienned red bell peppers and peas, cover, and cook on high for another 10-20 minutes until bell peppers have tenderized a bit.
Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Serve as is with a side of rice.

name: Smashed Cucumbers
instructions: In a small pot, heat olive oil until starting to smoke, then remove from heat. Meanwhile, in a medium jar, whisk ginger, garlic, chilis, sesame seeds and some salt.
Slowly pour hot oil over the spices, letting it sizzle through evenly, streaming gradually and carefully to control the overflow. Whisk and let cool.
Use the flat size of your knife to smash each piece of cucumber.
In a large bowl, toss smashed cucumbers with chili oil, sesame oil and season with some salt. Serve immediately.

name: Smoked Salmon Pasta
ingredientLines: 1/3 lb smoked salmon, cut into bite sized pieces
instructions: In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain, reserving ½ cup pasta water, and return to pot.
In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and broccoli and cook until soft, 5 minutes, then add garlic and cook until fragrant, 1 minute more.
Add wine and cook until almost completely reduced, 5 minutes. Add heavy cream, lemon juice and flaxseed oil and cook until thickened, another 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Add salmon and cook until salmon is warmed through, 2 minutes, then toss sauce and pasta together. Add ¼ cup pasta water if sauce is too thick.

name: Smoked Salmon Pate
instructions: Add the roughly chopped salmon to a bowl, add the cream cheese, shallot and dill. Mix well to combine.
Spread on a slices of bread and serve.

name: Smoked Salmon Spread
instructions: Process cream cheese in a food processor to soften completely. Add salmon, capers, dill, cream, and lemon juice. Process the mixture again until creamy.

name: Smoked Salmon Sushi Roll
ingredientLines: 4 oz smoked salmon, sliced into strips
instructions: Soak rice for 4 hours. Drain rice and cook in a rice cooker with 2 cups of water. Rice must be slightly dry as vinegar will be added later.
Immediately after rice is cooked, mix in 6 tablespoons rice vinegar to the hot rice. Spread rice on a plate until completely cool.
Place 1 sheet of seaweed on bamboo mat, press a thin layer of cool rice on the seaweed.
Leave at least 1/2 inch top and bottom edge of the seaweed uncovered. This is for easier sealing later. Dot some wasabi on the rice.
Arrange cucumber, avocado and smoked salmon to the rice. Position them about 1 inch away from the bottom edge of the seaweed.
Slightly wet the top edge of the seaweed. Roll from bottom to the top edge with the help of the bamboo mat tightly.
Cut roll into 8 equal pieces and serve. Repeat for other rolls.

name: Sopa De Ajo
instructions: Place bacon on preheaed pan and cook until crispy, for 5 minutes.
Heat the oil in a large pot over a medium-low heat. Add the sliced garlic and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes. Then stir paprika.
Add the bread and cook, stirring, until lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the stock and 2 cups of water and bring nearly to the boil. Then reduce the heat to simmer.
Crack an egg into a small dish, make a small indentation in the soup and pour in the egg. Repeat with remaining eggs. Cover and cook 3 minutes.
Garnish with crispy bacon and serve.

name: Sopa De Fideo
instructions: Combine 1/2 cup chicken stock, tomatoes, onion, serrano chile, and garlic in a blender.
Blend until smooth. Strain tomato sauce into a bowl and reserve.
Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add pasta, cook, stirring constantly, until lightly browned, about 4 minutes.
Pour tomato sauce into the saucepan over the noodles; add parsley and remaining chicken stock. Season with salt.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until noodles are soft, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with Cotija cheese.

name: Sopa De Tortilla
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add tortilla strips in batches and fry until brown and crispy, 2 to 3 minutes per batch.
Fry pasilla chiles in the same pan, being careful not to burn them, until browned, about 2 minutes. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.
Combine 1 fried pasilla pepper, tomatoes, onion, garlic, and oregano in a blender, blend until smooth. Strain through a sieve into a bowl.
Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add tomato mixture and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Stir in chicken granules and parsley.
Cover and simmer over low heat for about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and discard parsley.
Divide fried tortilla strips among 4 bowls. Pour soup on top of tortilla strips and garnish with diced avocado and cotija cheese.
Cut remaining fried pasilla peppers into thin strips and sprinkle over soup. Add Mexican crema to each bowl.

name: Soup With Chicken And Gnocchi
instructions: Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of a large pot, then season them lightly with salt and pepper. Cover the chicken with 1 inch of water.
Cook chicken for 10 minutes and shred them into small pieces.
Add the butter, olive oil, carrot and minced garlic to a large skillet and cook over low heat for 3 minutes until the garlic is soft but not colored.
Add in the Italian seasoning and flour, stirring well. Slowly pour in the chicken broth and whisk to combine with the flour. Simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Once simmered add in the shredded chicken, cream, and grated Parmesan. Allow the mixture to simmer over low heat.
Bring a large pan of water to a boil. Once boiling, add 1 tablespoon of salt and then the gnocchi. Cook until the gnocchi floats to the top then drain.
Add the drained gnocchi to the sauce, season with salt and pepper and taste.
Finally, stir through the spinach and let it wilt in the hot sauce. Serve with extra Parmesan and black pepper.

name: Sour Chicken Soup With Garlic And Cream
ingredientLines: ½ lb boneless, skinless chicken breast
Fresh cracked black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a soup pot, add 12 ½ oz of water and the chicken parts.
Boil for at least 1 hour, skimming the foam each time it rises to the surface. Add the carrots, celery root, parsnip, onion, and boil for 30-45 minutes, or until the vegetables are cooked.
Remove the vegetables and the meat from the pot. Discard the onion and the parsnip.
Shred the carrots and the celery root with a grater, and chop the chicken meat into pieces. Put the vegetables and meat back in the pot.
Put 2 ladles of soup in a bowl and let them cool for 2-3 minutes.
In another bowl, beat the egg yolks and mix with the sour cream. Press the garlic and add it to the cream mixture.
Gradually add the 2 ladles of soup and whisk well. This will help temper the sour cream mixture, so that it won’t curdle.
Add the lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste, and let the soup boil for another 5 minutes.
Turn off the heat, then add the sour cream mixture while stirring continuously with a whisk.

name: Southern Potato Salad
instructions: Place potatoes in a large pot and add water to cover by at least 2”. Add 1 tsp salt and bring to a boil, then reduce to medium-low and simmer 8 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the potatoes to a colander set over a bowl. While the potatoes cool, return the water to a boil.
Lower the eggs into the boiling water and boil over medium heat until just hard boiled, about 10 minutes. While potatoes are cooking, prepare an ice bath.
Transfer the hard-boiled eggs to the ice bath to cool. Peel, then dice eggs into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard, pickle juice, and cayenne until smooth. Add the pickles, onion, celery, potatoes, and eggs.
Season with salt and fold to combine. Season with more salt and pepper to taste. Serve sprinkled with chives.

name: Soya Pulao
instructions: Cook the soy chunks in salted hot water until they double in volume, drain, squeeze out the excess water, and keep aside.
In a medium skillet bring water to a boil. Cook rice according to a package instructions. Fluff with a fork, and set aside.
Heat enough oil and add the chopped onions and saute until they turn translucent.
Add peas, sweet corn and soya chunks to the onions, and saute for a few minutes.
Now add the garam masala powder, pepper powder, and soya sauce.
Cook on a high flame until the vegetables are half cooked. Add cooked rice.
Toss gently until the vegetables and rice are well mixed.

name: Spaghetti Aglio E Olio
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, about 12 minutes. Drain and transfer to a pasta bowl.
Combine garlic and olive oil in a cold skillet. Cook over medium heat to slowly toast garlic, about 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to medium-low when olive oil begins to bubble. Cook and stir until garlic is golden brown, about another 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Stir red pepper flakes, black pepper, and salt into the pasta. .
Pour in olive oil and garlic, and sprinkle on Italian parsley and half of the cheese, stir until combined
Serve pasta topped with the remaining cheese.

name: Spaghetti Squash Primavera
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Poke about 10 holes into spaghetti squash, place in a baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until spaghetti squash is softened and partially cooked, about 25 minutes.
Remove from oven, cool until easily handled. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F.
Cut spaghetti squash in half and seed. Pull the squash flesh from the peel with a fork.
Heat oil in a braising pan over medium-high heat. Add zucchini, salt, and pepper, nutritional yeast, cook and stir until softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add bell pepper, onion, and garlic, cook and stir until flavors combine, about 3 minutes.
Stir in green beans, cook until bright green, about 2 minutes.
Stir diced tomatoes and Italian seasoning into the pan, simmer until tomatoes are warm, about 5 minutes.
Add spaghetti squash, toss until combined and top with cheese. Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until spaghetti squash is tender, about 10 minutes.

name: Spaghetti With Clam Sauce
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Combine clams with juice, butter, oil, minced garlic, parsley, and basil in a large saucepan. Place over medium heat until boiling. Serve warm over pasta.

name: Spaghetti With Mussels
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water for 10 minutes or until al dente.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a pan, add the garlic, plus the chilli if using, and cook for 2 minutes until aromatic
Add white wine and bring to a boil. Tip in the mussels, reduce the heat to medium and cover the pan. Cook for 5 minutes.
Drain the pasta, reserving a cupful of the starchy cooking water. Toss the pasta and the butter through mussel sauce.
Add a squeeze of lemon, spinach, and check the seasoning then divide between 2 warmed bowls and serve immediately.

name: Spaghetti With Sun-Dried-Tomato-Flax Pesto
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a food processor, pulse the tomatoes, almonds and garlic. Add the half of the oil and puree. Season with salt and pepper.
In a skillet, toast the bread crumbs in the remaining oil, stirring, until golden. Transfer the crumbs to a plate, season with salt and pepper.
In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the pasta until al dente. Drain, reserving ½ cup of the cooking liquid.
In the pot, toss the pasta with the pesto and reserved cooking water until the sauce clings to the pasta.
Transfer the pasta to bowls, sprinkle with the bread crumbs and parsley and drizzle with olive oil. Serve immediately.

name: Spanish Cod Tomato Sauce
instructions: Place the flour on a plate and toss the pieces of cod in it. Set aside.
Heat a nonstick frying pan on medium-high heat and add the olive oil.
Add the cod pieces and fry them 3 minutes on each side. Transfer them into a separate dish and set them aside.
Add the diced onions and garlic and mix them with the oil.
Add the potatoes, red bell pepper and cook together for about 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper to your taste and the smoked or regular paprika.
Add the can of tomatoes, olives, and bay leaf and mix together until well combined.
Reduce the heat to low and simmer the sauce until the peppers are cooked, about 5 minutes.
Return the cod to the pan and allow the sauce and fish to simmer together for 2 more minutes. Taste the sauce for salt and pepper.

name: Spanish Garlic Shrimp
instructions: Pat dry the shrimp and season with salt. Add sliced garlic and oil in a skillet and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes.
Bring the heat to medium high and add in shrimp. Saute for 3 minutes. Season with red chili flakes and salt. Give it a toss for a minute.
Stir in dry sherry and chopped parsley. Cook for a couple of minutes. Taste and adjust for seasoning. Serve immediately.

name: Spanish Omelette
instructions: In a pan heat oil and add onion and potatoes. Cook without browning, for a couple of minutes, then the add bell pepper and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the eggs and vegetables to a large bowl and mix well.
Add 2 tablespoons of the drained oil back into the same pan and return to medium heat.
When the oil is hot, carefully pour the egg/potato mix into the pan and smooth into an even layer. Season.
Cover with a lid, this will help it cook faster. Cook for, 10 minutes, and serve.

name: Spanish Tortilla With Chorizo And Peppers
instructions: Preheat oven to 390°F.
In a saucepan place potatoes with enough water to cover and add 1 tsp salt. Heat to boiling on high. Simmer until tender, and drain.
In a skillet heat 1 tbsp olive oil. Add onion, pepper, and garlic, and cook 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender and golden, stirring occasionally.
In large bowl, with fork, mix eggs, and chorizo until well blended. Gently stir in potatoes and onion mixture.
In same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil on medium. Pour in egg mixture and place in oven. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: Spatchock Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Place an oven-safe rack over a baking sheet.
Place the chicken onto a cutting board, breast side down. Use kitchen shears to cut away the spine.

Use your hands to open up the chicken like a book, then flip it over, open side down. Use the heel of your hand to push down on the chicken breast, which will crush the breast bone and allow the chicken to lay flat.
Transfer the butterflied chicken to the rack over the baking sheet.
Mash together butter, parsley, Italian seasoning, and crushed garlic. Place dollops of compound butter all over underneath the skin and then press down over the skin.
Drizzle olive oil over the chicken, over the skin. Sprinkle with sea salt, paprika, and black pepper.
Roast together with carrots and potatoes. Bake for 35 minutes, garnish with parsley and orange.

name: Speedy Mussel Spaghetti
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in salted boiling water for 10 minutes or until al dente.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a pan, add the garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Add the parsley and white wine. Bring to the boil and bubble vigorously for 2 minutes, or until most of the liquid has evaporated.
Tip in the mussels and spinach reduce the heat and cover the pan. Cook for 5 minutes until heated through, giving the pan an occasional shake.
Drain the pasta, reserving a cupful of the starchy cooking water. Toss the pasta and the butter through the mussel sauce, adding a little of the pasta water.
Add a squeeze of lemon and garnish with Parmesan.

name: Spicy Baked Pasta
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Tip the farfalle into a pan of boiling, salted water, stir once, then cook for 10 minutes until 'al dente' or according to packet instructions.
Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a saute pan and fry the bacon for a couple of minutes until crispy.
Add the onion and cook for another minute or two until softened, stirring occasionally.
Add the garlic with paprika and chilli and cook for about 30 seconds, stirring. Stir in the passata and cook for 2 minutes until heated through.
When the pasta is cooked, drain well and then return to the pan.
Pour in the tomato mixture, then fold everything together until well combined. Bake for 5 minutes and garnish with some grated Parmesan.

name: Spicy Chile Chicken Fritters
ingredientLines: 1 lb skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cubed
instructions: Place 1/3 of the chicken pieces into the bowl of a food processor and pulse several times, cutting the chicken into smaller pieces.
Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Repeat twice more with remaining chicken pieces.
Add eggs, Hatch chiles, onion, almond flour, mayonnaise, garlic, chili powder, chipotle powder, salt, pepper, and cumin to the chicken.
Stir until combined. Stir in wing sauce.
Place a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Fill hot skillet with 1/4 inch olive oil, heat until shimmering.
Use a 1/4 cup measure to drop 6 mounds of chicken mixture into the hot oil. Gently press each one into a 3-inch fritter.
Cook until chicken is no longer pink and tops are browned, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Transfer fritters to a paper towel-lined plate.

name: Spicy Chinese Mustard Green Beans
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add green beans and cook uncovered until bright green, about 3 minutes.
Drain in a colander and immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes to stop the cooking process. Drain and transfer to a large bowl.
Mix mustard powder and cold water together in a small bowl to make a paste. Stir in vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, sesame seeds and salt.
Pour mustard paste mixture over green beans, toss to coat.

name: Spicy Garlic Salmon
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a medium baking dish with aluminum foil. Lightly grease foil.
With a mortar and pestle, grind together the garlic, chile pepper, and olive oil.
Mix into a thick paste with the mustard, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Place the salmon fillets in the prepared baking dish, and coat with the paste mixture.
Bake salmon 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until fish is easily flaked with a fork.

name: Spicy Halibut Tomato Soup
instructions: In a large stockpot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and half of the parsley, reserving the remainder for garnish.
Mix in tomatoes, anchovies, vegetable broth, salt, pepper, and red chili flakes.
Increase heat to high and bring the pot to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover the pot, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Remove lid and add halibut. Replace cover and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and break down halibut into small pieces. Mix to evenly distribute the fish and serve garnished with the remaining fresh parsley.

name: Spicy Hot Pepper Salmon
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray.
Cook the rice in a pot of water accoriding to the instructions on the packaging.
Mix1 teaspoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon lime juice, and 1/2 teaspoon chipotle powder in a large bowl.
Cover the bottom of the baking dish with the mixture and set aside.
Mix tomatoes, red onion, jalapeno peppers, habanero peppers, remaining lemon juice, remaining lime juice, and remaining chipotle powder together in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly.
Place salmon fillets on top of spinach in the baking dish and top with tomato mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 14 minutes.

name: Spicy Korean Chicken
instructions: Combine soy sauce, vegetable oil, chile paste, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and red chile flakes in a large bowl.
Whisk to completely dissolve chile paste. Add chicken and stir to coat.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 30 minutes and up to 2 hours.
Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Grill the chicken until slightly charred and no longer pink in the center, 5 to 8 minutes per side.

name: Spicy Korean Ribs
instructions: Remove membrane from back of ribs or score with a sharp knife. Place ribs in a shallow dish and season with salt and pepper.
Puree onion in a blender or food processor. Add kochujang, vinegar, garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce, and minced ginger, puree into a sauce.
Rub 1/3 generously over ribs, reserving the rest of the sauce. Cover ribs with plastic wrap and refrigerate 5 hours to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Scatter sliced ginger root over the bottom of a roasting pan. Place ribs meat-side down on top of ginger slices and pour lager over ribs. Cover with a lid or aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until meat is loosened from the ribs but not yet falling off the bone, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Let cool, 5 to 10 minutes.
Preheat an outdoor grill and lightly oil the grate. Place ribs on the grill and cook until browned, about 6 minutes per side.
Coat with 1/2 the reserved sauce during the last 2 minutes of cooking each side. Garnish with white and black sesame seeds.

name: Spicy Lamb Skewers
instructions: Thread a portion of the lamb pieces onto a flat kebab skewer. Repeat with remaining lamb and skewers.
Preheat a grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
Place skewers on the grill. Cook, turning often and sprinkling with cumin, red pepper flakes, and salt, until nicely browned, 6 minutes.

name: Spicy Lime Grilled Shrimp
instructions: Cook the rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Meanwhile mix together the Cajun seasoning, lime juice and olive oil. Add the shrimp, coat with the marinade. Marinate in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.
Preheat a skillet on medium heat, and lightly oil. Remove the shrimp from the marinade, and shake off excess. Discard the remaining marinade.
Cook the shrimp until they are bright pink on the outside and the meat is no longer transparent in the center, about 2 minutes per side.

name: Spicy Rice
instructions: Bring water to a boil. Cook rice according to package directions, fluff with a fork, and set aside.
Add 1 tbsp oil to wok and increase heat to high. Add carrots and stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Stir in garlic and ginger. Add beef and cook until browned, 5 minutes,
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil. Stir in rice until heated through. Garnish with some parsley and serve.

name: Spicy Salmon Salad Sandwiches
instructions: Put salmon into a bowl and use a fork to flake and mix with the liquid from the can. Mix cucumber and capers with the salmon.
Stir mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, chile paste, and reserved liquid from the capers together in a bowl, add Sriracha hot sauce and adjust to taste.
Pour mayonnaise mixture over the salmon mixture and stir to coat. Spoon onto toasted bread to make sandwiches, add tomato and lettuce.

name: Spicy Tomato Soup
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
When hot, add the onion and garlic cloves, cooking until transparent, about 5 minutes.
Add the tomato puree and broth. Season with salt, pepper, red pepper flakes and chili sauce. Stir and bring to a boil.
Remove from heat, and transfer to a blender. Blend the ingredients together until smooth.
Spoon out the soup into bowls. Garnish with some chili sauce, cooking cream and basil leaves.

name: Spicy-Sweet Glazed Salmon
instructions: Place salmon in a shallow, flat dish, and set aside.
Combine the vinegar, olive oil, soy sauce, water, lemon juice, red pepper flakes, onion powder, garlic powder and brown sugar in a blender.
Blend until brown sugar dissolves. Pour the marinade over the salmon to cover evenly. Cover the dish, and refrigerate at least 2 hours.
Cook the beans and carrots for 8 to 12 minutes in a pot of water.
Line a broiling pan with foil. Remove salmon from marinade, and place on prepared broiling pan, season to taste with salt and pepper.
Transfer remaining marinade to a saucepan. Turn on broiler to low.
Broil salmon about 6 inches from the heat for 5 minutes, brush with remaining marinade.
Broil an additional 5 to 10 minutes, brushing 2 or 3 more times with additional marinade.
Salmon is done when fish is no longer bright red and can be flaked with a fork.
Meanwhile, cook the remaining marinade over low heat until it thickens and reduces by one-third, 5 to 10 minutes.
Use cooked marinade as a dipping sauce or drizzle over salmon just before serving.

name: Spinach And Cheese Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix the flour, cheddar and baking powder together.
Whisk the eggs, and add the salt to the eggs, then add to the flour bowl. Add the melted butter to the flour bowl. Combine.
Add the milk and mix well. Stir in the crumbled feta. Stir in the chopped spinach
Spoon the mixture into your muffin tin, or into muffin cases. Throw a little extra cheddar on top of the muffins.
Bake for 20 minutes. Take out of the oven when the muffin tops are golden brown and cooked through.

name: Spinach And Chickpeas
instructions: Cook bacon in a skillet until browned. Set aside.
In a skillet add 2 tbsp olive oil, chickpeas, and red pepper flakes. Saute for 5 minutes.
Stir in spinach and garlic and saute, stirring, until spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper and top with bacon.

name: Spinach Fettucine
instructions: Add some oil into pan and pan-fry the asparagus, for 2 minutes.
In a large pot, heat some oil and saute the onion for 3 minutes until it becomes translucent. Then add the garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the uncoooked pasta, the vegetable broth, and the lemon juice. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir a couple of times while cooking.
When the pasta is al dente, stir in the lemon zest and the cooked asparagus. Cook for 2 more minutes and season with salt, pepper.

name: Spinach Parmesan Orzo
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Heat the oil in a pot over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add the onion and saute until softened and fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Add the garlic and orzo, season with salt and pepper, and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Stir in the broth and milk and bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce to a simmer, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the orzo is al dente and most of the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the spinach and Parmesan until the spinach has just wilted and the cheese melts, about 1 minute.
Taste and season with salt and pepper as needed. Garnish with additional cheese and bake for 5 more minutes in an oven.

name: Spinach Salad With Berries And Goar Cheese
instructions: Divide spinach amongst 2 plates. Top each plate with half of the strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries.
Sprinkle with goat cheese and sliced almonds, adjusting quantities if needed to your tastes and preferences.
Drizzle salad with vinaigrette to serve.

name: Spinach Smoothie With Mango And Coconut
ingredientLines: 1 oz unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender and puree until smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Spinach-Artichoke Mac And Cheese
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.
In a large pan, melt the butter. Add garlic, and spinach cooking until spinach is wilted. Add artichoke hearts. Add the milk, salt, and pepper. Stir until milk is boiling.
Add the macaroni, cooking until the milk coats the macaroni like a glaze. Add cheddar and half of the mozzarella, stirring until the cheese is melted.
Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella on top. Bake for 7 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Spinach-Artichoke Penne
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add spinach, cooking until wilted, then add artichoke hearts, cooking for 1 minute.
Add cream cheese until melted, stirring until there are no lumps. Sprinkle in garlic powder, salt, pepper, and milk, stirring until smooth.
Add pasta and mix until pasta is evenly coated. Serve immediately.

name: Spinach-Stuffed Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Place the chicken breasts on a cutting board and drizzle with oil. Add the paprika, salt, garlic powder, onion powder to a small bowl and stir to combine.

Sprinkle evenly over both sides of the chicken. 
Use a sharp knife to cut a pocket into the side of each chicken breast. Set chicken aside.
Add cream cheese, spinach, garlic, and remaining salt to a small mixing bowl and stir well to combine.
Spoon the spinach mixture into each chicken breast evenly. Place on a baking dish with brussels sprouts and bake for 25 minutes.

name: Split Pea And Sausage Soup
ingredientLines: 5 oz smoked kielbasa, cut into pieces
instructions: Place all the ingredients into stockpot with 3 cups of water and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover and simmer for about 40 minutes. Remove bay leaves and serve.

name: Spring Frittata
ingredientLines: 6 oz asparagus, trimmed and cut into pieces
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the leek and saute for 3 minutes.
Then add the asparagus and saute another 2 minutes. Then add the frozen peas, carots, potatoes, salt and pepper, and saute another minute.
In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, yogurt, salt and pepper. Pour the eggs over the half of the vegetables in the pan. Cook on the stove for 3 minutes.
Add the remaining vegetables on top, then dollop with the cheese. Transfer to the oven and cook for 15 minutes.
Garnish with dill before serving.

name: Squash Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Place squash and onion in a large skillet over medium heat. Pour in water.
Cover, and cook until squash is tender, about 5 minutes. Drain well, and place in a large bowl.
Mix cracker crumbs and cheese together in a medium bowl. Stir half of the cracker mixture into the cooked squash and onions.
Mix eggs and milk together in a small bowl, then add to squash mixture.
Stir in 1/4 cup melted butter, and season with salt and pepper. Spread into the prepared baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining cracker mixture, and dot with ghee.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes.

name: Squash Lasagna
